review: The best hardcore survival game I've ever played. Full of drama often the good kind. Probably best to play with 2+ people as it can get really frustrating solo. Not that solo isn't super fun but starting with a group is the nicest way to learn the game. The game has official servers and community ones official ones are all well maintained and great. Game is still being updated like crazy too with big features every other patch. If you like longterm world persistence this game isn't for you (in its current state). 99% of servers completely wipe once a week or once a month to keep the server from being overrun with houses/max geared characters. The game is also very skill based so if you like RPG style/level based gameplay then Rust probably won't be your cup of tea.Other than that if you can accept a medium to high learning curve and hardcore experience this game is quite awesome! And if you have friends to play with already the game can be great even if your a more casual player as it has a lot of different activities (gathering building sorting scouting/exploring manipulating/befriending your neighbors) that aren't PVP based. Good luck and if you happen across me in a server... visit my shop! D

review: Rust is a game about human nature. If you aren't fully convinced that humans are evil (or naturally inclined to be mean/awful/rude/selfish towards other humans) then you will be after playing this game. This video game encourages others to murder steal and then brag about it. The community (or lack thereof) in this game is toxic and will eventually be the downfall of this awful game. I enjoyed the minecraft aspect of the game and the graphics but the players ruined it for me. Everyone kills you on sight and takes all of your stuff back to square one. This is a common problem in survival/pvp/sandbox games. Why is that? Why is this a common problem? Because humans are evil and they dispaly their cruel evil nature when let loose on video games on the internet. Dare to mention anyone's profane and immoral speech or behavior (for which they would either be institutionalized or imprisoned in real life) and you will be ridiculed mocked etc. There are very few mature adults or people with a conscience playing this game. As western society abandons its Judeo Christian history a subjective view of morality rises to the forefront. What's right for you is right for you and what's right for me is right for me? Sounds good doesn't it? What if my right tells me its ok to murder you and take what you have worked for? Is it right then? No it's wrong and will always be wrong. And whether you are doing it in real life your mind or a video game it is still wrong. The developers of this game have gone out of their way to make the death experience as realistic as possible the sounds of a human screaming for his life and bleeding out are trutly reprehensible and blurrs the lines between fantasy and reality. The people who made this game should be ashamed of themselves. The truly scary part?This is what life would really be like without laws prisons courts civil authorities etc. The human is by nature evil and must be restrained. This is an awful game and if you care at all about your soul you should avoid it.UPDATE So I've sank another what...6 months into this game? Yeah something kept drawing me back although I knew better. I'm leaving Rust for good. Jesus said it best The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy I have come that they may have life and have it to the full. (John 10 11)Rust is a game about thieving murdering and destroying. It glorifies sin and I am ashamed I have sank so many hours into this worthless game.

review: RUSTDo I have a lot to say for this game. Lets begin with a summary of what my review is going to include I will be covering 5 aspects of this game and ratting them on a scale of 0 5. Closer to the end of my review I will include my personal opinion what made me buy this game and what I dislike about it and what I want in the game to be added.GRAPHICS 4/5The graphics of this game are quite georgous. From the reflections of the water to most of the textures this game is with no question one of the best looking games I played. Now some people will say I am over exadurating but I'm really not. The look of this game will appeal to most people who have played First Person games before. Using a 1050ti I was able to put this game on the highest settings and run it at around 60 fps most of the time.Here are my specs I5 6600k 3.5 GHzMSI GTX 1050 TI16 Gigabytes Of DDR4SERVERS 5/5 This all depends on where you live but I had no trouble what so ever finding a server. I never experienced any server lag while playing on this game. But do take this with a grain of salt because not all servers are official servers and it will always depend on your Internet connection. There are many different types of servers to choose from there are free for all servers where you can spawn in with a few weapons and instantly jump into a fight. These can get quite chaotic but some people will enjoy this madness. There are also servers that split people into 2 teams sending them to fight each other until either team is killed. And there are tons of regular rust servers you spawn in gather supplies build a base and etc. But to sum it up for most people there is always something to do.GAMEPLAY 2/5Gun shots everywhere arrows flying explosions roaring. This is what you might imagine Rust to be like and so did I. But most of the time I ended up being killed by someone hitting me to death with a rock or just being killed with a spier. This might not be the case for everyone if you have maybe ten friends or more you can build a base in a few hours and there are no worries if you die because you can just run back and pickup some extra loot that you have stored. When your ready to fight or your friends are you would search for a base near you and raid the loot thats left in hope of getting something good. But when you and your friends wake up the next morning and jump on Rust to find that your base has been raided it's not a pleasant experience. But playing this game alone is painfuly hard there will always be people who will troll you trick you or just try hard in general. And most of the time I spent in this game was looking at the beach where I spawned.COMMUNITY 2/5Piggybacking off of my last aspect this one is almost as equally bad. Now don't get offended for reading this because it's not you that I'm talking about it's the people who have given me this experience. One word can sum up the people I have met TOXIC. I have only been able to properly talk and maybe friend one person while playing this game (hats off to you.) Everyone that I have attempted to befriend try to talk to or get to know has back stabbed me or trolled me. There are a lot of games that I have started to play and enjoy just because of how friendly people were. But whenever I was in a server and needed help with controls or basics of the game someone would either say KYS or laugh. Only %10 of the time I got a legit response which is quite sad because some of you need to grow up. Maybe if more people tried to be inviting to new players or at least nice I would have enjoyed the game a little more. DEVELOPMENT 3.75/5I would have given a higher score but there is one thing that bothers me the most Early Access. I can not explain to you enough how long this game has not been officially published. And don't get me started on the amount of glitches this game has it's mind blowing really. I see a few patches coming out here and there every once in a while which I'm fine with and I support beIause it shows that the developers did not completely run off with my money and still support the game. So why did I buy this game in the first place? A few reasons actually I was about to build my PC and move on from my laptop so I wanted something to play when I finished so I picked this up and GTA V. But what really made me want to get the game were the insane youtube videos of people building huge hotels mansions and bases. The insane and intensive raids and also the funny moments. It looked fun until I got the game and realised the amount of grinding I needed to do to achieve that. And the toxicty brought me to the last straw making me write this review. So don't think you will be able to achieve all of that maybe with some help of friends you will be able to do it. But if you do decide on achieving these things good luck getting sleep. What I would have liked to be added into this game is a single player mode with more enemies maybe NPCs that would try to go after you and kill you. Maybe something thats a less pain in the My final score for this game is 12.75/20 giving it a %63.75 percent.But the final question should you buy this game? Do you love being a ? Are you up to face the grindiest game of them all? Then this game is for you. But on a serious note if you think you might enjoy this game pick it up on sale for $10. You might enjoy it more than I did.Thanks for reading!

Check out the rust wiki before playing !

review: Rust is a good game many people have come and gone in and out of the community but I have chose to go on. I joined Rust in its early experimental stages when it had just left legacy this was the prime moments of the game since it had just stepped into a new era. Since then the developers have constantly been adding fresh game changing updates that really make the game fun and enjoyable some people have left for these changes since they may have felt it was to drastic of a change. I ask that you keep in mind that this game isn't for everyone but if you keep an open mind and are ready to get raided and lose everything more than once you will learn to love it like I do.

review: I have to sadly say this game is going the wrong way....When i first bought the game way back in bp days i was loving it then they switched to the god awful xp system BTW was god awful. After a while of constant negative reviews they did components which i was loving but then they changed it AGAIN for no reason. now you cant even start off the wipe doing anything because you are forced to find scrap and just to make a ing work bench to get a waterpipe but thats not even near all of it. you then have the ass tiers to the work benches that cost an insane amount of scrap to make like for real 1500 scrap for a ing tier 3 bench and then 75 per research??? thats complete bull you cant even build a proper base because now literally ing everything is a blueprint like for real the ing hoodie is a bp and so is the god damn pants. Also might i mention that now it just seems that the game is only supporting clans because of the amount of work it takes for everything and as soon as the wipe starts clans already have a monster base when you are sitting there in a 2x2. last but not least even once you have finally crafted the damn bp you then need to get the components to make it.SO IN ALL this game is turning for the worst. it will always have a place in my heart because the few good things i can say about it is that it is something that used to not get boring ( i saw used to because now the game is a pile of the old pvp experiences and the raiding and having to learn the hard way through things and getting better through you mistakes is one hell of a ride and was very fun. if theres one final thing i can ask for is bring back the old rust or normal components.PLZ DONT BUY UNTIL THEY FIX THE GAME NEW COMERS WILL HATE IT!!!

review: Rust is basically if Minecraft and Fallout ed and this was their offspring.If you are looking at this game you have probably already seen some of the countless gameplay videos the YouTubers who have essentially made their career off of playing this game and if you are interested in the survival genre you have probably seen at least one or two other games compared to Rust. I think it has earned its place as the standard for a survival game. I started playing Rust in December of 2015 and boy has this game gone through changes. Not every patch has knocked it out of the park. The leveling system was an interesting take but definitely not a winner as it really made things more difficult for solo players just starting out. Here's the important take away that I learned from this blunder though they realized it didn't work and fixed it. This is a development team that absolutely wants to deliver the best product they can and they really do actively listen to their community. Although it is early access this game is entirely playable and has been for quite some time.So let's dig into it shall we?The Good This game looks sounds and even SMELLS beautiful. Don't ask how I know that I can just tell ok? I've definitely caught myself sitting on a mountain looking out to a stunning sunset on a few occasions. The Dev team as someone who has been burned by early access a few times I really do trust this dev team. They really do seem to care about this game and they want to do it right. I really think they could release the game right now and still beat out a lot of major releases but no they want to really get this one right. The gameplay is solid couple hiccups here and there sure. But for the most part the gameplay feels complete and whole. From epic gun battles that can go on for literally days in game loud cracks and booms can be heard from miles throughout the map and really gives you a sense that the island you are on is alive. The crafting I don't think any other game has done it as well as this game has. One of the reasons I didn't care for Hurtworld was that the crafting was entirely linear. It felt like you basically had to just go through the motions of crafting your needed gear. This is not the case in Rust there are so many things you can make in Rust and each has their own purpose that I find myself changing the order of what I craft changing often. It really comes down to what you need immediately in Rust. Some of the crafting in Rust is almost done for ease or comfort not even survival. It really allows for you to see the difference between when you were surviving and when you are thriving it's almost 2 games in one. The time when you crawl from the beach with just your trusty rock sure you fought your way through the masses you dodged arrows and gunfire to be where you finally are your own base maybe even your own store that you built with your own hands. Creating anything in this game just feels like it means so much more to you.The Bad The game is not finished. As I mentioned there are little hiccups you will find throughout the game but the dev team is making the list of bugs shorter and shorter just about every month. My next point is extremely subjective about what you may or may not consider to be a negative. This game is extremely EXTREMELY punishing. It's not unheard of for your base to get raided and you have literally 30 hours of work completely undone. As I said this is subjective. Personally I never thought I would enjoy something that punishing but Rust has a weird way of inviting you back in to try again. There's a constant sense of "Ok this time I will do it right." That's how anyone gets good at Rust by having their kicked over and over and learning how people exploit your mistakes. Stick with it and you may find yourself being the exploiter soon!And that's kind of where I want to end this review on. Who should buy this game? Look there's no getting around it Rust is not for everyone. If you find that you get easily frustrated with a game then this is NOT for you. If you like a really great challenge that you can bring your friends along for the ride. If you like this new emerging survival genre then I don't think there is a single game that does it better. Considering how often this game goes on sale (I grabbed it for $10) and you have found yourself staring at this store page do yourself a favor and check it out.

review: Rust is a great game if you like challenging and rewarding survival games. Where this game shines is in the player to player contact it brings out what most people will call the animal from someone. If you don't like games that have a slow start and a sharp learning curve then this game isn't for you. I had multiple friends who got this game and didn't like it because of the unforgiving gameplay. What I figured out is that people who group together have an advantage over the solo players. I went through most of my hours playing solo but what I found out is that playing in a group is alot better. I would highly recommend this game for anyone who loves survival games. If you're just getting started in this growing genre then I would recommend you to stay away from this one till you can handle losing everything and I mean everything on the first night.Oh yeah and this game is real time and no singleplayer option. You could build an "unraidable base" to wake up the next morning to see it completely destroyed. But hey that's the fun part about it.

review: For all the newcomers out there just wait a solid 4 weeks until things change. Right now after the scrap update the game went to scrap and you can now build twig structures in claimed areas which to me is nonsense. Back when the XP system was out after the blueprint system that to me was when you needed to devote your life to playing rust 24/7 because you had to farm to get better things. After the component update everything (for me) was excellent and I got back into the game after about 3 months. But recently scrap to get components?....Really? I get into a game I put around 50 bucks into because well I get into a game I buy skins for it and sell after I'm done. Well I'm done with this for a solid month or so let a few updates come out and I think you and I can get back into Rust. Just to clear everything up just one word Wait. For now Im going to keep this negative. Update Still going to wait but now they have added an up keep for your base so if its wood/stone the walls degenerate in I believe 2 3 hours for wood and 5 6 for stone. I switched it to positive because why the hell not it is still a great game.

review: This game like similar games suffers from a really toxic community think Rocket League or CSGO times a hundred. Most of that is because PVE is so underdeveloped which leads me to my only real criticism of the game it needs more PVE elements. If this game had a real threat in PVE or even some challenges besides the Tank and Helicopter that will blow you up if you're armed it'd be a much better game and the community would be more balanced. Regardless the mechanics stand on their own. The fighting and crafting are fairly stable and let's face it who doesn't want to run around naked all the time? Hell I'm naked writing this review!As for the artwork it's been improved over the time I've played and the animation glitches seem less common. Though I highly doubt this game will ever get out of Early Access overall it's still a great game and you'll easily get your money's worth of entertainment out of it.

review: Rust looks like an amazing game sadly my computer doesn t really support it well I guess it was my fault for thinking that this beautiful game could run on a surface pro. I still did get some good gameplay out of it though even though I was getting 3 frames per second. The graphics are amazing and the online mechanics a well thought through and very interesting. It is unique and brings something new to the survival sandbox types of games. With the ability to play online and communicate it doesn t always have to be guns blazing all out war (Most of the time it is). Sometimes you can trust or rely on other players which adds another layer to the game another tool you can use. I definitely recommend this (if your computer can handle it) if you like multiplayer survival and things like that you will love this game and will be interested and want to explore the world and opportunities that rust has to offer.

review: Question Should you get Rust If you like the following then yes LootingShooting PeopleBuilding BasesRaidingMaking FriendsIf you do not like the following then no Trying to loot as a fresh spawn and getting rekt by zergs (clans that run around killing people)Being shot atPeople destroying your base while trying to build itBeing raided losing ALL your stuff and having to restart all over againNot being able to make friends because everyone is a toxic jerk who will kill you for no reason at all (On sight)Rust is a 50/50 game some people will like it and some will completely hate it. If you are an aggresive person who can deal with a toxic community then please buy this game it can be so rewarding. But if you like teamwork and are a person who thinks "I was just standing still and was shot with an ak from 600ft away." please DONT buy this game tbh youre not missing out on much.Overall I'd say that Rust %99 of the people in the game that are toxic the perfect game. Sadly thats not how it is. Theres a lot to learn a lot of success and a lot of failure. You choose your outcome.

review: This has been a rather fun game even though 99.9% of the other players in the game seem to only want to kill you. Just to give you a bit of helpful info you do start the game in your "Birthday suit." I was not aware of this when I bought the game(4pack) on a whim and gifted the other 3 to a few of my friends. I am glad my wife was in the room when I started it up for the first time she was just as surprised by it as I was and it spared me the awkwardness of having to go and say "Hey Babe "So I bought this new game thinking it will be fun for me and my friends to play and after sending it to them I discovered "that you have to spend the first thirty minutes of the game looking for clothes.(if you survive that long)After a day of ownership and shame I found out that you can go to "Settings&gt Options and at the bottom under "Censorship" you can censor the nudity. This will pixelate the areas were clothes should be both one your character and all other characters from your point of view. There is also a live chat that can be filled with other players who go beyond "Salty" and can be down right vulgar. You can also disable this under Setting&gt Options and Show Chat. From here the game does a pretty good job putting you in survival mode. I honest felt after playing the first five minutes that I was in the TV show "Naked and Afraid " only nobody seem to care about what I had to say PThe Crafting is my favorite part. I haven't made a building yet but I look forward to living long enough to achieve this goal. Shout out to the those few players who didn't kill me I was genuinely grateful that you only took most of my stuff and then let me go on my naked way.

review: My honest review of rust... what could i say about the infamous Rust. For starters the most rage inducing game you will ever play. Losing hours of work to a zerg and constantly dying as soon as you spawn. For all the countless losses you gain skill. With that you will learn to be quick and agile becoming the one to defend from zergs or killing the person that camps. Not only is PvP a major need but so is thought. The way a base is built will determine if it will be raided or kept safe. The game is about survival do what you must to survive. In the end it all comes down to kill... or be killed.

review: One of the best survival games I've played. No other game has given me the kind of adrenaline surge and edge of my seat feeling like this game has. It's EA after all these years but very polished and worth the price tag.You will be out gathering materials and be full of juicy loot then someone sneaks up behind you and starts shooting your making you jump and try to get away.You will raid bases and people will hear your explosions then come try to steal the loot that you stole. Epic firefights will ensue as you try to defend your goodies your base and your territory.The survival market is saturated but Rust was one of the original and continues to be one of the best if not the best of the genre.9/10

review: This is onoe of my favorite games. review: Rust is still a game in progress but it definitely has come far in the last couple of years. I played the original version and have recently started the new version now that it has more content. I would definitely recommend. The devs do an excellent job of keeping players informed on what they are doing and what is coming up in the world of Rust. A lot of people complain about KOS and constant raiding but really if you find the right server and can find some people to play with it is a lot of fun. Rust is all about adaptation and starting anew. If you get too attached to the things you have built up then this may not be the game for you.

Now I had some top notch fun for the longest time. One of the most fun games I've ever played even though it stressed me out so much. Then.... they added the blueprint system again and all the fun gone. Instead of the fun game I once knew it was this restricted boring collecting simulator. review: Let me tell you my story I was alone wondering around fending for my own life and battling the constant danger of starvation until....out of the corner of my eye I see a man. He looks at me with the eyes of a killer and I knew "this is it" but he had bigger plans for me. He decided that this was not the day I would die but instead...would begin to prosper. He began to help me find my base the one that I had been searching for more than 2 hours. Once we found my overly tall twig mess of a fort he walked up to me with a smile and said "THIS IS ING HILARIOUS!" and then he proceeded to blow it up... I began to hold back my tears as my whole 4 hours in rust had come to this moment. I thought it was all over that I would never play this insane game of life and death ever again until he looked at me once more and said "I've got a better base for you." I looked back with pure puzzlement and found out that we were going to his magnificent castle of epic proportions. As qe traveled we encountered many obstacles such as naked men with rocks. We treked through mountains and valleys and streams just to get to my new home and just when I thought that we would never make it I saw it....just over the peek of the mountain was the gorgeous castle for me to call home. I did it I finally did it I was....home. we got settled in and I was given a room and weapons and clothing and a friend. But then this mentally insane burgaler breaks in and kills my friend but I would not allow this treacherous murder to get away with his evil dead so I swoop in to take revenge only to be killed at the same time as I killed him...i was quickly brought back to life upstairs in my new room with my new shotgun by my side and then my friend came home again. Then I had to leave for work and once i cam back I was stuck in a dark room with nothing but a singular piece of paper taht said "I have killed all your friends and stollen all there stuff and your future you are my slave now."11/10 would cry again

review: My name is Jsn1981 and I'm... Wait this isn't a meeting.. It's a review... Here we go So.. After some time spent on Rust I have developed an opinion. Not about Rust but about survival games in general.If it is a multiplayer survival game then the community is often salty and/or toxic. That's not as bad as most people seem to think. It adds rivalry and bitterness towards other players which games of this nature were designed to nurture.You have nothing to do but become the best. And everyone else is in your way.Rust is an excellent game with a terrible community. It's fantastic.Rust has excellent graphics with arguably even beter graphical glitches. Every time I kill a bear it's head spins around like it was the stunt double for Linda Blair in The Excorcist. My bandaids looks like agave plants.. Water sometimes does not render...even with the graphics all the way up. None of this bothers me at all.Rust has excellent gameplay. Wether you like to solo it or group up. Farm or kill other players. There is something there for you to excell at. Hell even if you like to just randomly surprise friends with a bout of gunfire for no reason you can excel at that.I would sell milk forever in order to make sure every pc gamer in the world has a chance to own this game.If you don't agree with this review I don't care.This is not satire. This is how I honestly feel about this game. Thank you.

review: The game is incredibly well done for still being in an Early Access status. When I first started playing I realized right away that the info for this game is spot on. Everything wants you dead but it is truly an open world filled with people who will either make or break you. I met a dude with an AK thrusted in my face saying give me your wood of course I did lol. Another didn't propose the question he just shot me in the face with a crossbow. Another dropped me some weapons and resources and we banded up and made one hell of a base. Frankly now that I understand the game much betterm I preffer to solo even though it is TOUGH to make it on your own. The graphics look awesome the gameplay and fighting aren't bad either. The animal AI is beyond dumb but they have said they will fix it. MY only complaint being server uptime and this complaint isn't with the creators it's the that DDOS the server and shut it down for everyone. Trust me when your in knee deep with this game and some idiot jacks with server it is the most aggravating thing. I do reccomend this game even with not 1 but 2 servers I spent a ton of time in both shut down on me I'm headed to play on another. Point is the game dynamic focuses on the server due to acquired blueprints and wealth acquired but I still go back to square one because I love the game.

review: Never wrote a review on steam... and to think this game brought me to that means a lot to me anyway.i don't have a great deal of hours into this game and yet here's my 2 cent this game offers you Everything and nothing.you can have it all own your game own the server.. or you can be the one being owned.i suppose dying in Rust is not something you should be ashamed of since every time i died every time someone stole 5 hours of work (and even a lot more than that) was paid back with game experience.Rust is a Thrill i didn't feel for a very very long time (since the days of WoW as much as they are on different catagories).the Graphics is amazing (to me anyway playing with Asus ROG Strix 1080 Ti 11GB makes this game looks like its the best Graphics Engine there is and i played a ton of Triple A Games through the course or my life).the game play is catchable. it takes a bit of practice and muscle memory to start clicking fast / quick when situation presents itself (as any game i guess)you might not agree but i can compare Rust's Early stages of the game to the same Principle of Starcraft you join a server you decide you wanna stick to this one and start surviving.you have to gather wood stone cloth and as fast as you can so you can establish your first house and this is just the beginning.creating a house doesn't just ends up with having a Foundation walls roof and a door.it requires a lock which without metal its a lock that requires a key a key that can be stolen upon dying and everything you gather in the past 2 hours (each and his own experience and therefor progress can be faster and can be slower alone or with groups of friends / allies)and basically the faster you acquire the materials you need to defend yourself along side with arming yourself with your first bow (to hunt animals ..or.. humans.. i guess) the faster you get to the point where you might be able to protect yourself from the Zerg coming to you (sooner or later they will come).just like Starcraft. the longer you delay your defenses the higher the possibility you'll get zergged without being able to defend.since i am not sure how well is my review (certainly not a professional but indeed a review that comes from the heart of a gamer who never knew how hungry he was for a Survival game such as Rust) i will end this review by saying this.i bought this game about 2 3 months ago (maybe even more).this game was lying in my Library all that time without playing this game for 1 single hour.this last Thursday i logged into Rust starting my adventure without realizing i am about to play this game from Thursday night till saturday (or should i say Sunday early morning) at 4 30 AM (2 hours and i gotta get up for work).i played almost 35 37 hours of Rust Basically with almost no downtime other than sleep shower eat. (wife and kids were on vacation).i am a father for 2 33 years old... and i feel like 16 again.if anyone actually have read this review all the way to the end and was able to get the sensation of how i felt during this crazy weekend (how much of a Nerd can i possibly be..) that you'll turn back the moment you see this because i am giving you a warm warning...THIS GAME IS FRIGGING ADDICTING AS .Thank you for reading.p.sfor a more professional review i suppose the Tube and the subreddits could supply with a better angle.See you in hel... uhh i mean in game!!!
title: Rust

review: First thing is first DO NOT expect this to be an easy game to play this is not for the casual or light hearted gamers... Do not try to play this game solo playing as a solo player will likely not work with the many 5 man clans raiding bases constantly and gets boring quickly... Having one friend is enough to enjoy the game however if you want a FULL experience of what this game has to offer you should form a group of 3 4 people. There are certain servers that limit group sizes but it still isn't as fun.I have successfully played as a solo player ONLY because of #1 I have absolutely no life and spent 10 hours collecting resources to make a base that would not be raided over night (this was on a server that had a 3x resource collection rate).. #2 I made my base on the edge of the map in snow where I was less likely to be found before my base was finished. And lastly #3 I was able to become friends with my neighbors who was a group of 3 players our bases were in view of eachother and we helped protect eachother.Overall this game is fun and I would recommend it to anyone you get your moneys worth and it is always VERY comforting to know that the Dev team that works on this game is extremely active giving you updates almost every week.

review: Rust is honestly one of the best survival games out and much like other survival games out there it takes time to understand the basics of resource griding and crafting. Rust in my honest opinion is best played with a group of people if you're going solo try pick a smaller pop server until you get some experience. The basis of rust is 1. Resource Grind2. Crafting your base3. Survival 4. PVP / Raiding other basesYou're going to find out very quickly that in most servers shoot on sight is going to be standard don't expect to go into a server and expect your first encounter is going to be friendly it most likely won't be. People want your resources especially in the early grind.Servers will reset depending on the admin allowing everyone to restart new. This can vary between a week or a month. The game from my short time of play time has shown me the dev's are continiously developing the game which is good a few veteran's of rust have said over the last few months alot of updates have been happening and the player count is impressive.Beware though as like every other survival game out there hackers can be a problem.Also servers sometimes have a tendency to have memory leaks which can cause mass lag but other then that it runs well for the most of the time. Also regarding servers check when the restart of a server will happen there is nothing quite like spending a whole day upgrading a base and then finding out the server resets the next day. With a GTX 1080 I can have this game with most of the high settings although crop in can be a pain at times with my FPS dropping from 100 to 10 in a matter of seconds regarding loading.In anycase a sold game and worth the asking price. Hopefully the game will continue to develop and expand whilst fixing the issues.

Recently a few buddies asked me if i wanted to play and honestly had the most enjoyable experience on a game in a long while. I played for 700 minutes straight leaving with only few quick breaks to go to the toilet with the fear our base was gonna get raided. This game ofers something unique that i haven't experienced in a long while. Grinding so hard for gear then sitting up in your watch tower with a gun plucking down noobs with a spotlight is somewhat satisfying. Amazing game highly recommended for someone with a few buddies )

review: To start out I have owned this game for a long time and seen it go through its phases of being created but I have only played it for close to 10 hours. Recently I started playing Rust and believe me I was so exited after the few new updates to make the game more solid that I played for 3+ hours straight one day. In that 3 hours I literally got nothing accomplished because everyone in the game kills on sight. I spawn in and within 30 seconds I die from people camping the spawn. Once you actually make a base it begins to be fun but oh wait you have a whole team of 5 guys camping you with guns and armor when you started and only have stone tools. It is such a good concept of a game but not having a singleplayer mode to play is very rage enducing when you try and play the game peacefully and get killed every time you see a player. Either way its still very fun to play the game if you do get far enough to built something or play with a friend and I do highly reccomend the game.

review: Rust is not for everyone.Its not a fair game. Its not a balanced game. It's mostly about thuggery and surviving a PVP environment. Most gamers if not experienced with PVP open world builders will have a hard time. Its just not a friendly game in anyway. But all of these things is why i love it. Its harsh dark and extremely changing solo.Yes. You can lose stuff in game and your totally open to being Griefed on bothered. Slandered. All your stuff can be taken and you're player base destroyed or under new ownership. Its a fact of life in this game.Most players are rude and just out to make your experience as horrible as they can. Its a very young and toxic group of players.But you can find a way to survive even solo and nothing more rewarding than revenge. You end up getting friends in compelling ways.There are issues with the game right now. The servers must be wiped every month because of a technical issues.Its a very demanding game on your system. Needing a high end computer to enjoy the experience.Its been in beta for like five years now and changed directions in what they want to do with game as many times.Yet there is something magical about this game in many ways.If you're a hard core pvper and love open world builders you must play this game.If your a care bear type and just want to build farm and have a relating experience. This game is not for you. try portal knights.

review: OK first things first Rust is amazing. I gladly give it two thumbs up and hours of my life. And I encourage you to check it out and decide for yourself.Now with that out of the way I want to expand a little. I heard about Rust in an article about all the salty lads crying about not being able to pick the race or gender of their character. I was intrigued by these game creators not caring about off their own players and even though First Person Shooter has never been a game genre I've been interested in I decided to give Rust a try.Mind you this was on a slow laptop averaging about 15 frames per second. Somehow I managed to get about 500 hours in on that potatoe. I love the sandbox feel of the ever changing maps. The dev team puts time and love into trying things out. Discarding and adapting sometimes for the better and other times not so much. But it's a wild ride that will constantly challenge your skills and faith in humanity in general.Thank you Rust. You taught me the true meaning of salty and I love you for it.PS I've recently upgraded my computer and now play Fanastic at 80 100 frames per second. OMG! #SoMuchPretty!!!
title: Rust

review: If you are looking for a somewhat challenging game to play where you can free roam Rust is for you. Now keep in mind depending on which servers in rust you join they will be difficult. It's somewhat difficult starting out especially if it's vanilla. If you don't intend on putting in a couple hours and time into this game then don't bother. This game is still being worked on. If you don't like the enjoyment of looking for people or resources and then dying and loosing some of your stuff and you get butt hurt over PvP Rust likely isn't for you. When you buy Rust know that most people are use to the agressive population rust has and will most likely kill on sight. The game is kill or be killed. If you raid then expect to get raided. Like I said before you if get butt hurt easily the game likely isn't for you.

review: On the suggestion from a friend I chose to venture into the EU District Rust server. The game while beautifully aesthetc still has a long way to go many things being currently non interactive however keep in mind it's still in Alpha release. That being said what is there reminds me much of Minecraft with guns and technological items.You start out with only a rock and torch from there you must find/hunt for food and build with what you find/gather. The tricky part and for that matter unbalanced part of the game is even with regular wipes it's very much the game of who gets in first. When you're starting you have no firearms you have no traps mines etc *however* anyone who has started before you has had the ability to get that technology and more. There don't appear to be any safe zones so you're just as likely to be sniped on spawn as to have your newly built house repeatedly ransacked and destroyed making it nigh impossible to build up reinforcements etc a horrible situation for a new player to be faced with. However with most deaths comes a lesson whether it be don't go near bears or watch for the helicopter that will destroy both you and your house in one pass. Deaths are corpse runs or lose your gear.Ultimately gameplay and asthetics are one thing community is another. If EU District Rust is a good guide on community give it a miss unless you like being griefed or can find a haven safe from griefers. Without the griefers it has a lot of promise.I am hoping beyond hope that the early access community is no indication on what it will be like on release.Graphics 8/10Gameplay 8/10Community 3/10

review: Rust looks like a hopeful early access survival game 7/10 for now someweirdonamedsilverMore objective part graphics depend on your rig they can range from "which pixel is my character?"To good enough The survival some time ago adopted an RPG element to crafting in which you unlock the ability to craft stuff by using level points gained by doing survival stuff I think it's garbage Because it's unfair with people new to the server but it's rust so no one cares about what's unfair AI is comprety garbage Gameplay it's fine ish sometimes some annoying glitches happen KOS kill on sight believe me I've died dozens of times for making goodhearted choices.Vast base building system More subjective part and hints If you don't play it with friends at first you'll maybe want to give up on itSince this game can get immensely frustratingBut the best way to deal with fails is respawning and building it all up againIt is a good survival game overall the developers STILL need to adress the bugged animalsIf you couldn't kill a horse within 5 seconds just let it go because they just go through rocks and climb cliffsLike there weren't any cliffs in the first place And avoid wolves and bears if you don't have ranged weapons at all costs Bears almost insta kill and wolves if they get you by surprise will kill you easily But do not DO NOT! Ever trust anyone I know it's cliche but it's just a fact Don't even trust people who seem to be beginners (nakeds) they will stab first chance they get Be Professional and always have a plan to kill players around you Oh and yea I hope you don't mind racial slurs because those guys love it The best way to deal with players is if they have spotted you kill them quickly and if you couldn't don't chase themUnless you KNOW for sure it's worth it But expect that person to be back with friends If not spotted just avoid or wait for the perfect moment Build base clever base designs making it harder for raiders to get to the loot Be sure to have two different exits and optionally an advanced post hidden nearby with weapons on it in case you die That load of crap was my third review please feel free to criticize and do whatever else you want.

review: ***Psychopath's Playground***This game advertises as an upper tier survival crafting building pvp pve etc. but is in reality a psychopath's sandboxer. After watching a few youtubers I decided to give the game a try and in three hours I wasn't really able to build or craft anything playing on official servers btw (tried west cost 1 2 &amp 3). With in 3 min of nearly every single spawn I was straight up murdered by another player no pretext to PVP no way of knowing what was going on or that there was anyone else there just dead over and over and over and over again. The few times I managed to live longer than 5 min. I owed largely to a "helping hand" from another player with resource gathering and defense that is until our inventories where full then they would murder you outside thier base for everything just farmed.Seriously this game is for psychopaths and I wouldn't recomend it to anyone. Survival yeah no. Game for those who apprently enjoy murdering everything that moves and sometimes co op.

review: How much can you trust someone other than yourself? This game will show you ways to survive in the wild in the middle of the island inhabited by strangers. The game is replete with various kinds of components that will help you go from caveman to HomoSapiens armed with modern weapons. You will have to evolve by the collection processing and combination of the resources around you creating more complex and useful items. Among the useful and necessary for the survival of elements you can find wood stone metal sulphur blueprints of new items and much more. The most essential resource however is trust. Trust is fragile and shaky but also the most important part in this game. This item will allow you to more quickly and safely reach your goals. Security in terms of survival always makes a priority of the extraction of raw materials and choosing a place to build a shelter. But even if the original area in which you chose to settle was relatively safe things can change quickly with new neighbours. Do not forget that you are not alone. This is a land inhabited not only by peaceful gatherers trying to survive but there are those for whom the easiest way to survive at the expense of others killing and looting their own kind for their own benefit. Any of the inhabitants of the island seemingly innocent and initially friendly to you may be useful companion. Later you can be killed by your new friend for profit in the most unexpected moment. So you decide which path to choose the path of peaceful but thrifty settler or the path of the bloody Head hunter. Whether to trust someone and join together in groups or be a loner to build great towers to your power or your own little slice of shattered Edem.
title: Rust

review: Really fun game but comunity can be a bit toxic(Not everyone). If you are the type of person that likes risk and is fine with farming and ALOT of deaths then you'll like it. Perseonally I dont play it anymore because I don't like it when everytime I spawn I'm killed by a fully geared guy for and giggles but thats part of the game and the devs cant change that without comprimising the the game itself.Devs are VERY active(Regular updates listens to comunity and knows how to make a proper game) so thats a plus.Game is balanced but if you dont like farming or having to start from scratch everytime you die and don't have a base you should probibly go on a comunity server with kits multiplier etc...Then some people say that cheating is the biggest problem in the game and that it's game breaking the devs don't care etc. but the truth is it is really not that bad. Yes there are cheaters a whole bunch but there are not enough so it is accually a bad game or makes it impossable to play. And the devs do care and are trying to fix it as much as they can.Conclusion this is not my type of game BUT it is a VERY good game with a good team behind it. I cant say amazing comunity but it can be really fun every now and then when you arent shot in the face with an AK while you are naked...

review: Nice graphics nice game overall. Here's my full review.Needed to run this game I'd suggest a 750ti and atleast a 2.5Ghz processor.Depending Nice people depending on server. Really fast and easy to run game depending on hardware.Cons Most of the time unless you get on a server just before a wipe it will be packed to the brim full of people that will hunt any naked they can. Defence is really underpowered unless you have a really good location where no rockets can hit. C4 is hard to get but when someone has the blueprints and materials to make it... Prepare for all out server war. Base building takes AGES if you are solo playing. Making a wood base doesn't take much effort but oh my hell it's hard to solo making a stone base and it's near IMPOSSIBLE to make a pure metal base.Pros Under $20.00. I haven't team played but I can imagine that using some strategies team / clan playing is amazingly easy. SOOOOOO MANY SERVERSI'd give this game a 7/10.

review: Aesthetics 8/10 Whilst the game itself is one of the most beautiful in the open world genre there are still many issues regarding clipping of rad towns and such where there are empty textures in some areas Gameplay 8/10 One of the most emotionally intense games you will play for both excitement and anger Community 6/10 Whilst there are many friendly people on select servers in the community there are also areas where you will experience some of the most toxic gameplay you will ever see Noob friendliness 4/10 Rust still has a lot to work on only helping noobs through the barebones of getting started of a new wipe with the current tips Fun 7/10 This is very dependent on how and where you play however playing a real time game can sometimes start to feel like a chore especially with the new upkeep system Starting outRust is not friendly on the new kids on the block it is unforgiving and the only way to learn is by learning from your mistakes. As if the environment and PvE for noobs wasn't hard enough for noobs you then have the toxic cancer that is PvP in Rust. As Obi Wan Kenobi said when describing Official Rust servers 'You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy'. Honestly I recommend if you get this game find a low pop or empty community server this is the easiest way to learn the game and if you want to get straight into PvP because you're an absolute madman there are servers like CosaNostra and CombatTag where you can skip all the farming and go straight to running round naked with an AK hell might aswell call this game 'Congo Child Soldier Simulator'. The new in game tips should help you get the basic necessities and a base down if you dont get killed by a zerg with AKs two days into wipe Further understanding the game In game tips won't help you too much after your first couple days of playing when you are ready to start gathering components and heading into rad towns you have no idea what to do when you start taking 140 rads and get confused as to whether or not you are playing Fallout 4 now. There also isn't much help to be found online as most of it is just videos titled RAIDING SALTY CHINESE HACKER ZERG BASE ... sigh . The best way to learn is by talking to other players (it really helps to have a mic in this game but the in game chat should work fine too) which brings us onto the next part. Making friends Making friends is very important in Rust as on high pop servers you will almost exclusively see groups ranging from 3 20 people living under the same roof. I recommend making friends on low pop servers where everybody knows eachother somewhat this way you are more likely to be friendly with eachother and thus friendship is spawned yayyyy you later log on to find your new 'friend' has changed you base codes and killed you leaving you back at square one . Trust and Toxicity An old relic that is rarely seen nowadays in Rust is Trust back in the olden days of Rust you could often walk past another player both of you with guns in your holsters but instead of a bloodbath you would usually see today the encounter would usually end with a 'see you later' after a friendly 2 minute chat. Now though whew thats a whole different story my advice to you is if you see someone with a gun and you arent up for the fight stay well away. Toxicity in this game has reached a maximum especially on Official servers not even the nakeds are safe from the clutches of the 20 man AK roaming zergs. DON'T PLAY OFFICIAL SERVERS I cannot sweat this enough Official servers right now are in utter chaos these servers are unregulated and hackers run amok ESPs and Aimbots everywhere this is because the servers don't have thier own admins they instead rely on bans direct from FacePunch which can take days this is one of the largest underlying issues in Rust right now and until it fixed stay well away. Community servers are regulated by the admins that own the servers and you willl rarely see hackers. Finding the right server This is actually pretty simple you will find yourself moving to lots of different servers because no two servers are the same from the community to the wipe cycles you're best bet is to use a Rust server website such as RustServers.net which allows you to search for your perfect Rust server.Overall I think once you have a good understanding of the everything the game has to offer it can be one of the most rewarding pieces of gameplay playing a 4 week long round of farming building and PvPing in a real time environment is one of the most unique pieces of gameplay you can get until you get offline raided and have to restart. Like I said you'll learn from your mistakes.

review: Worth buying? YES ) "Keep your friends close and your enemies closer" Here is 4 tips for beginners. Enjoy!1. Check out if you have anyone on your friend list who would be willing to join you into this new adventure filled with good funny and bad memories(the more the merrier meme basically) I'm not saying that you can't play alone but think about this.. your chances of survival are higher together than alone!2. Don't trust strangers blindlessly they could just be nice to you because they want to gain your trust and later offline raid you(the possibility is high)3. Want proper and sturdy base buildings? have no more fear! Youtube has tutorials from beginner to advanced video designs(worth checking out if you have the patience)4. If you are struggling with PvP find a server only meant for PvP and pratice the different weapons there until you get the hang of it! and yes it sucks in the beginning when you can't PvP properly it is stressing the fact that you are the first one to fall down every fight.. feels horrible However if you keep trying and never give up.. lets just say that "there will be a light at the end of the tunnel" Lastly thank you for taking some of your time to read this.
title: Rust

review: Just looking at the reviews people are clearly upset about what this game has become. I never played rust when it was 'good' so I cannot really compare my experiences to anything but the overall message I am getting from the community is "Rust sucks now!".When I first started playing rust not that long ago I was completely fixated on it. I had no idea what to expect when I started it up in all honesty I assumed it would be just another minecraft clone. This game actually made me more nervous or happy or scared than any other game I played. Some of the most tense moments of the game were when I was crouching behind a rock in the dark and the pouring rain naked and clutching a stone listening to the sounds of gunfire and screams. I can still experience this feeling whenever I play it. The fact that there are huge powerful clans who could kill you on sight makes the experience even more haunting and really ramps up the whole 'Post apocalyptic' feel that the game is aiming for. Even making friends ingame is like some sort of TV drama you never know if you will be the back stabber or the 'back stabbee' (Hopefully that makes some sort of grammatical sense).I can see where people might be coming from with the negative reviews and you could say that I don't have enough experience with the game to make a valid point Fair doo's either way. But I still kinda like the game regardless of it's flaws.In conclusion It gets a 8/10 from me go get it when it s on offer or something.
title: Rust

review: 1. How easy is the game to understand? +They have a starter guide implemented.2. Achievements They are in progress with this.3. Graphics +Not bad and it is getting better and better so.... 4. Gameplay +They have make a lot of improvements and the gameplay is one of them! Forced wipes are now every month instead of every week so that's a big improvement and they are also adding a lot of new stuff and things every update so yeah!5. Singleplayer Got none maybe if you play in a empty server......6. Multiplayer +A lot of fun if you play with a team. If you play alone then it's not worth all the time.7. The story No story in here.8. Unique things +They are making new items every 1/2 months (On the moment) but i think the Workshop helps here a LOT. (Skins)9. Time +We are back with the Blueprint System good to back if you ask me but you still need scrap to learn stuff and the drop rates of scrap is not that big so they need to change that or they need to lower the cost for some items. Personally i like the idea but it need more balance.10. Bugs/Glitches +Most of the big Bugs and Glitches are fixed so the develop team did a great job out there! But there will always be some glitches in Rust as long they update.11. Early Acces/Alpha/Beta/Development Stuck in Development forever it is nice that they are creating some new stuff but some people (like me) wanna play a stable good version of the game and not a game that got changes and nerfs and forced wipes like every month.12. Mods No mods in this game but the skins are fun to create.13. Genre +It is a decent game in his genre the concept is good but the game can be better make a stable version and more people will like it i think....8/13 for me..... I still play it (Like and hour) because i hope that there will be a stable game someday. On the moment it's fun to try but i don't recommend it if you play solo. Maybe (I hope) it will change in the future. We will see )

review: PREFACE I STRONGLY ADVISE AGAINST BUYING THIS GAME WITH THE INTENTION OF PLAYING ALONE. PLAYING THIS GAME ALONE AND WITH FRIENDS ARE TWO COMPLETELY DIFFERENT EXPERIENCES.That being said I have enjoyed my experience with the game and I think it was well worth the money I paid. While the game is in early access it's one of the better cases I've seen. Everything that needs to work does and the game is perfectly playable in its current state. You're going to have a few cheap deaths especially early on but nothing game breaking.As far as technical concerns go I have a decent setup (Nvidia GTX 980) and I can power through poorly optimized games. Maybe once a day my display driver crashes and I have to restart the game but that's it.This is a survival game and if you've played other multiplayer survival games before you probably have a good idea of how you need to go about things. 95% of your experience with this game will revolve around other players. If you jump into a populated official server alone you're going to have a bad time. If you get set up with a few friends on a decently populated community server like me you'll probably have a great time.A lot of the recent negative reviews come from the XP system from my understanding. I think the system helps encourage players to focus on themselves and setting up in the early game to make for better late game PVP. You can't craft your own guns for awhile but there are places to loot them if you're inclined.TL DR This doesn't feel like another early access hell project. You can play it you can enjoy it BUT DECIDE CAREFULLY IF YOU'RE GOING IN ALONE. Survival early game base raiding and defense late game.

review: At the this point i can't recommend this game anymore. It's still in Alpha after 5 years of development the community may be the most toxicated ever Youtuber influencing the game to much (getting people banned trolling and toxic behavior got way worse cause of theire uploads disclosing every trick in basebuilding raiding and PVP) Hackers are still a big problem (maybe always will be) the devs really do good and hard work but it seems they still don't know what they want this game to become You are going to be frutrated most of the time since it takes hours grinding ressources just to loose everything in a couple minutes or cause you needed some sleep. If you do not have much time you should look up modded servers with 2x/5x/10x etc gathering to speed things up2. don't store to many loot/ressources since you will be raided and lose everything 3. get used to beeing killed even if it is not worth killing you4. if you are easily frustrated play on low pop servers5. make friends and team up even if it's hard...the guy who killed you constantly for 2 days may become your best mate6. don't stream and whine cause ppl know your baselayout or streamsnipe you thats the price you have to pay for beeing a wannabe celeb

review: Now people say the community is toxic af. I can agree but without that type of community the game would be boring. If everyone was friendly there would be no conflict.Rust is probably my favourite game atm. There are many different ways to build bases many different play styles and every wipe feels different. One wipe you might have a base in the desert deprived of cloth the next you may be in the snow having to wear snow jacets the whole time. It varies. You make friends eventually betray them and make enemies which will probably end up killing you more than you kill them.But probably the best thing about this game. The weekly updates. Every friday thursday for someother timezones I wake up and check the devblog to see what they've changed/added. Sometimes its very little. Sometimes its a lot. The constant changes to the game is what keeps people intrested. I have to go with a 10/10 would install again. (legit its very little space)

review: This is only my 2nd review ive done on a game so cut me a little slack Ive spent 90 hours playing this game in about every aspect i can see.This review will be a review on general game play and a small overall rating chart at the end on a 0 to 10 scale.So to start we will begin with the building aspect of the game. This game has several different walls and upgrades that can be made to your player made and designed home/fort/base. It does keep a very 'Caveman' age feel to the game. When it comes to doors no doors are as strong as a wall this i understand it is basically like the developers want you to raid someones base threw the door rather than tearing all there work apart. I do feel doors made of metal should be slightly stronger but this is just my opinion. As far as windows and the bars you can place inside the window wall piece the window bars need to have the option to upgrade to metal. The reason for is noone wants to put windows on the first floor if window bars are only 300 strong and people can destroy them then jump in threw the window. Having the option to upgrade to metal and make the window bars stronger would be a big defense plus to the building structures. The stability aspect of building which basically determens how tall your building can be is Fantastic. If you add pillers before placing walls (support beams) then this will increase your overall stability and you will have the option to build a much taller building. Next we will talk about overall survival aspect of the game. At this time there isnt too much the few animals in the game are very hard to catch because they seems to 'teloport' when they walk so its hard to catch them let alone hit them with a bow&amp arrow. I understand this is a known problem but should be moved to a priority fix if it isnt. There are 2 different 'Aggressive' animals in the game you have the wolf and the bear. These violent creatures are hard to escape from and harder to fight. this goes back to the 'teloporting' mentioned above. As far as overall tools and craftable items there is a large selection of tools and items to create. locks code locks furnace fireplace crates chest guns ammo and etc are all crafted. blue prints are needed to unlock the ability to craft each item. This makes it a team aspect game in my opinion each person finding different blue prints to complete a task. As far as finding loot and looking for blue prints the only real options are smashing barrels and checking rad town crates for them but they are very rare and hard to come across. Loot can also be given out in airdrops which at this time is the only game event inside rust.When it comes to guns it seems the devs havent made it too much of a priority. There are only a few guns in the game a starter pistol a revolver a shotgun a pump shotgun a ak assault rifle a thompson and a bolt action. The main weapon of choice is the Ak47 assault rifle. Happens to be the best gun in the game. Biggest problem with the assualt rifle is it zooms more than the bolt action and you would think the bolt action would zoom more because it is the 'sniper rifle' of the game. hopefully they will soon add a make shift scope you can add to the bolt action or even add a sniper rifle with a scope so there will be something that compensates for the assault rifle.When it comes to what the main point of Rust is in my words. You gather supplies find blue prints craft items build a base save up some gear hit some air drops and rad towns THEN RAID AND KILL EVERYONE ELSE.The goal is to be the biggest baddest and most dagerous crew on the server. take over the Rust world you have chosen to be apart of build up and take out the other groups around. Steal there supplies by blowing there front door open with c4. Rush into combat with gun blazing action packed pvp and hope to survive and be the last man standing to take home the prize.Overal Game Ratings rated 0 to 10 (10 being best)Game Graphics 6 for todays age you would exspect alot more detail in a game like this Map 5 map is kinda plain and dull not much as far as landmarks to help you get around they did just add roads though Guns 6 Need more guns and deffinatly some adjustment to the assault rifle and the bolt action General Game Play 8 game runs smooth even in a high pop server such as 100 250 players Building aspect 8 Great building aspect just need more... keep up the great work Devs Survival aspect 6 the animals need greatly adjusted and tweaked aswell as more aggresive animals such as a wolf pack PvP 7 it is what it is for the game being the way it is now no different than most FPS Overall Game Rating 8 Possibly one of the best Build/Raid games out there at this time .

review: The old rust was good and I still like it the game was a bit ruined by removing the zombies cuz of the looks that the game already had it was about survival not being able to see in the dark with zombies on every corner was all the game about.It was interesting and all now the old rust is about building gathering and killing nakeds.Now for the new rust.I try to like it every time I turn on the game I try to force myself into playing it but I simply can't reason? You don't listen to the community that own potatos (I am talking about the /grass.on false command being added because the grass IS the main source where the lack of fps was coming from. You keep saying it's the trees no it isn't why doesn't my fps drop when I am in middle od desert with trees or in the forest where the grass is not there but instead my fps goes down in plain wide field where the grass is. Why don't you add a texture on the ground (like it is on legacy (green and yellow mushed grass should I say) so when you turn off the grass you won't be seeing black ground nor green (depends on the biome))Another changes that should be made as the community asks are Make map smaller because such a big map requires too many players for good enough action. (Or just convert the old map as you said you will instead of adding roads to this one and stuff near them. Make more blueprints available from the start similar to legacy (pistol+ammo bow+arrow etc.) Modify loot at rad towns more like Legacy + remove stupid stuff like Torches as a possibility to spawn like who cares about those Possibly cut crafting time in half And since there are now explosives make guns and melee weapons not being able to take down walls. (at least to a certain point for example if the wall is wooden or made out of stone it should be able to be taken down with the weapons named above if it is metal or something else that I don't know of then just explosives)To be honest about the new building system I am against it I'd rather use the old one from the old rust just remodel some textures cuz building is really really great on the old rust. Darker look (as it was when the game was in pre alpha alpha alpha lol) Add the zombies in the near futureI haven't played the new rust that much because of these reasons that I've talked about above... especially the grass one my fps drops from 30 35 to 10 15 or less.As I said I haven't played the new rust that much there could be more stuff wrong that I haven't said in my post.I love this game as it WAS the new one would be great if things would've stayed the same or changed but saddly rarely the community has a voice.Thank you for understanding potato out.

review: I started my Rust experience in early 2016 and have been playing on and off since then. I have seen the game evolve from the Blueprint system to XP to Componets (favourite) and back to the Blueprint/Component system we have today. Rust has seen many changes through its development and overall despite the communities complaints they are for the better. Since day one I saw a lot of potential in the game my only concern was that it was on the Unity engine and I feared its limitations. But my fears have been laid to rest because of the developer dedication with weekly updates of fixes and quality new content every few weeks. About the game though if your looking for a survival game for solo or cooperative play in a competative setting I say look no further because this is the best out there imo of course.

review: Having played Rust for a few years now I'm still very much enjoying the game. I have taken a break while an expansion dropped on another game but I think a lot of us do that from time to time.The Rust developers at Facepunch Studios are still in my opinion the best in the industry. I run the server Vanilla Fudge (which was also on break for a while) and the communication between server owners players and Facepunch is outstanding. Facepunch listens to feedback and makes adjustments as needed without compromising their core vision of the game. They have had weekly updates with said communication since day one I believe adding most of the time good (meat and potatoes) content while doing so.I have invested time into other EA games that simply did not or still have yet to deliver what the promoted hype was all about (uh hem dayz). I say time because the $20 I paid for the game was miniscule compared to the amount of entertainment I received in return. Heck you can't hardly buy a case of brewskies for that anymore and back in the day I'd have that drank in a weekend with a couple of buddies.Keep up the great work Facepunch and thanks for the great memories thus far!Veeblefetzer Rust serverVanilla Fudge

review: Rust is a great game. I don't do reviews really so this may not be the best.I will start with the bad first.This game is still in its infancy trying to find itself. I am not sure what the "endgame" is going to be for the title but I can't wait to find out. Currently its an FPS overlay stuck in a sandbox building game. It's not a survival game its a Newman vs Newman deathmatch to entertain some evil observers.The player base is trash. In the old day's people used to joke and screw about while killing each other now they talk and spew hate while killing each other. They shitcan the review of the game while playing 90 hours in two weeks. Any change despite the game being in alpha is meet with a level of REEEEEEEE that even Reddit can not contain it. If you play on an official server you are going to have a time. They are dominated by ego zergs large groups of players who on the whole are terrible that succeed by banding together. Something that sounds perfectly reasonable that soon becomes tedious when you have to endure the rantings of a gaggle of pre pubescent manlings as they wipe every player off the server. The alternative is community servers which are better but have a half life measured in minutes. The server that you wait to get into one day will have a population of 10 in three days. I don't understand it but it is what it is.Lastly... Cheaters. It's a thing. Any popular competitive game is going to have them. Where there is a market for cheats someone will provide them and some will buy them and make the game suck for other people. Rust is no different. Community servers where admins put in stipulations like minimum steam account life and no vac bans help. There is none of that on official they are hacktastic. Now for the good stuff. It's fun legitimately. The game is visually pleasing I actually have just a screenshot of this game at night that I use for a background sometimes. The resource gathering/building system is solid. The POI's are all very well done and great places to get into fights in. The weapon mechanics are rewarding with good feedback and the level of detail with skins and options is top notch.Seriously play Rust. Its fun aesthetically pleasing stable as hell. I don't know where the game is going but even in its current state its solid and fun to play. Regardless of where it ends up I am on for the ride.
