review: I've been playing Rust for over a year and accumulated almost 2 000 hours ingame. How many other $20 games can you say that about? There has been a lot of negative reviews about the game recently due to a large update that changed how the fundamental systems of the game work so I figured I would leave my 2 cents and show that the large outcry of negative feedback is really only a vocal minority. (disclaimer this review only accounts for the most recent state of the game the developers are changing core aspects on a fairly frequent basis so I will try to keep my opinion broad instead of getting into specific things.) Let me break down my likes/dislikes of the game Likes Game mechanics are very crisp and clean. There are some issues and bugs with the game but compared to most other giant games with this sort of scope it is very minimal. When you shoot a rocket at a door or ceiling it does what you expect it to when you fire a round out of a weapon it (usually) does what you expect it to. There is very little desync or sluggish reactions from weapons.There is a fairly large skill gap. This point could be argued until the end of time about how much skill is or isn't required to be good at this game but I firmly believe that there is a decently large skill gap in the current form of Rust. What I mean is that when you come up against a person(s) who are significantly less experienced than you are you will defeat them most of the time. Yes luck does play into fights or raiding but you can almost always count on the better player coming out ahead in the end. Base building and PvP are the core aspects of the game and they both have very large skill ceilings which I personally really enjoy.The game feels like an organic experience. Rust is what you make of it a choose your own adventure in a giant sandbox. You can be a villian hero merchant farmer trap layer or passive bystander. Most games these days take great care to craft every second of gameplay to what they want you to experience. There's nothing wrong with that but it can sometimes feel like you're not having your own experience but someone elses. You can have the most interesting and intense interaction with other players or stay in and around your base and mind your own business the choice is up to you.The developers are trying to make this the best game possible. Facepunch is the most active development team i've ever seen. There are patches weekly that introduce new and interesting things to the game. There are larger patches sometimes but there has always been some sort of update every thursday. The developers try their best to listen to the critcisms and concerns by the player base and adjust the game to make them happy. They work on gameplay and how you progress through the game in ways that they believe will make the game more interesting and fun. This is one of the best games to play with friends. Whether you're starting out just learning how to build your first base and defend your home with bows and arrows or running around shooting every threat in your area with rifles it's a blast with a few close friends. Rust is also a game that you can play by yourself although you have to change your frame of mind a little bit and adjust to the different dynamic of being solo. Dislikes Large groups of players will always have a slight advantage. Due to how the game functions there will almost always be an advantage to playing with more and more and more people. This makes you feel like you have to play with other players and some people don't like that. There are downsides to groups that can be taken advantage of if you're a good player so don't feel like i'm saying it's hopeless for solo players and people with 3 or less in their group. What i'm saying is that if a group of 6 are to come up against a group of 3 and they have similar gear and similar experience in the game the group of 6 will win the majority of the time. Unless the developers introduce some sort of mechanic that affects large groups but not smaller ones this will always be the case. There is very little feeling of achievement in the long term. This is something that has kind of changed with the newest patch introducing blueprints back into the game. Now there is something that will tie you to a specific server in that if you want to swap servers you have to start over with no blueprints. These are short term solutions to me I still dont feel like putting a large amount of time into the game has that much of a reward over the long term. I am a fan of grinding in games and I appreciate having something at the end of it. With rust the only real reward of putting time into the game is saying that you are better at the game. At the end of the week or month or sometimes 3 days that severs stay active you have your base and guns to look at and then it's gone wiped away to a clean slate to restart from scratch. The blueprints give you some feeling of accomplishment so that you don't have to start over completely but it still feels like in the long term we're not really rewarded for our time and efforts. This isn't a big gripe or something that would stop me from playing it's something that i've accepted about this game. I play the game because I have fun and that's all that matters. This game doesn't feel like a survival game. As of late this game feels more like a PvP call of duty type game with a small base building aspect in it. People start a small base with a storage box to hold their things and immediately go out and try to kill everyone they can. Guns and ammo are very easy to get and based on the amount of time it takes to stockpile resources there's no reason to go outside without a pile of ammo and meds to sustain you for hours. There's nothing wrong with this play style one thing i've learned over my time playing Rust is realizing that there are several very different ways to play the game and none of them are wrong. What i'm saying is that I personally would like the game to be more of a survival challenge with aspects of PvP and risk versus reward sprinkled in here and there. Weapons should be fairly rare and ammo should feel scarce and like a privelage. You should have to make a concious choice about whether you want to shoot someone based on the possible return of what they have on them. Right now there's no reason not to shoot every single person you come across just because you can easily do it. Summary Rust is a great game. Thank you to the developers who have put so much time and effort into the game it really shows when you play it. I've had as much fun playing Rust as anything else i've played. I recommend this to anyone who likes FPS with resource gathering and base building. Rust is definitely a game that is easy to learn but difficult to master.

review: Rust is the most brutal and unforgiving 'survival' game there is. This is not due to any PVE element altough this is subject to change in the future but rather because you have to survive on an island filled with bloodthirsty murderers aka your fellow survivors. The result is that its less of a traditional survival game and more of a heavily PVP orientated FPS game with resource gathering crafting and building.It answers the age old question of what would happen if you isolate a large group of naked people on an island with the ability to make weapons and build what they want with no rules? The answer to this is that they'll form small groups or clans and attempt to dominate the island from their heavily fortified bases killing looting and raiding anyone they come across to fill their own armories. And those with big balls do it solo.There is a ton of buggy broken and incomplete early access games out there that will probably never reach their full potential. Rust is NOT one of those. Never again will the world see such a dedicated and hands on early access development team as the Rust team at Facepunch Studios. You can expect a major update every second week like clock work and a smaller update every other week. They are always in touch with the community and they strive to make the game awesome for everyone even though it's nearly impossible to keep everyone happy all the time especially if you are dealing with a community of toxic savages that hates change. But if something does not work or contribute to the end vision of the game they try something else or add something new. So expect changes because this game is still being shaped and improved continuously.If one buys a mainstream big title game and get a couple of hundred hours of gametime out of it it feels like money well spent. But Rust is the type of game that you'll always come back to when you are tired of other games and rack up thousands of game hours. And it only costs a mere $20.This game requires a fair amount of dedication but if like me you dont have nearly enough time for that always you will still be a part of the Rust family and in touch with how the game is evolving with tons of very entertaining Youtube content daily that will always have you feel like a Rust player even if you havent played for a month or two. The minute you log in though you'll feel right back at home.Rust might not be everyone's cup of tea but in my opinion if you don't own this game your Steam Library is missing the best part.
title: Rust

review: A typical week in rust.You spawn.You get bashed in the head by a naked with just a rock.You spawn.You get killed by a wolf.You spawn.You get killed by a guy roaming with a ak.You spawn.You get killed by that same fkn wolf from before.You spawn.You farm.You build a massive base.You get an ak.You kill the wolf eat it and its brothers You shoot the naked in the head and the other that got in the way *dejavuYou blow a hole in the ak guys base and take his gun explosives and even his seeds in his dropbox.You do it all over again next week.Rust somehow became my most played game. After been skeptical about paying the initial $20 i have to say it is the most worthwhile steam purchase made. I have clocked over 2000 hours. Note It is a sandbox make it what you want. PVP build farm hell even role play if you are that way inclined. It is best played in a small group with comms (discord). Even when taking a break from the game i still monitored progress via reddit and devblogs. Rust comes with incredible updates from the devs. You will both love and hate it. As the game keeps changing so it is forever fresh. They provide weekly updates that are record on their twitter website and in game community update.The community is both great with Youtube videos that tell a story to the inverse of a screaming 12 year old that you wish would stop voicing his opinion on reddit. Points to beware Hackers. You will have all your gear taken at some point while your offline. The learning curve will be very hard but if you push through you will understand its popularity. Time. And lots of it. Solo sucks but is a nice challenge ever now and again. Never trust a rust player...........i warned you.Highly recommend playing

review: Rust is in my opinion the only exception to the rule of "beware early access" Perpetually in a stage of development rust has changed drastically over time and usually for the better. Facepunch continue to make efforts to improve the game and the multiplayer experience that makes up its core. The continued monthly updates provide a consistent flow of changes and refreshments that pull me back into the game thursday after thursday to get the jump on my friends right after the wipe. I honestly could not recommend it enough for fans of survival games. Fair warning however if you're anything like me you will quickly realise how much better everyone else is.

review: RUST Legacy was MUCH better. People on Legacy were nice. And servers weren't filled with ignorant giant clans picking on nakeds.. But today the kids in RUST came directly off Minecraft.. Now it's ATLEAST a big clan of kids per server.. Kids who grew up from Minecraft but too early.. And they control each server so there's really no point playing because you get attacked by kids who use extremely bad language and offensive language. N words F words C words and so on. Just looking at YouTube makes one puke. Toxic kids everywhere.. And the youtuber personalities are all praising it with their "raiding nazi" videos and their "rust slavery" videos. They really want as much toxic content on their videos as possible. And that's what they get.. And the annyoing kids from Minecraft come over.This game has gone from being really good to a disgrace the last years. Just put it out of Early Access. It's done at being good.And what's really going on with this game?First they have blueprints (to craft certain items in the game)then they replace that...And then they put it back...And then they replace that with a basic level up system where you as the solo player actually have a chance versus clans..And then they remove levels and the solo players are screwed again...And then they put in something weird after levels..And then after that they decide that blueprints are the way to go again...What is this game really becoming?Blueprint scavenge simulator 2017?Winter to Summer of 2014 was the best time to play RUST.

review: I fully recommend this game to any patient survivalist or strategist. Rust is about spawning in with nothing and through hard work and stress getting up a base and defending it as long as you can whilst destroying other peoples bases. It can be a fun game if that type of environment is fun to you. Other than that this is ridicuously challenging game for any solo player especially if they lack FPS experience as the shooting and PvP are the #1 most encountered activity in the game outside of farming materials. The thing that constantly keeps me coming back to this game is the building mechanics. It is so complicated from a strategy level. You can always improve your bases hitting new levels of base security from game knowledge rather than just farming materials. You can have the biggest base in the game and if you lacked the knowledge to keep it secure I as a raider to your base can have great success in finding and taking your loot. Whereas If I know how to build very secure bases I can keep my loot safer. There are creative servers you can use to practice base building or 3rd party programs like Fortify. I do not recommend Fortify on its own though as it does represent the game of Rust at all despite the effort of the creators of it. The biggest downside to the game is how much time you have to pour into it to get anywhere how toxic the community is when it comes to kill or be killed how complex it can be from a building perspective and how long it takes to really graps all the mechanics of building in order to build top tier bases and lastly the ever constant major updates that sometimes take the game in a completely different direction when you are very comfortable with the previous settings. Even so this is still my favorite game and I foresee myself playing it for many more years.

review: Recently got this game and I can say it's pretty fun! The one thing you gotta learn though is that your death will be inevitable.Gameplay wise I'd like to say that most elements in this game are already pretty balanced. Guns like the AK are powerful but have quite a bit of recoil so you'll have to pull down if you're planning on spraying. Base building is very easy but requires much more resources if you plan on upgrading it to withstand the raiders that may come and attempt to break in. Raiding is also very easy. C4 and rockets are mainly used to break into stronger bases with sheet metal/armoured walls. Another popular was to raid is to build a tower to climb over to the top of the base to raid it.You're only really able to experience the best of Rust if you have others to clan up with as other groups can easily wipe out lone wolves and raiding by yourself won't work out very well.

review: Rust is an interesting Minecraft like game with relatively advanced graphics Game mechanics makes it feel realistic at least at first. Hunger thirst and health levels need to be monitored after respawn. Strunggling for staying alive is definitely enjoyable for those short periods of time. Large reserves of food and water possible to consume prevent this aspect drom being irritating later on. The next intriguing thing is that the character respawns with not even a part of colting which need to be crafted each time. After a few minutes of uninterrupted game player is able to buidl a simple shack and lay a sleeping bag there to have a constant point of respawn and hopefully a safe storage. This is where the real fun part begins in my opinion. Developing a dwelling requires a combination of material gathering blueprint hunting and securing obtained items. All three aspects are well balanced so the game remains interesting until hitting the technology / space / server lifespan limit.There are some aspects that could be corrected by now even though the game is currently in alpha version. The most troubling defects are items falling through the ground (like some weapons tools granades) shooting melee mechanics large client server traffic and missing terrain textures. Even considering these errors I find the game most interesting and I'll certainly be watching it develop.

review: "This really is one of the best games on Steam. I love it. You should buy it. Buy it and be friendly. OR buy it and kill nakeds. It s your life play Rust however you want to play it."... A+ Rust is fantastic. Read on for my reasons why... When I first heard of Rust I was playing some other survival/multiplayer games and really getting into the genre. After watching a few hours of Rust content on Youtube I bought the game and I am so freakin glad that I did. First of all It s diverse you do plenty of farming gathering loot engaging in PVP there's base building hiding loot stealing other people's loot base raiding intense battles It really does have it all. The interactions with other players ranges from visceral and violent to obscure and hilarious and plenty in between. For me Rust evokes the most wide range of emotions joy fear anxiety anger relief just to name a few. And to top it off there s scores of different servers you can play on from unmodded (vanilla Rust) to modded servers with zombies to mini game servers to strictly PVP battle servers. For you role players there s even medieval servers and a few PVE servers. The community in Rust is as diverse as the game itself. You ll hear things like Rust is toxic Rust has the worst community .. Honestly that s b.s. It s what YOU bring to the game. If you re salty and rageful you will attract salt and rage. If you re friendly and just playing Rust to have a good time you ll really enjoy the game. I ve made a lot of Rust friends this year and have built my own community within Rust. To be fair you should know that you will get killed. A LOT. Likely within the first 10 minutes of waking up on the beach someone will run up to you and either A) scream REEEEEEEEEE and kill you with a rock or B) befriend you gain your trust then betray you and kill you. LOL seriously tho it does happen. You will die. Don t give up. Some tips Watch some **recent** vids on youtube to help flatten the learning curve practice gathering resources and building/securing a base on a low population server then once you got that down take your knowledge to higher population servers and show em what you re made of. LOL. You'll eventually come across people who will unapologetically troll and grief but in the 1000+ hours i've played this game they're far outnumbered. Rust is currently early access. The positives are that you get weekly updates that keep the game feeling fresh and sometimes they are significant and game changing. The game is always improving/evolving. The devs at Facepunch play the game read the comments talk to the Rust community and take that to the table when they decide how to improve the game. This really is one of the best games on Steam. I love it. You should buy it. Buy it and be friendly. OR buy it and kill nakeds. It s your life play Rust however you want to play it.

review: I have been playing Rust for 2 weeks now and despite my first few hours of continuously being killed I absolutly love this game. First and foremost Rust is a PVP game but come on give a guy a break especially a noob. I decided that in order to "learn" how to play Rust I needed to find a server with little to no population. Next adjust my game settings to make it look good. Once done the game looked a whole lot better. Finding an empty server was easy as well. Now I was ready to learn the lay of the land craft some items and begin my Rust experience.I woke up naked on the beach and started exploring the area around me. I learned to harvest wood and stone to create some basic tools which made the bolder I started with obsolete. I absolutly love the hemp "pot" plants that grow all over. Too bad it's only usable as cloth. (Note to the devs maybe you can ad another use for it)The first thing I did was make some clothes as it was raining and I was cold. I made a bow &amp some arrows and got a few wild pigs for food and leather (and cloth) . I came across a dusty road that led be to an airfield. It was then I noticed there was someone else in the world besides me. Luckily he was friendly and agreed to show me the ropes.With his help I quicly learned the basics of building and crafting better items. By now I had the Rust bug.Fast forward a couple of weeks and I was starting to build a small compound of my own. Again on a relatively empty server. I discovered lots of blueprints built a large furnace and began mining and smelting metal and sulfer. I has a nice stash of goods I had collected over the past couple of days and was feeling pretty good. Then the unthinkable happened I was raided. My doors and walls blown up all my hard earned loot and supplies stolen. The perpetrator left a message on my sign HI was all it said. With that I rebuilt added locks and the next day robbed again they blew up the box. The last straw they blew my doors off and killed me in my sleep. I know it's a pvp world out there but killing someone while they are asleep?? That's just mean. Now it's time to plot my revenge as it told me whole killed me while I slept.I still enjoy playing it's a blast. And having an enemy beside that damn helicopter makes it more personal. I now know I need to rebuild in a more secluded area. I'll be waiting for you ...To the Devs if you are open to suggestions and/or ideas I have plenty. I'll save that for a diferent post. I like this game and I'll keep playing. I say get it it is fun especially if you like killing and crafting. Happy hunting!Mudbugger

review: Played a good few survival games in my day. While Rust isnt the most hardcore game to find food or water they make up for it with savage PvP. I've had this game in my steam library for ages but finally got around to trying it 5 days ago.Since then I haven't been able to stop thinking about it. Constantly on reddit and planning/theorycrafting with my friends who are mostly new to the game aswell. My base got raided and I lost a ton of stuff. Luckily with the recent reintroduction of the blueprints system my friends and I were able to get back on our feet.This game is WELL worth the price. The developers are constantly updating it for both balancing and QoL improvements. Legitimately 10/10. Expect to die while getting your footings. This game is not easy. If you like a challenge you will like this game.

review: A game with a lot of potential. The problem atm is no longeivity (constant updates/wipes/no real feeling of reward/etc) Plenty of fun when played with other people. Solo can also be fun (I once survived in a bush for a week on a higher pop server...ty RNG Gods). Nice open world thing.. There should be NPCs. For example being able to hire a clerk to man your shop...or a gardener/lumberjack/hunter...who cares...I would have a ton a fun hunting down npcs also. Yes they should be able to shoot back (or at least use their shovel/axe/bow hah). I originally purchased it on sale while running steam on Linux (worked better than most SteamOS and ARCH). I really liked the idea of Valve having their own free OS. Office/whatever would just be another entry in your library! Anyway I ran Linux as my main for years Rust didn't let me down (nor did any of Valve's games). THANK YOU!

Su sistema de crafteo no es muy amplio a mi parecer.En cuanto a rendimiento creo que nunca estuvo del todo mal optimizado si que con una gtx950 un i7 4790k y 8GB de RAM había que jugarlo en medios altos o medios para conseguir fps estables.Conclusión recomiendo comprar este juego si tenes amigos con quien jugar y un poco de tiempo para disponerle ya que si te haces una pequeña choza es probable que comiences de cero la próxima vez que entres

I was about to open the door to see what they were up to when I heard a peculiar beeping noise...then my wall exploded. The men charged in and shot me in the head. They mutilated my corpse and burned my cottage to the ground....10/10 would play again.

review: This is personally one of the better early access open world crafting games on here. This game is very much PVP oriented so be aware if you are not a fan of PVP this game is more fun with friends and played as a PVP style game. They are making a lot of additions that drive a more PVE experience but at this time I would say if you like open world crafting survival games with PVP this is a great game to play. The developers make regular weekly updates and this game has progressed a lot since it first launched in 2013. The original game had zombies and was a bit of the same as all others nothing really unique and a bit of a grind to play. Still fun. The current version of the game is very fun when played as a PVP with friends. The focues is currently around base building to resist being raided end game blueprints to be able to raid. Base raiding is done in two ways offline and online. The player/s base you are raiding they are either offline or online. Online raiding is the funnest but most difficult. Offline raiding is easy but really only rewards you with loot and resource. I find online to be more rewarding as it is a challenge. Base designing is really fun also. I look forward to the new PVE aspects such as NPC's they are adding dungeons they have discussed adding and the changes to the water exploration of the game. I play both this and ark. I feel this game is more fun and better optimized. I like ark but more as a PVE style of survival game. They both have thier pros and cons. I do enjoy both equally. TLDR Highly recommend if you like survival crafting open world PVP focused games.
title: Rust

review: Oh man. This game really has its ups and downs. The community is trash and you always get killed on sight. Very few people are actually friendly outright and most are constantly skeptical. But something about the constant bickering is endearing. This game has a lot of heart and has certainly come a long way since a year ago. The dev team for this game are easily the most dedicated Early Access devs I've ever seen. Bi weekly content updates listening to the community about bugs/greivances and solid game design. This is the holy trinity and they nail it. My only critique would be the lack of PvE elements trying to kill you. Sure the thudding of a bear can be terrifying if you aren't prepared to fight it but its not enough. Players need something to be scared of other than each other so that more focus can go to the environment. Lastly removing visibility during the night was an interesting move but it makes half the time spent in game almost useless without using a light source. This isn't necessarily a bad thing but it would be nice if we could have night vision goggles as a super rare drop/craft. Might be asking for too much but it would certainly help.Anyway excellent game. 9/10. Definitely worth the money.

I've survived weeks in RUST solo and that in itself is an accomplishment. You either enjoy RUST or you don't. I thoroughly DO. I'm not even that good at it outside of base building and occasionally being to defend myself from a player of equal skill.

review: Rust...Been playing it for almost two years it was an amazing game no doubt. Probably my favorite. Easily use to spend a good 60 hours a week when I first started played I absolutely loved the game. Then came the XP system... and it ed us in the The devs talked about fairness... What fairness??? When you have these massive clans who come on as soon as wipe and are carrying aks while you're still stuck with a bow? Forget about it... It use to be good when you could just go to radtowns and just think about finding something good I loved it because it was based on luck now... its ing stupid.As you'll see I spent all these hours before the xp system... When the xp system came about I spent about a good 8 hours trying to maintain myself to it. I couldn't stand it. I hated it! Modded servers don't even work well with this... You'll be spending most of your week just gathering trying to level up literally this will become your full time / part time job. And for people that work when I use to play this in my clan we had older guys who worked real life jobs and could only spare a couple of hours now and then. Well sad to say they quit as did I. If you have a full time job infact regardless if you do or not if you're not willing to spend hours upon hours a day grinding and gathering to try and level then this game isn't for you. You'll just end up rage quitting.Don't get me wrong I use to love farming and building my base! That was before the xp system because I could go to radtowns and at some point find a broken AK which then I would repair and get blueprints to make it. Now you're out of luck.Thanks for nothing Devs.You did what most selfish companies do you became greedy and forgot about your community. Ask anyone most of the verterns hate this they hate it so much even for the ones who were legacy won't be coming back. You should've listened.Bring back the old rust with the blueprint system not this xp system. While this XP system is in place don't bother buying this game.110% don't recommend it.

review: review update 6/6/2017this game is fun with friends but not alone if you dont plan on joining a clan or friends dont even waist your time as you will be blown away by everybody else and lose all your progress. everything works (to a point depending on the update they push out) but there is one big annoyance that has cuase me and every clan or group i have played with quit this game in disgust can you guess it? thats right its HACKERS! they are everywhere in official servers dont expect to get very far befor you and your group of 6 friends are triple headshotted in 5 seconds (that actually happened to me multiple times) they are blatant and dont care. they dont hide it and its super blatant. i think csgo has less hackers than this game and at least as a server you can vote kick them out and do something about it there. but nope unless your are in a community with an "ACTIVE" (most of them arnt even thought they say they are) admin your ed until thier anti cheat bans them maybe next week. me and my group of friends would steam role servers because we are all very good players but every time we have ever have been destroyed or raided is by hackers because why play the game and have fun when you can just cheat and not get banned then when you do just make another account with a profile generator and buy the game for cheap of or other sites.score 1/5 this game is super fun but time consuming so when you and your friends spend hours and hours mining for resourses having fun battles with other groups over airdrops only to lose it all to someone who downloaded some scripts from one of the VERY MANY cheating websites out there or blew past their wet tissue paper of a anti cheat system they have. it has made countless people i know with thousands of hours put down this game and never pick it up again. fix the hackers and its a 4/5 until then its a waist of time.

review: Easily one of the greater (if not the best) multiplayer survival game out there right now. The game is notoriously brutal expect to die. A LOT. There is a nice progression system in place to keep you focused on getting better equipment and weapons wildlife to hunt and players to either befriend or to take their stuff. The gameplay is really what you make it. As a warning a lot of players in the game are incredibly toxic (you will see racial slurs and swastikas in front of bases) but not everyone is like that. This game is definitely best played with your friends. The developers are very active through social media and post updates weekly. The game is slated to leave early access in February 2018. I can say this is easily the most enjoyment out of a game I've gotten for $20.

I have played other games like this DayZ H1Z1 and yet this game has grabed my attention the most. I first heard of this game when it was Rust 1.0v and i had heard that there was quite a few bugs and that it would get boring quickly. But now Rust 2.0v modern aesthically pleasing and frequently updated. This game has been great for me and i highly recommend it to anyone who loves openworld survival games!!Also lots of servers so its easy to find one that you like and will play on!!

review: This is an amazing game. I love almost everything about the game. I can only think of one thing that is needed and that is character customization. This probably makes you wonder why I dont recommend it right? Well thats because of the community. The game is amazing but what ruins it is the majority of the players. People will kill you when you dont even have anything worth taking or do not pose any threat. You will spawn in and soon as you wake someone waste their bullets just to kill you and gain literally nothing but a rock and a torch. The people make this game annoying and a pain to play. You will spend hours building up a base just for someone to walk by blow it up take nothing from it kill you then destroy your spawn and leave. This game has no rules to counter that and it really sucks. I didnt listen to the people warning me about this games community and I was so wrong not to. Please DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL THINGS ARE FIXED WITH THE COMMUNITY.

review: Used to be good. Really good but now its complete BP was the best XP system more or less components was still playable but when they mixed BP's with it that's when everything went from going down a hill to down a cliff.There was always a grind in rust but in the end of the day once you grinded your base your XP your BPS or components but now it's a never ending grind upkeep cost (if you are solo and you want to have a decent base with honeycombing prepare for a huge upkeep cost) scrap components and if you are lucky you won't get zerged down in the monuments and get your rather quick but not to worry as this is only temporary you will probably get raided in the next few days and to think your bp's will stay only for a few months before you gotta start grinding for them again. But this time the whole server will be trying to get them.Player communication has completely disappeared the rust community is more toxic then ever it was always but now everyone just wants components and for you to build far away so you do not take any potential resource from them.i made allot of great friends and memories from old rust but now you can't do im 100% confident that on some servers people build sniper towers next to beach just so they could kill fresh spawns fast and they won't have to go out to check if they have loot since they just spawned.If you have no life and sit at home all day and got absolutely nothing else to do and if you got a group of at least 4 5 people who are also playing rust 20/7 then you might as well as by the game you might enjoy it but if you are looking for a game to just chill meet new people and have a laugh and only to spend a few hours now and then (until it will gradually consume you and rust becomes your life) If you have no life and sit at home all day and got absolutly nothing else to do and if you got a group of atleast 4 5 people who are also playing rust 20/7 then you might as well as by the game you might enjoy enjoy it but if you are looking for a game to just chill meet new people and have a laugh and only to spend a few hours every now and then (until it will gradually consume you and rust becomes your life)

review: An unfinished game that will more than likely stay unfinished because it has to dominate the "testers" market like ark and every other crafting game. You basically play solo as someone's slave running around collecting whatever you can until someone who's been playing since server wipe to come and shoot you with a gun and take everything you've collected with their friends. No game has ever quite made me feel like I've been wasting my time as much as this one. More than likely I will get the usual replier "This game just isn't for you it's too hardcore" from I've gathered about the devs yes the game is too hardcore for me to keep track of the outrageous updates they have buffing and nerfing applying seemingly nonsensical mechanics to the game. To each their own.

review: My system specs are above minimum but not quite at recomended. I had a few performance issues. I would recomend treating the recomended system specs as a minimum.I think this would be a fun game if new players could play it. However established players tend to camp out at spawn points and just kill all new players as they respawn which prevents you from being able to get anywhere with the game. They seem to think that killing unarmed people makes them tough or something? I don't know I think a psychologist would have a field day with the type of people this game attracts.The game itself seems fairly well done but the community makes it unplayable. Seems to be something that's common to all Rust servers too. Too bad. I'm glad I didn't pay money for this.

Step away from thy poor peasant or I will bring upon you a pointy reckoning!"&gt I brandish my trusty road sign cleaver&gt they stop blasting smash mouth and turn to look at me&gt the mute savages charge towards me&gt I charge as well&gt their puny wooden spears and no match for my sweet road sign armor and chivalry&gt my trusty road sign cleaver slices them up in no time&gt peasant naked thanks me and offers some sweet sweet medieval bitcoin for my help&gt I tell him that the thrill from doing the work of justice is payment enough&gt he walks away a free and happy man&gt I am a happy knight&gt I continue to traverse the land and speak in old english somehow on shotgun users and spear chucking savages&gt my events are now told as stories throughout this server&gt I am a legend of this wasteland&gt one day I find a group of armored people holding guns&gt they say "Oh yeah it's that weird ing knight who runs all of the place dealing out justice"&gt they yell "Stop right there!"&gt I yell back "No one can stop the work of justice from being done!"&gt I charge&gt they put me down&gt I lay there defeated&gt they surround me&gt turns out they're the pumpkin cult people from before&gt oh &gt they say that they want their revenge and they'll soon take it&gt I ask that they do it under my code so I can die in glory&gt they end up accepting my bargain&gt I'm helped up review: I heard about rust more than a year ago and my curiosity was piqued. I read reviews that were very mixed after the twigs update. I've now logged more than a hundred hours after buying the game a month ago and I have to say I love it. I do play with my two brothers and we generally grind together for at least 15 30 hours a week working towards the same goals and guarding each other. This game is very difficult to play solo and you can expect to get killed for no reason a whole . You're always playing against whoever is on the server at the time so sometimes the things you need to progress just aren't available and that can be very frustrating. The only options are to find a less populated server (most likely a community server not an official server) or play with a group. Hit up discord or by a few copies for some friends. I freaking love this game and it has a ton of potential.

review: This is a game that I used to play a ton of. This is basically a game of factions wars and alliances. In the beginning you are given a rock and a torch (On Most Servers) and have to start by hitting trees and other rocks with your rock. You start to build up gear and a base. When all of this is happening you are also trying to avoid other people or make alliances with them. Once you have a stable econemy going in your area whether it's with your friends by yourself or other people you just met you can start raiding. You raid other peoples bases to either scare them out of your area or for the loot. Raiding can be expensive. Overall this game is pretty fun and enjoyable to play. But after a while it got really repetitive. I would still recommend it.

review: Ok so I'm a newish player so this is from my perspective. First off the game runs well and looks good. With a 1070 / 6600k I can run the game on ultra settings at around 100fps + as long as I'm not using dx 12 version which is experimental anyways. The gameplay feels very polished and all the inventory management is very well done. It's also nice that custom servers are allowed to speed up game progress as many people don't like the slow pace of the default game. Sound design is also good nothing flashy about it as I guess it should be. It's also easy to play with friends and so far easy to learn. The only gripe I have is the XP system. It restricts the ability to build certain things until you get "experience" by doing stuff like crafting. I kind of like it because of the sense of achievement and the fact that it eases new players into things but I can see how experienced players would have gripes with it. Overall the game feels good and satisfying to play and if you are looking for a multiplayer survival game to mess around in with friends it should do the job.

review: I've never played a game that can make me feel the way this game can. The comunity can be rather harsh at times however that is not all this game is. One thing to note is that with this game your experince will be drastically different deopending on if you have friends who play or even depending on what your friends are like. There is no set goal you make it as you go. Playing by yourself can be painful at times yet also really rewarding. Playing with a friend or in a group really shows how team work and communication can be vital to "success". You can have quirky encounters with people and there are really funny moments. There is a dark side too though this game generally rewards you for playing as a "bad guy". (Not always as you may be rewarded by helping others yet it depends on their personal choices.)The adrenaline I have felt playing this game cannot be matched by anything else in the digital world anyways. Don't get too attached to your base or loot. Remember that it is just a game and try to spread some kindness to other players every once in a while. The game can only be as toxic as the people playing it and that includes every one of us.

review: Buried within Rust is a good concept and an average game. Don't get me wrong the game play is well done with a solid foundation but it always leaves you wanting more and doesn't really 'deliver' on that.Additionally starting out in Rust is a nightmare. The Rust community has a few helpful groups to aid you in this and even some helpful servers for it but for the most part you're going to encounter trolling. Since Rust as a concept depends on its over all community and the feelings that it gives off this is a big knock against the project.So first and foremost Rust is not meant to be played alone. I had some good times with some friends but over all my experience was negative even when playing with a group. The most interesting experience I had in the entire game was when two players attacked me and mine and we were all at a fairly similar equipment level I lost that battle but had a blast over all since it was at least an actual fight. That was fun as well as engaging and I can honestly say it was the high point of my entire rust experience save for when I found a private server that was willing to help my group learn how to play. Unfortunently by then the game had soured.You see the rest of the game save for that one battle and the private server always had me running around desperate for equipment and getting shot at by higher geared players with nothing better to do. Resources were impossible to get meeting up with friends was a pain in the and over all this drug what would have otherwise been an exciting style of game down quickly. Even when I found my stride in Rust and thought I was making good progress the game blindsided me. Me and my limited number of weapons could do nothing against a helicopter. So with me seeing no real room for advancement I recognized that my fun with Rust was clearly at an end. There's only so much you can do in a community oriented game that has a very negative over all sentiment and with a difficulty level that fits the 'brick wall' description aptly. The fun ultimately could not survive that.That's the key point. If you think you will enjoy the head bashing style of game then maybe this is for you. It doesn't have the depth of Dark Souls and doesn't have the equity of DayZ and doesn't have a positive community over all.For me it's not to be but if you can over come those issues as I said you will find an average game. The developer recently asked players if he felt they got their 20 dollars worth of entertainment. I did not and would not recommend buying the game at full price.Keep in mine the game is still in development as of the time of this review and communities can evolve. Perhaps one day Rust will come through and become the game I wish it could be.
title: Rust

review: SummaryOverall this IS a good game. The devs are constantly working on the title. Controls Sound Visuals are all good. It is a world I want to be in. Love the building hunting side of the game. The procedural maps are now a nice touch too so can visit a server with a unique map to explore. It s a game that s best played with friends. Having said that there is always aspects that could be improved upon to address a few key complaints from people. Which would also add a new dimension to the game. I really want to see this game reach its full potential. Suggested ImprovementsAI FactionThe game itself is 90% PvP. There are a few animals to kill etc and some exploring to do but there is little PvE content such as an AI faction to fight against. This is something I feel would be a big plus for those players that prefer the PvE side of games and want to co op to beat an "Island Boss" in his gang s fortress. This would probably be the greatest programmatical challenge but would be a big plus for PvE ers.Gangs/ClansNow of course some people have pure PvE servers where PvP has been disabled. Which is good for some that ONLY want the PvE side of things. What's needed is a game mechanic such as "Gangs" (Guilds Clans Corps whatever you wish to call it) So people in the same gang can't hurt each other. That would build in some safety into the game for those that enjoy working in part of a team to achieve goals in construction farming mining etc. This could be a server option. This would help address some of the "toxic" community issues and bring some PvPvE feel a bit more. Spawn protectionThis could be another server option. Make a new spawning player invulnerability for say x number of seconds after every spawn. At least giving them time to NOT be spawn murdered. There would be mechanics that would stop this being abused so for example while spawn invulnerable you cannot go near non gang buildings.PvE player modeThis again can be a server setting. If enabled a player can choose to be in "PvE Mode" only. Meaning they cannot be harmed by other players or indeed harm others. Of course this must also come with mechanisms that stop this being abused. Such as again these players cannot damage or go anywhere near other player s structures. This would suit people that just want to be part of a local community doing things such as hunting mining construction etc. for their gang but get no enjoyment from the PvP side of things.These players would have a marker above their heads to show this status so other PvPers dont waste time trying to kill them. This setting would need a protection timer so you can t just switch it on and of every 5 seconds. And perhaps only apply the setting at login.

This game is the first one ever to have me properly rage quit and call it a day. As an example We moved our base to this nice neighbourhood with a lot of loot rescources and rad animals. Everything was great. Then two people showed up and started killing us for no apparent reason. We tried to take revenge resulting in them stealing all our weapons too. review: Rust is a survival game created by Facepunch Studios. Inspired by games like DayZ Minecraft and Stalker Rust aims to create a hostile environment in which emergent gameplay can flourish. The aim of the game is to survive. To do this the player should gather resources. Hitting a tree with a rock will give you wood hitting a rock with a rock will give you rock and ore. You can then craft a hatchet from the wood and rock allowing you to gather faster. You can go out and hunt a variety of wildlife such as boars chickens rabbits bears wolves and deer. Once you have killed an animal you can butcher it to gather its meat and skin. You can craft a fire using wood and cook the meat inside the fire. Then you can eat. You face two major dangers in game. Rust is a multiplayer game so there will be other players trying to survive in the same way that you are. Unfortunately for you they can find you kill you and take your stuff. Fortunately for you you can kill them and take their stuff. Or maybe you can make friends and help each other survive. Rust s world is harsh so you might need to make friends to survive. The environment is not kind. Bears and wolves will chase and kill you. Falling from a height will kill you. Being exposed to radiation for an extended period will kill you. Starving will kill you. Being cold will kill you.
title: Rust

review: Very interesting game! I like the crafting and the world is absolutely stunning. Survival from the elements animals and PvP. Massive potential for this game!There are some things that do take away some of the fun however. Hacks I've seen it super speed no clipping and all done for the sake of trolling. It's alpha so it's to be expected.Raiding and PvP. This is a tough topic but in a nutt shell it's the "Ah shucks.....someone broke in and stole all my stuff while I was offline. Oh well I'll start agian" 1 day later "hmm..okay it happend again. No worries" 1 day later "Ummm....hmmm. Better build even better D for my home" 1 day later "the hell.....they killed me built walls all around my base with multiple doors? Okay...fine I'll start again...who cares that I spent 25 hours bulding all this stuff" *Runs around collecting stuff and get killed*"Annoying..." *Runing around naked trying to collect resources to build a shack gets shot gun to head* "Grrrrr...."*Spends the next 4 hours building a moderate sized base* "Phew..okay good D on the base time to turn in"*Next day* " #$%!!! Really?? someone built a buttload of stairs all around the base?? that's it Im not wasting anymore time with this"It's Alpha yup. Great playing with some friends. However when you invest time and effort just for it to be ruined on a constant basis...all of a sudden its not fun anymore. I honestly don't know how some of those issues could be solved in PvP.And thats the biggest problem...PvP should be an integral part of this game. However PvP ruins the fun at the same time.It's gotten so bad that I have moved to a non PvP server but eh....It's so....50/50...I love this game...and I hate it.I want to recommend this..but I can't in this state.Might be more viable in the future....I hoping!

review: The concept is great Survival in a post apocalyptic landscape with limited resources. Starting off naked with just a rock and a torch and working your way up from there. The graphics are nice and the gameplay feels challenging and exciting. The possibility of death is always near be it in the form of other players and wild animals. So far so good.Sadly many factors make this game an unenjoyable experience for me overall The game has severe framedrops which makes it near impossible to hunt animals and makes even the most mundane tasks frustrating. Advanced players with rifles continuously kill naked starters that only have a rock. Resources are incredibly scarce to the point of frustration. I played for two in game days without coming across a single stone deposit. Stones are needed to craft even the most basic tools. The whole map is completely filled with player built structures. Within hours of a server wipe it becomes virtually impossible to find a place to build a house and call your own even when walking several hours from your spawn point in a procedurally generated map. Russian hackers are everywhere.Should these issues be addressed I would love to recommend this game. In the current state however I simply cannot.

review: I watched a play throuh on YouTube and wanted to try it for myself. It seemed to me like a game i could pop on a server with a bunch of friends and just have a good couple hours of fun.With in two mins i was shot 3 times and hunted down into the ocean where I proceeded to drown. I switched servers to one labeled 'friendly' and sure enough there were some helpful people that were kind enough to show me the ropes of the game and how to get around its overall glitchiness. The instant I headed off into a wooded area of the map i saw a few horses and a deer. I tried to attack it with my spear but it teleported to the top of a few boulders ran in a few circles teleported down and convolsed its way across the field. Even though it was a funny moment for a game thats been in developement for well over 2 years I expected that they would have worked these things out. After maybe a good 10 mins of just wondering around some kid (im guessing like 10) attacks me even after I yelled "Im friendly! Im friendly!" after maybe a dozen times. After I talked to a few people in game and they discovered that I was infact female I was harrassed multiple times by nearby players (again 10 year old boys) and who then made multiple threats towards me and a partner that I was tagging along with. I ended up dying a few more times before I ended up rage quitting. I personally would only recommend this game if you have a gang of maybe 10 people who you trust dearly. The majority of the community are 10 13 year old boys who think that being massive wads is acceptable. Along with the disgustingly vulgar underage community the game is lacking major updates and ways to promote a friendly gaming environment. Update 7/28/16 I popped on to another server recently and was surprised on the new updates that were added to the game. I enjoy the whole concept of leveling up to learn new recipes instead of having to run around looking fro blueprints while trying to avoid getting shot at. I recently met a band of players that helped me out and we teamed up to work on building a base. We took over someones empty raided base and now we are at war with the previous owners. ATM im shut up in an old base while the other members are offline and being camped by others. Its a fun game if you find the right people and they are a dimond in the rough.

review: After countless days of grinding fighting winning losing quitting and returning over and over i've decided to write my review. This game is so much more than you'd ever expect. I used to love every minute of rust even just walking around and exploring the maps at this time it was just a simple fun survival game to me. Then I made the mistake of taking this game way too seriously. Success was all that mattered to me if I wasnt winning it wasn't fun. Toxic players countless deaths losing resources it took hours to get in 2o seconds. This is just the surface of the frustrations any player will face. This game can be the most fun youll ever have with a ton of content and play time for $20 but it can also tear away at your sanity and ruin your whole day/week. Do I reccommend this game for casual players? No way this game is gut wrenchingly difficult with the only real challenge being other people. If youre willing to grind practice and play for hours on end this is the game for you. For me this game started to feel like a job it was no longer fun only stressful. Even with all that being said I know deep down that I will eventually come back to this game because thats the type of game it is.

review: This Game is great before buying this game I watched streams of people who played it That just made me want to buy it more plus most of my friends on steam have it. I've been playing it a lot and every week they have an update that adds more or makes performance better. This is survival its fun not dealing with zombie but with people and nature. What you put in is what you get out. You might start out confused but as you play you learn. This game just gets better and better It is in alpha but its more the community deside what gets put in the game and what doesn't the Devs just give the idea. The Devs are always updating there public on what there doing mostly on Twitter but on there website. They have an Devblog showing off the update stuff and what they are working on and the Communty Updates which showcase the players and there creation. They also have a subreddit for bugs and glitches that people can report that makes the game even better. Over all great community amazing Devs great content. Keep in mind there are cheaters and hackers but not everywhere and don't let that stop you from having a good time so if you love survival and PvP and PvE.Then buy this game what are you waiting for.

review: This game is no longer playable.When i started playing this game when it first came out it wasn't even on steam it was played on their website so i've followed throught this games entire development process. It started out with a lot of promise and was honestly quite a lot of fun and that stayed true for a long time even after they decided to remove legacy and remake the game when they moved it to steam. After the remake it was still fun i played a lot of solo and then i also told 2 of my friends to get it and we enjoyed they game. But after a while the devs started making some questionable decisions and we started to take more and more breaks from the game part because we had played it so much and because the game was becoming worse and worse. Then almost from nowhere came the xp system instead of the bp system. This change completly ruined rust for the few months that the system was active. After the devs realised their mistake the decided to change the system again to the component system which was fun... for about half a wipe. Because the componenet system made it so that servers died faster clans had it even than before components took up so much space and there was no real progression anymore. Seing as you could have end game items in the matter of 1 or 2 hours. And now the ing game wom't even run properly and after about 4 or 5 hours of trying to fix this to give it one last try i've given up. This game is dead to me even though i want to like it looking at the game compared to what it could've been and what decisions are made by helk the game is dying it will never live up to the potential it had. Edit they just reintroduced bp combined with components this has made the game playable again for me however im still not sure wether i can recommend it yet. I will play a few wipes and see.

review: Well... I played rust almost from the beginning of its journey to the world.. First months of this game were certainly better although more ''rusty''.. nowdays this game is just 'STAY THE AWAY'. The optimization is horrific.. with a monster pc i can barely play it on medium graphics Gameplay is just random. You cant shoot its buggy and most of the times you get oneshot by someone that didnt actually wanted to shoot you in the head. Theres no mathematics and calculations as well.. sometimes you die of headshots sometimes not. Completely random. Mechanics are just laughable. On day 1 you get a big base and machine guns which you can craft easily if you have a big group. If not... 'STAY THE AWAY' parable. Bad developing team is bad. These guys keep making tha game worse and worse.. i mean how the heck can you do that... They can though. RAIDS. Raiding is just pointless.. most of the times you can wait until someone is offline and get his house.. its no fun and i really cant see why the heck is that easy to raid someones house.. (if its not badly built). WIPE WIPE WIPE WIPE WIPE WIPE EVERY MONTH. COME ON ITS ON ALPHA... WHAT? ALMOST 2 YEARS? HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!To end.. i would recommend to 'STAY THE AWAY' of this ''game''. The community others stress out is logical for this kind of game i would say. So no probs there.If i could i would get my money back.. i had good times but these guys are a joke just like their game. And im not even sorry to them out like this. Because this could be a great game but its and getting more byt the hour.And for the video.. and the part ''make friends'' THERE ARE NO FRIENDS IN RUST. ONLY HOSTILE RUSSIANS THAT ARE YOUR ENEMY.I KNOW THAT BECAUSE IM RUSSIAN. AND I AM YOUR ENEMY.

review: Currently RUST is going the way of the first release of All Points Bulletin. Hackers. Oh my god the hackers. The worst part is that even if you have a computer capable of recording via fraps or some other screenshotting software VAC bans don't seem to be doing anything. The server that just made me quit this game was an Official server. One of maybe 11 out of several thousand. It also wouldn't let me pull up a list of current players via steam so I couldn't even report the individual who was doing it.When I killed someone at a loot shack who had been stalking me his friends teleported to my brand new base and seeingas there is no way to see who is inside it called over voice chat to give his stuff back. Huh. Very good guess in a server with one of the highest populations. I opened the door and blasted the first one but suddenly was dead due to three headhsots from a pistol. Wow. Amazing aim.Think you're gonna run away from someone? Haha speed hacks are a thing. And the BEST part is that they are ALL toggleable. I understand the game is in Alpha but it's currently an unplayable alpha. I've been reduced to walking the map just shooting people because when I built an elaborate base a hacker was able to TP straight to me kill me then dump all of my possessions on the floor. Will the game be fun and playable someday? Damn I sure hope so. This game without hacks would be excellent. But that isn't this game right now. I am upset I even spent money on a game without some form on anti hack software. Save your money and wait for a full release. Oh and Steam? Could you please get on banning people for cheating like you said you would?

review: Love the concept. Start with nothing and then build yourself a defendable home to gather and survive. Get a few friends and conquerBuilding is fairly intuitive. Some of the recipes seem a bit resource pricy but overall balance seems ok.Lots of life on servers.Sound is amazing. Gun shots in the distance. helicopter patrolling. occlusion is really good.graphics are pretty good.This is about as true to post apocolyptic as you'll getvery immersiveemotional rollercoaster lol. excitement anger happyness disappointment. you will swear and laugh and fist pump. count on it.Cons The random loot barrels/boxes in the world are a bit too many and skew the balance. A chance find of a gun and you are a big step ahead.Hard to get anything establish if you are not in the know of exactly when a server is gonna be wipedWill have to make some alliances to thrive so buy it for a friend too.No center dot for "from the hip" attacks. Assume that there are others who will dot their screen for the huge advantage so seems like a decent thing to add to ensure others can't gain an advantage from external sources.food is super scarce. Not sure what i will do when christmas presents go away...Overall a really good game. you may not love it but you will absolutely not be disappointed.

review: What can be said that hasn't already been said Rust is a super fun game. Challenging yes but it's the closest thing you'll get to experience the thrill/terror of living in a post apocalypse world where you're on your own to survive counting on no one looking over your back all the time for any and all dangers that threaten your very existance. Learn to trust some you meet but still keeping one hand at the ready for any sense of betrayal when your back might be turned. Experince the joy and relief of contructing your first small base to keep your basic survival gear safe and giving you a spawn point so you don't have to start all over again.To those of you still on the fence buy now before the price goes up on Feb. 8th 2018. You won't regret it. And thanks to Facepunch for helping me waste 3000+ hours of my life. lol

review: This game is like the hunger games but much MUCH WORSE! If you are new to the game ill just let you know that there are alot of naked men and women throwing rocks and trying to survive against animals amd other naked people. But you will have to survive yourself. Yes. yourself. You will start to hallucinate and every sound you hear will feel like someone is creeping up on you coming for their next kill or every crackling sound will sound like a gun reloading. Its a scary place out there. There are the good the bad and then the very evil. The evil will make you a prisoner or a slave. They will keep you locked up forever or until your mind gives in and you type "kill" in console. They will feed cans of tuna when available and sometimes spare logs of wood. The evil might sometimes talk to you saying "It puts the lotion on its skin or it gets the hose again" and by hose i mean they dump charcoal on you. If you buy this game just be ready for full on war of the nude. But over all great game. 20/10 IGN

Lag. Now before you go screaming at me "IT'S IN ALPHA YOU STOP JUDGING IT" I understand that. But the fact of the matter is the game is so poorly optimized and the Rust developers just keep implimenting new gear and weaponry without fixing the bugs and lag issue they had before hand... Now I have nothing else against rust other than the unoptimization is almost making it impossible to fight with...I'd recommend this game to anyone it's 10/10 but this is just a message of a community member reaching out to the developers hoping to make an impact...

Thats how i see it there are the Friendlys who are the miniority (im one of them P) they usually dont fight unless forced and have the general view to help people then there are the Regulars these people shoot or talk based on whatever they think they fight some time for pleasure or for some other reason nice people to talk to bad to have as your enemy then you have what i like to call the bandits now these people unless you are one are generally unpleasent to be with as they kill everyone and everyone except for theyre steam friends or clan they are generally toxic and rude and will taunt constantly in chat and be well. a Now thats what anyone can assume in a game correct? now heres what I say if you want this game to play yourself and learn the mechanics then yes get this game if you want it to group with friends and become great in a clan then yes get this game aswell but if you want to be friends with everyone and happy sunshine turn back now because you will be slaughtered like cattle.Hope this helped Pat

review: * UPDATE *JUST TROUBLESHOOTING THIS HAS NOW CAUSED MY COMPUTER TO BLUE SCREEN FOR THE FIRST TIME IN ABOUT 3 YEARS. AVOID AT ALL COSTSMost of this playtime has been spent troubleshooting. I very rarely have issues with games and this is getting frustrating.1.There is no full screen option in the game. As most people know windowed is performance wise and especially on Rust it causes a lot of screen tearing. I had to enter a launch command into steam. 2.No V Sync have to force through Nvdia control panel. 3.Anti Cheat Software has started malfunctioning and is making it impossible to play I cannot get logged into a server. 4.Frame rates in game are bad even with 8 gigs of vram and every setting turned low or off. 5.Mouse has stopped working in game will work in menus but won't move camera around. Very dissapointing amount of bugs for this game. Close to giving up.

review: This game is completely and utterly consumed by cheaters. The game is almost unplayable by non cheaters as a result of the many cheats exploits and hacks that are constanly exercised by other players. A simple internet search will reveal just how easy it is for any kid to become god against players who do not use such cheats. Also you should be warned that this gaming community is extremely hostile not only through gameplay but social interaction as well. The vast majority of players are hard core Rustians whom KoS (Kill on Sight) and mock those players which are trying to get established in the game (aka noobs). The official servers are unattended garbage while the community servers make up the bulk of the player population. However be prepared for admins that give themselves and donators tremendous advantages almost to the point of making this a Pay to Win title. The devs have abandoned original rust in it's entirety to focus all of their time on the "experimental" version which will be replacing the version you see here. Until that becomes a reality do not buy this game.
title: Rust

review: A very cool and unique game. Worth every penny it's also cheaper than its rival 7 days to die. Even though the game is in it's alpha stage it is indeed very playable minor bugs here and there but that won't spoil the fun. The A.I is dumb had to say it zombies get stuck and might ignore your presence and if a hostile A.I starts following you he'll ignore everyone except you meaning a person can dodge and another person can keep whacking him from the back. The game has a nice array of tools and items at you disposable including rifles pistols bows flare and not to mention a freaking C4. The map is very large! very difficult to find friends to meet and regroup. You still can't share doors meaning if you are planning to build a house for 3 then you need 3 doors /. I'll conclude with a tip use a microphone saved my life multiple times and find a secret spot for your house raiders are all over the game.. ) good luck!

review: People that have over 100 hours into this game and give it a bad review they're just salty becasue they got screwed.Fact is Rust is post apocalyptic life. The proceduarally generated worlds are simply beautiful. It can take you off guard.But then you realize nature is beautiful but also cruel.The wolves the bears the radiation are nothing. The real danger lies in the people. Who can you trust?You're new friend may just be waiting for you to fall asleep and eat your meat. Freshly roasted over the campfire under some damp dungy rock shelter as the dark of night envelops the land.You awake from a deep sleep hogtied. Is that my leg on the campfire?Oh but there is hope. You can fortify your base build vault doors reminiscent of those Vault Dwellers from Vault 101. But then an airplane flies overhead dropping a blueprint for C4. And BOOM! You are officially in the Danger Zone.Hunt craft build explore learn trust or distrust. Post apocalyptic survival in its finest and most gruesome form.

review: I have been playing rust on and off since zombies and there have been ups and downs. The community has always been horrible. People are seen as resource nodes and anyone not in chat are kill on site. For every 10 25 people that will kill you 1 might be friendly for a bit then kill you. Rust was going threw a phase of increasing the play ability for the pve er of the group but has since reversed any gain and went in the complete other direction. Currently the game is unplayable. It is a great game and there is plenty of fun to be had if you want a large scale arena deathmatch with a few minutes to hours to get equipped instead of spawning in with your loadout in a smaller arena.Rust has some of the best base building in the survival universe. This part of the game is why I have so many hours and I still keep an eye on it. destructible bases provides a nice designing challenge. This coupled with location specific building challenges allows the free form building of fun bases. Many players however watch the latest youtube and scout for a location to build the same base they watched.If you like to interact with strangers and find helping out people to be enjoyable this is not the game for you. If you like cs go cod or other kill people for the sake of killing people games then this is right up your ally.I currently recommend this game for the group of players that will love it. If you have ever enjoyed pve in a multi player survival game there are much better games out there for you.

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and it destroyed me. My mother said to me 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 18 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because your game gave me cancer anyway.

review: For playing a good amount I feel like it is time to make a review.First off never play on official server they are filled with hackers who never get banned as much so your better off playing community servers as they are better and have good anti cheat. You're also going to want to bring a friend as the game is rather hard play solo (I live the solo experience) but there are servers where it is solo only so you don't have to deal with large groups of people weilding guns. The weekly updates are awesome as they usually contain one new item added into the game along with the skins you can buy which are pretty nice. Though your going to want to find a stable community too as after wipe day you will see lots of people online but a couple days later the population is very low like 10 to 20 people online. I would also avoid servers that contain toxic and rude people as they can ruin the game for you. Other than that the game pretty awesome and I would totally recommend buying )

review: Ok i'm nearing almost 1000 hours in this game so i'm guessing it's time for a review Let me start with saying Rust has changed alot over time and not every change was positive. Facepunch has tried to balance the game more and more which of course is understandable but they sometimes forget not everybody has alot of time to play this game. I don't play as much as I used to in the past which means I simply cannot play Vanilla anymore for the following reasons Rust Vanilla is just no fun anymore. It is an endless grind for Blueprints and resources and if you're a solo player you can pretty much forget about it unless you wanna spend a couple hours every day. The only way Rust Vanilla can still be fun is if you play with a large group. That way you can share Blueprints and resources. In the past being in a group also was easier obviously but as a solo player you still stood a chance because you could get your hands on better tools and guns. Now this is way harder if you're on your own. So they think they helped to balance the game with this but really they made it just harder for solo players.This wasn't always the case. About a year ago Rust Vanilla was still a great experience. Of course gathering resources took alot of time but you at least could craft everything right away. Now you need to spend almost an entire day to find the blueprint of a better tool which you need to farm resources. So if you play Vanilla prepare to spend alot of your time hitting trees and rocks with the worst tool available in the game which just means grinding and grinding and grinding.Another big downside of Vanilla is the introduction of Workbenches. Workbenches is what you need to stand next to to craft basic stuff. So no more crafting on the run. Horrible decision. These awful things require a shatload of scrap (more like crap) which getting your hands on also means extra grinding.So Blueprints and Workbenches was a terrible move by Facepunch and have pretty much ruined the Vanilla Experience for Rust.Another thing that is worthy of mentioning is that the Tool Cupboards have changed alot. Over time a Tool Cupboard had a radius of 50m to protect your base and people coulnd't ladder up your base when they were within it's zone. Now a days you need a single Tool Cupboard for your base and it expands all around your base no matter how big or small it is but they can ladder up your base easily. I also dislike this because now everybody just roofraids you. Getting raided is easy now so I prefer playing on Modded servers that still block any form of building in someone else's Tool Cupboard radius.This game is still great fun if you play Modded. Modded has alot more support for solo players since most Modded servers have faster gathering rates or don't require the need for Blueprints at all. So if you're like me and only play in the weekends or maybe like an hour during the week Modded is still the way to go.So if you're gonna play solo make sure to play Modded on a x5 server. I also recommand playing on a server that doesn't require the need for Blueprints or the need for a Workbench. That is hands down the most fun experience for this game.I highly not recommand getting this game if you wanna play Vanilla on your own because that way it's almost like a fulltime job to get a fun experience.Downsides of Rust Vanilla Endless grind for Blueprints to unlock basic stuff Endless grind for resources (this wasn't the case before but it is now because you have bad tools untill you found better blueprints and you also need more resources to upkeep your base). Building upkeep Everybody can just build up your base with ladders or twig building and raid you from thereSo in short Rust Vanilla vs Rust ModdedRust Vanilla Not RecommandedRust Modded Highly Recommanded
