review: Well... After a little bit over 300 hours on Rust I think it's time for a review. Let me start off by saying Rust is an amazing game and I recommend anyone to pick it up. The crafting system is fabously created along with building plans jazz. The game revives multiply updates and hot fixes through out the month which keeps the game enjoyable to play and has good replayablity. There was a certain update sorry that I can't remember it off the top of my head but the update featured where you were able to build on top of people's bases which made you think differently about the game and made you create based in different ways which in my opinion brought more life into the game. The game does have an issue with open mic which creates a bunch of toxicity and might drive some people away from the game. But reporting them will help bring the community to a better stance on this. (Do it!) The game also features a karate verity of weapons anywhere from small melee based weapons to Rockets and C4s. Mountuments are also a big feature in this game this is usually the main place you would want to go for loot also the roads are a fairly decent place to get loot as well. They recently added a mounument called the "Launch Site" which has a tank protrolling the area defeating it will give loot as well. There is also a day and night cycle which in this game actually does something. At night it is pure black and your only source of light will be your torch and swimming in the water at night will make you cold which will cause you to lose health unless you create a fireplace. In conclusion I would give this game a 8/10 enjoy!

review: This game has come along way and has had uphill and downhill moments. At its current state it is still a fun game (as it has been and will always be) its just a endless grinding cycle to level up by yourself. If you dont have a group this game is pretty much not one you should pick up.The postives outshine the negatives though so that is amazing.The PvP One of the best you will find requires skill it makes your adrenalline start to pump and makes you want to finish off that group or person you're fighting.The Resourcing Pretty much you just hit stuff for resources ( i know sounds boring but it is fun at times if you're with friends)The Crafting makes sense already will make more sense on november 3rd 2016 when the new componet system is coming out.Finally... The Toxic (But Salty and hilarious community) it is fun getting in arguments when you just triple headshot someone who didn't have a chance to say you and they talk mad beef in chat. Definitly a +i would give this game a 9/10 just for it is not perfect but will eventually become amazing like when the BP System was here.Oh and P2 Nerf Didn't need to happen !

review: Now that I have 150 hours in this game and it just left early access I will write a review. This game is amazing while I go on hour long rants about how bad the community can be and that I took a couple month long break I still adore this game. The graphics are great and the gameplay is amazing. I don't know if the main stream is ready for the gameplay which consists of a really hard experience to learn the game. You spawn in and try to gather materials most of the time get shot but when you don't you get a base. This base feels great to keep upgrading and get all your bp's. Or you get eoka raided when you go to eat dinner. Thats the problem with new people trying to start the game is brutal and the clans and people who somehow get every gun within hours cause physical and mental pain when they kill you. And the community can be terrible when they say welcome to rust when you get mad. I'm so glad this game gets developed so much by facepunch and that they are so great at releasing weekly updates. While some updates are pointless (flares) they still respond to the community and make great updates most weeks. I was so happy to see rust now available on steam but I don't know if a lot of the mainstream can handle the pain of dying. The graphics gameplay aesthetic and developers are great. Looking forward to a good 900 more hours 9/10.

review: This game is still under development It has the best most caring and active developers I've ever seen. They listen to the players and constantly try to improve the game. Sometimes the changes are good sometimes bad. But if you've been playing long enough you can see how far the game has come and how much stuff they've added.Despite many hours I'm not particularly good at the game but I still enjoy it nonetheless. I've made a lot of friends in the game and also a lot of enemies. If given the chance Rust is definitely a unique gaming experience that is well worth the money. I'm excited to see where the game ends up once it leaves early access one day.

review: First off for transparency sake I don't enjoy this game very much. I enjoy it in the company of friends and I believe that is how it should be played. This game is a grindy hard to understand game. The official trailer does not describe this game what so ever. Please before purchasing this game do some reasearch to see what it is truely about. It is a survival game where you join a server that has reset that day you build a house get weapons and your two main objectives are to expand your base to further protect your growing stockpile of weapons and resources and use those weapons and resources to destroy other people and their base. Playing alone on an official server will make you refund the game. The good players play on official servers I suggest going to community for a smaller player count try looking for a solo only server as on official servers there are large clans of 8 20 people. If you want to enjoy the game playing solo look up how to build bases and learn how to fight. There are community deathmatch and battle royale servers that can help with this. Playing with a group is optimal for a game like this. If you wish to compete on official servers you need at least 4 people who are exceptionally skilled at the game. We are talking like 800 1000 hours. You will come across people that are on 18 hours a day and have 2500 hours on the game along with their 9 buddies that have the same statistics. It is not fun fighting those. I'm just trying to give you a picture of how I view this game. The community is cruel and toxic. Do not play alone. Know what you are getting your group into and if you are well edcuated enough proceed. I only play with a group of people and I only farm with them getting wood and stone occasionally helping them out in a big fight flanking with something cheap like an SMG but every person has a diffrent role at least in our group. Seriously play with friends only way you can enjoy the game if at all.You have been warned. This is a toxic and competetive game and you can and will be outnumbered. I can not say wether or not I reccomend it so I am just putting it as I do the choice is up to you I just gave you my raw rambling thoughts.
title: Rust

review: My best and worst moments have been in Rust. Such a variety of emotions can't be delivered by any other game.One week you could build your base up get some weapons make some allies and maybe fire some shots at a couple odd nakeds with foreign accents. It could be a mellow week with minimal hiccups in terms of progression. The next week you could build a small 2x1 hut and never build a proper base because you're being shoved into intense firefights near monuments you built too close to kill a geared player and run away with all their stuff then log on to find a five player group take it all away in an instant. Not being attached to your items in this game is a good skill be prepared to lose a lot of your This game is well worth the price as the developers have really put their all into this. I urge that you (and your friends) buy the game and give it a shot. This game is a wild ride.

review: I bought this game in alpha stage a month back and It was 10 dollars it looked fun. I bought it. I hopped into a server and found myself naked on the beach with a rock and a torch. Like any survival game I looked for rocks and trees. Then out of nowhere was shot by a guy who was fully geared and had at least 4 guns in his hotbar. I respawned and this time was able to gear up and make a small base. It was small but it worked. I killed people got airdrops. Made friends exactly as the game says you will. Although the servers take a while to load the payoff is worth it.Pros lots of map to explore and varying maps helicopter fights can happen and are intense with friends the game can be lots of funCons game now costs 35$ three and a half times what I origanally paid for it gunfights are annoying as you almost always just either instantly die or you instantly kill them it's very frustrating to get off the game in your base and come back not only dead but your base looted and now have to start back from square oneOverall The game is very fun in general but in the fifty hours i've played there are countless rage inducing things that were completely out of my control.A 8/10 for it's 10$ versionfor 35$ though? wait for a huge sale otherwise? a 6.5/10

review: I no longer have as much ethusiasm for this game. Have not played or seen it in a long time. So this review may not longer be proper. But here was what I once thought of the game below!I love this game! It teaches you some of lifes most important rules. 1. Never trust anything.2. Walking around the wilderness WILL get you lost. 3. Bears don't want you to pet them... They want food! AND YOUR THE FOOD! 4. Everything you have worked hard to earn will be taken from you..... Unfairly! 5. EVERYONE DIES! 6. You can bend metal into perfectly acceptable guns with your hands. Seriously though this game does do a couple things very well. It is a massive world! And your going to get lost! It takes hours and hours of gameplay before you learn how to find your way around. When it's dark out it's REALLY dark...... don't wonder around in the dark.... your going to get hurt killed or perhaps just trapped down a pit of rocks like I did. You could market this game as a get lost simulator and it would be worth the money on just that aspect alone.
title: Rust

review: Lots of official servers and community servers to choose from based on if you're new (solo/duo/trio is good) or if you're skilled and have lots of people to play with (clan servers) and different mods drop rates etc. Looting gathering and farming are straightforward and easy even for the newest of players. If you don't know what to get just search the item by pressing Q and typing the item that you want and it tells you what you're going to need. The hardest thing about this game is finding a nice build that is hard to raid for your base. The only downsides I've found with this game is that in the 40 hours I've played I've already ran into multiple cheaters that will only get 100% headshots.

review: I woke up naked and afraid. Other naked guys with long wooden pigstickers jabbed at me while dancing around howling like monkeys. I ran still naked and afraid. The distant fields and wooded areas offered little solace and I was soon slumped over in a pool of my own frothy blood simply because I had no time to react from the thunderous crack that ripped through the air from behind me. I couldn't even clothe myself and these guys had guns. FML.Respawning over and over I came to learn the ways of this strange and wonderful land. I brought down my first kill and for a single night feasted like a King! With hunger at bay I could explore my surroundings some more and ultimately carved out my own remote corner where I could buld a small but sturdy structure to make it through the night in. I fashioned simple garb to keep warm with. I crafted primitive weapons. I learned to harvest the land's bouty and turn what I unearthed into better and better items. Soon I too had guns.The prey was now the predator and I learned to strike at those who would take what I had. I could defend myself. I could force my will upon others. I could take what they had. Now I was a King!

review: Interesting and fun game concept that is unfortunately soured by an immature community.Your house will more often than not be raided when you are offline and your items stolen or despawned just so you won't have anything to come back to. Some people will also go to the extent that they build difficult to destroy items in doorways to greif you or just demolish your base entirely.You will be shot on sight or stabbed by every player you come across no exceptions no conversations. People are not willing to trust one another for fear of being tricked causing the playerbase to become a self perpetuating kill on sight mess.You will be shot at by highly geared players when you spawn in like some kind of sport.While being shot at after spawning other players that have just spawned will try to kill you with their rocks "just because".Numbers Power. If you do not have people to play Rust with you will be repeatedly killed and greifed as listed above.Time Power. If you do not have many many hours to defend your base and grind for resources to construct some of the more elaborate buildings you will get targetted by people that do.Mechanically the game is very fun with only one glaring bug that I have come across (animals run through solid objects). The community playing Rust however is awful forcing me to not recommend the game.EDIT I'm not going to change what was initially written here but I will update this review after a year of game progress with my thoughts now that there have been some major changes to the systems within.A lot of what i've written in my earlier review still stands. If you build a house it will get raided every time you log off by people who are miles ahead of you in power using explosives to take out your budget little stone shack in the off chance it contains anything of value.What makes this into something that isn't so game breakingly annoying anymore is the fully revamped crafting system. Rather than requiring a home in which to place a fire smelter and other such crafting tables you are now able to craft the majority of things through your inventory alone. Any items that require higher level materials such as metal can also be obtained by raiding radtowns and using the free Recycler in almost every one to break down items into components.Using this system I have personally been able to make myself some nice armour and a crossbow without ever placing even a fire.Nomad style gameplay will become your best friend as a solo survivor and thankfully the game actually supports this as a viable albeit more difficult mode of playing Rust.The community is still as terrible as ever. What feels like 99% of other players will shoot you on sight out of paranoia that the other person will do it first. Do not expect to make friends.The game still has some issues with optimisation considering the detail in the models and textures I would have expected a more stable framerate on my rig (GTX 680 + 3770k both overclocked). It has a very cartoon ey asthetic which suits the game well it's like Team Fortress had a lovechild with Mad Max.The playerbase is still extremely active with servers here in Australia easily hitting 350+ players during prime time. I can't foresee the game being empty any time soon.Overall I think the changes to the crafting system alone are enough for me to push my review to Reccomended. The game is very fun to play as a roguelike multiplayer survival. I hope to see more optimisation in the future.
title: Rust

review: This game is heading in a bad direction. I have played a lot of this game and had a lot of great experiences. From being part of a large group to playing as a solo survivor. Unfortunately the developers have decided to move this game in a direction that forces a specific type of play and makes it very difficult for new players to become involved with the game. The constant focus on rewarding large clans and groups while nerfing the early game for new players is ruining what made rust great. The flexibility to play the game the way you want. Most recently with the new XP system and changes to early game weapons they made it so a new player literally has no way to defend themselves when they start. They must farm or gather to get enough resources to level up and craft a spear. Usually just to give up these resources to other players before they can even craft a spear. This is made even worse by the fact that the XP system clearly rewards larger groups who can coordinate the XP sharing to quick level their members.I honestly hope this game turns around because it is one of my top games of all time. Let's hope the developers pull their head out of the sand long enough to see they have something that can be great.
title: Rust

review: Rust Is One of those open world Sanbox that has a Minecraft (yes Theres crafting) S.T.A.L.K.E.R (i would say becuase of Zombies and radiation) Dayz (Pvp Loot raiding) kinda feeling. Personally I think if your alone the game gets 10x more challenging knowing you have to fight the night bandits and doing 100% of the work by yourself. If you Do get this game Get some friends. It makes The game So much better. Either persuade your friends to get this or hope to find that one golden nugget person who actually is there to be your friend. Theres also a few bugs I should talk about. In the Version of alpha im running (30th dec.)((i think)) gun models all look the same so u cant tell if the guy has a rock or 9mm pistol. or the m4a1 and Mossberg Shotgun have the same model as well. while in the players hand you can tell because they do look different but if you look at another player the guns have same models. This is also one of the best day/night cycles ive seen because at night it gets so dark you literally cant see anything and you freeze if u dont have clothes and a campfire and in the day the sun gets so bright if u look in its direction u cant see anything. I do Recommend this game because you have to realize that this is alpha and these things can be subect to change.Alpha version 9/10 *must play*

review: This will be one hell of a game.With all the upcoming new contents and features it'll sure be a masterpiece.Highly recommend for people who are searching for a survival game in the wilderness.You have a good friend or maybe 2 3 who would like this too? Ask them to enjoy it with you! Together it's much more fun.The first 2 ingame days maybe a pain but with friends you can easily build things up.If you are more the "solo survivalist" no problem! Search for a hidden place maybe behind some big or small mountains where its unlikely that someone in the next days will come.Build your little shelter for the first ingame week and begin to harvest wood to begin to build you dream survival house.Let's go hunting! First for animals then for humans.Better don't run up the streets the first week without a gun.Things can change very fast.A sunny wood harvest day can easily be a struggle when doing so.But check it out yourself! Résumé Rust is an absolute blast when it comes to a survival game!

review: Early Thoughts Rust is a truly fun game that is taking a bit of a different viewpoint on the survival genre. No zombies. I love zombies but there are at least 5 games out currently (in early access) trying to be "THE ZOMBIE" game. Rust has other creatures you have to survive from including wolves and other players.One interesting mechanic is that your player location is stored on the server and you character still persists after you log out. Making you feel the need to check in on your character to make sure he hasn't been murdered or generally bamboozled.VOIP is a good feature in this game as it allows you to try to build relations using your own charisma. It doesn't always work and most people will attack you regardless but there have been a few times where this has saved my life and the player taught me more about the game and how to survive. Thanks Luke! )The most intense moment that I have experienced so far I saw 2 people meet up in the middle of the field about 50 yards away as I crept through the high grass (naked as you start the game). One man was naked and the other was fully clothed and in a red shirt. A few tense seconds passed and it felt as if the 2 were friends. Suddenly the red shirted man shot the naked man and looted his corpse. I was slowly approaching but then realized I had to get out of dodge. I crept away silently and cried myself to sleep.Rust is coming along nicely but still has a ways to go to be "THE SURVIVAL GAME" of the century.Early Review 74/100Pro'sGraphicsGameplayYou can troll people.Con'sUI can be tricky some of the items feel hidden or less obvious such as the crafting button which is 50% of the game.Trolls.

review: I know this is an early access game so I am writing this review for the development of the game and ways for the game to improve. This game is a very great game perfect for people who love Minecraft. I first saw this game and it looked very fun and a great way to play with my friends. It has great scenery and a very open environment which I love. The thing is my computer is a decent computer I can play almost all of my games without lag issues (unless sometimes if it's due to MMO internet connection). I have a 500 GB computer with a video card for my games so my games are usually very fast when I play them. However when I purchased this game and I went on a server I was unable to play the game due to excessive amounts of lag throughout the game. I did put my graphics and effects to the lowest settings in the game but it did not help. The game was causing a lot of trouble making me unable to even walk around without experiancing massive lag. I do like this game and the gameplay is fun. And I do suggest this game but waiting for the actual game to come out would be the best option. The lag in this game is very annoying and bothersome so unless you have a perfect computer I would wait. Wait for the updates to come and wait for the early access to end. Wait until the game is updated fully and a game that is fully developed. I think that if you wait for the game to update and solve these issues more the game will be worth the wait.Thanks.

review: Rust is a very unique game. It is not a game for everyone. One person could love the game finding it's all or nothing PVP style exciting while another could find it annoying to get killed when collecting wood. Rust is really what you make out of it and it's about forming alliences with other groups or clans. While solo play is possible it is extremely difficult on higher pop servers (But some people like the difficulty)Rust is a huge investment if you plan on playing on a competitive level. Which can wear one thin. I recommend everyone try it out play solo play with a group. see what the game has to offer. It's less of a survival game but more of a FPS tacked on with a few survival elements.Base building could be better as everyone mustly uses cookie cutter designs to help limited raid loss (If you haven't play this game before a determined group could get into your base and well ruin it)While I personally think I'm done with Rust for a bit I'm sure I'll come back as the developers are ALWAYS making changed and are very active on reddit and their forums.Enough rambling pick it up try it and try not to die.

Learning curve is extreme but even the most casual players can find fun in lootingthe map and protecting their base.

review: It's a vert well concepted game with a ton of room for innovation and improvement. Of course it has issues ranging from hackers to visual bugs but this is honestly to be expected in any form of alpha whaever game. Only new and better things can come from it. Community Everyone is complanining about the community. But from 150 hours into this game so far I can easily tell you that this is due to people not giving an effort. The odds of being kos'd upon spawning is very minimal and to avoid this the NUMBER ONE thing you can do is to create a group. Roll with some buddies on your friends list or make some in game. When I went into this game none of my friends played this game I've made friends with some prettty damn cool people since then and I don't even have a mic. It's all about player interaction choose what you'd like to do with it. (Quick note I personally don't experience people who don't have guns out kos'ing me) Fighting Fighting in this game is like no other. It's one of those few games where your ability to kill isn't determined by your gear. In this game kill of getting killed is determined by deception and skill. Many people won't waste bullets on killing a presumabely new spawn. Run up naked rock in hand get close and blast them. In a firefight it's all about the aim. Someone wit the best gear in the game can be killed by someone who has better skill with the recoil and the sway. Housing Making your own base is absolutely awesome!! You can design it however you please and the possibilities are endless. Also you can look through cracks in the wood to see whatever is inside said wall window doorway etc. Raiding Raiding is absolutely amazing especially when they're online. Firefights planting c4 on doors cover fire. It's all fun and very much enjoyable. Sleeping upon logging out This feature is one of the best and most bistinguishable between Rust and DayZ (I haven't played Dayz Standalone yet) It prevents combat logging and makes and incorporates an interesting aspect on base building and protection. How long does it last? (Late game?) Best feature of this game is the longevity of it. It's completely replayable and it takes a while to get blueprints for all of the advanced gear in the game. Extra Features Then there are many more features crafting airdrops etc. which adds to the game and things to do. CONS Hackers Hackers are ruining this game accross the board. Atleast community servers have admins to filter out some of them but it's still an issue. I believe that FacePunch needs to make an anti cheat of their own steam VAC is good and all. But in those days where it doesn't insta ban and just records to ban on a certain day hackers can wreak havoc. Official Server Uptime A lot of the larger Official servers which will have a (Stress Test) to them are very unstable and it's unfortunately the only official game servers that have 200+ people. Can't think of any more major ones. Overall A good game that has things coming for it but potentially game ruining things at the moment. (Mainly Hackers)
title: Rust

review: A headache inducing DayZ clone with less options and no deadly kiwis 1/10.
title: Rust

review: Very bad game at the moment I strongly advise people NOT TO BUY this game atm it has potential to be a good game but not yet. My favourite part is The Blueprint system this is where if you find a blueprint and study it you then know how to craft the certain item the blueprint is for. This kept me playing and hunting for more intill i found my m4 blueprint. There is a steap learning curve though so I personally reccomend go watching some begginers guides for rust. Although it is pretty easy to figure out once you have some basic things. I rate rust 9/10

review: This game started off as a magnificient survival game set up in a sombre atmosphere with a unique art style a huge map with tons of details a building system like no other we've ever dreamt of an unbelievably caring and cooperative community and lots of adrenaline rushes caused by strangers zombies and rad animals. In short it was about primitive men some better geared than others versus nature making friends and enemies along the way.At some point Rust was rebooted from scratch. That made a lot of sense back then because the amazing concept behind the game was being hidden by its modest technical level and the messy code in Good Ol' Rust supposedly hampered developers progress to an ill extent. Getting more features and a better game seemed optimal. This new thing was labeled Rust Experimental.Now two years later Rust Experimental is simply known as Rust. A lot has changed since the beginning of said massive revamp. I'll give you one thing it looks fantastic. It totally does.The negative side? The game has totally turned from a survival to an FPS. The community is now crowded with players who are intellectually uncurious at large they are not interested in interacting they will never ask for food nor will they try to convince you about letting them in to spend the night and they will not cooperate in any way. If any of the previous ever happens to you it will be to kill you and to raid your house. Most of the times they will refrain from using these old tricks and just shoot on sight with an AK 47 rocket launcher flamethrower or sniper rifle with a 4x zoom scope if they are able to. Everyday they stay late at night with one goal in mind use C4 to raid as many houses as possible right when everyone's logged off.People are simply not open to expanding their friend circle and so the hilarious and creepy dialogues and situations that made Rust the best game I've ever played they're all gone. The developers' ill emphasis on military weapons has taken this too far away to the point that I've found myself playing DayZ trying to recover some of this experience while still visiting Rust from time to time to check on the progress of users' devastating mindset and the building system which I still enjoy quite a bit.Some other bad bits that are in no way nearly as defining as the ones above developers are poorly organised and seem to tackle issues randomly instead of as a team developers' progress is tedious to follow mostly because of their lack of focus realism and priorities (although they manage to pull some decent weekly devlogs) performance is poor and seems to be slowly getting worse the building system hasn't received barely any update in a year (bugs are virtually the same ones as back then) developers' only goal in life is adding modern weapons to the point that even this new FPS addicted hostile community is feeling wrong about it procedurally generated maps are losing features for no apparent reason (amazing desert and snow biomes forests and canyons suddenly just flew away) caves have never worked properly and old Rust's rock formations which allowed players to hide build shelters where they'd never in a hundred years be found simply don't exist anymore. Animals have not worked at all for two whole years and they want to have it fixed by June (!). Now let me tell you a story. Facepunch didn't like the zombie fashion they took them out of the game put rad animals instead and took them out again when moving to the new Rust. After that they spent years deliberating about adding NPC hostiles (there are none) doing intellectual work on the topic coming up with amazing new beings that would terrify survivors thinking of refined concepts that would shatter the world as we know it. After all that effort on a paramount subject the only NPC threat now in the game is... guess what. A cannibal tribe? An ancestral monster? A wizard in a tower? Nope a chopper a ing chopper with a machine gun. You still think it's not that bad huh? Okay picture Facepunch staff would be replaced by one CoD mad 14 year old tell him to develop a concept for The Boss of a game like this and give him two hours instead of two years. You and I know even he would've thought of something better. And have I said this game requires too much time? Several hours daily. And also that it includes a few pre gun powder weapons who no one can use thanks to the mindblowing number of guns?There are a lot of minor points I could make too but I'm lacking the energy and time for it.In case you are considering this as an FPS purchase I firmly believe it makes no sense for you to go through the annoyance of building a house gathering blueprints and resources crafting weapons trying not to die at night and moving from wipe to wipe if all you want is to simply shoot down some people. Of course this game allows you to shoot down some people who really care about what they're doing and who're expending a sick lot of time putting effort into building their place which I have come to understand motivates a bunch of people. (Sigh)If you are still going to play it bring some friends from real world and enjoy the bloodbath or simply get abused non stop playing solo.Rust is opposite to what made it different.

review: This is by far one of the best games i've ever played. First the pvp is smooth and solid in my 2k hours i have never seen a glitch or bug while fighting another pearson. I love the heli it gives you a good boost to getting a gun or high end raiding supplies. Animals have gone through multiple stages form flying through rocks to being something that can be challenging and dangerous fight deppending on the animal you fight. The base building is the best i've ever played with compared to any game that involves building. The armor has been evened out where is isn't OP or bad enough to the point where you dont even bother getting it. But by far the guns in this game are what made me play so much. Guns in this game are tiered by Early game Mid game and End game. Early game guns are more focused on close range mid range are a mix of close and long range and end game guns are good a close and long range. I usaly get comments about how the game is too grindy about hitting trees and nodes but pearsonaly with the new hotspots that have been being added grinding isn't even one of the thing i remember about a wipe. These are my reasons you should buy and maybe even enjoy this game as much as i do.

review: I was set up really well at about 3 hours into my game at this point me and my posse found 3 people living at the bottom of our mountian you may think we would kill them but I had a much synister plan in store. I went down to them feed them and clothed them and told them they could build there house atop our mountian of course they accepted this offer. about an houre later is when it gets intresting me and my group were inside my house and the trio were outside just getting set up so naturaly I needed to stir something up. I took my shotgun and fired at my wall 2 times and all we can hear outside is screams the went something like this "OH MY GOD WE'RE UNDER ATTACK RUN GET DOWN THE MOUNTAIN!!!" we had a good laugh at that one but the best was yet to come.The trio came back after about 10 mins we left them to there own devises for about another 2 hours well we pland what was to come.In the dead of night where nothing was happening our posse slowly surrounded the trios house and laid in wait. The door opened as one ran out then two then at last the third closing the door on the way out once they had nowhere to hide we opened fire effectivly killing all of them as they respawned in there house we could only see them typing to me "Man we need you there are bandits at the house!" little did they know i was among them. I responded to them "Sorry I can't help im pined down about 20 mins away." at this point they wanted to get out and kill the bandits attacking there house so they opend the door guns blazing but what they did not expect was 3 shotgun shells as the door opened it was me they finaly knew the truth. In the end they uninstalled the game calling me a loveing ' through a steam message. 10/10 would make rage again.

review: First stuff the game client and servers run well. There are TONS of servers and players. You can find one with &lt 30ms ping no problem. Gameplay is quick to pick up although fairly undocumented you'll get no help figuring it out and there is no "new user experience" per se you'll have to wiki everything. The textures object detection and collision seem just fine and better than most. All things being equal this game is totally worth the price and you can play it endlessly.My complaint(s) I've played most games of this type. After about 100 200 hours of gameplay I'm the first one to suggest that butt hurt victims of my cross bow "get gud" in just about any game. I've never gotten to what I consider to be the "end game" i.e. large bases heavily armed players using squad tactics etc. I've only ever been clubbed in the head repeatedly while naked on a beach or been able to construct a decent stone or metal base about 10 minutes before a bunch of &lt insert unintelligible foreign language&gt speaking Zerg show up with explosives kill me and take about 4 hours worth of resources.So the game is suffering from a fate similar to most Battle Royale games and I've seen it in the battle arena games too some people like world building and some just want to destroy everything. The "goal" of course is to kill the most enemies and "all's fair" and so on. But non veterans may be scared away easily by the difficulty in progressing due to the scavengers and the naked player murderers and that sits just fine with the kids who feel mastery on their server(s) because they keep them away. Eventually n00bs will stop coming the gankers will get bored and the online community will collapse.But hey it's worth 3 4 hours every Friday night I give it a rating of "Buy Now Even at Retail Price Especially If You Like Having Your Skull Crushed a Lot"

review: While Rust does a lot of things well building gun play etc. It does them far more cleanly than all the other survival games out now. The devs obviously put a lot of work into making what they put in work and work well. They are slow to add features like some of the other games but what they put in is polished and great.But the true beauty of Rust is in the pure chaos of the player interaction. Since Rust lacks any clear goals there is a wide range of what people do. Yes most of the time you are just trying to dominate each other in a huge match but you'll run into a bunch of personalities just wanting to make the world a weirder place. I haven't played another game where you find such interesting interactions.

review: After nearly 2k hours I think its time to give an "official" review on this amazing game You know your money went to good use when it let's you experience almost every emotion within a single wipe. Rust is a VERY unforgiving game and you have to make quite a lot of hard desicions that's how it's always been as long as i've been playing (very very early into early access). This game have been through a lot of up's and down's but i always keep coming back to it just because of the original vibe you get of this game while playing. This game takes a LOT of dedication You need to be able to sit down and put a fair ammount of time into the game before you get somewhere (ESPECIALLY IF YOUR PLAYING SOLO!). This game is often labeled as "Impossible" for playing solo and i always have disagreed with this statment even with this new blueprint update. Playing any playstyle in this game is possible with dedication and effort. It's a challenge and that's what gives this game its jazz. Hackers are rarely an issue in this game because the dev's take that into their own hands and are VERY good at catching people who cheat in this game (I'm not saying you will never run into a hacker i'm just saying it's very rare). I don't like making reviews this long but for such an amazing game I decided to put some time into writing this. I 100% recommend this game to ANYONE considering buying it.
title: Rust

review: In RUST you survive. That's it. You can loot irradiated towns hunt wildlife kill other players build houses and bases and raid other peoples bases. The game goes downhill once you've built an amazing base with ample supplies because everything is already handed to you on a silver platter. However with each server wiping the map at least once a month you're forced to start all over which can be positive for some who are tired of being OP but negative to others who had a good base going at the time. All in all RUST is great fun with a friend or two and I'd recommend it to survival game enthusiasts. Watch out for the helicopter!
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: Now that the game has finally left early access I can give it a full review. If you dont want indepth information then here is a basic score card.8/10 Multiplayer8/10 Controls8/10 Graphics9/10 Freedom8/10 Crafting3/10 Dificulty 4/10 CommunityOver alll this game is a solid 8/10 minus some toxic playersFor a more precise look at the game I can say that it is rather fun although challenging. Rust is a survival game with a good amount of freedom and a large playerbase. While the game is simple and easy to learn the dificulty of the experience is based solely on what server you are playing on. With the customization to servers PVP can be shut off or limited. If it is not limited in any way then you will have a rough time if you join a server even a week after a game wipe. A large portion of the community is toxic and trollsome but the building mechanics make up for it for the most part. House construction items learning new blueprints and all can be super fun and have a great amount of creative freedom. My over all rating to this game has changed 4 times through its movement from when I started playing to its current and final form. As of now it has my full reccomendation. The only thing I would change about it would be to give players the ability to host a server from their home computers for small groups.
title: Rust

review: I've been playing Rust for over 200 hours now. What to say?Rust is a game where you spawn at the coast of a big island and you got nothing but a stone to harvest stone and wood. To survive you have to kill animals and use a well created crafting system to craft weapons houses and lots more. You can kill other people to get to their inventory what makes the game interesting but difficult for singleplayers.But Rust offers you great ways to raid the bases of other people!Me and 2 friends for example raided a base by One person playing guitar and singing Let it go from Frozen through the voicechat on the roof of a base. The inhabitant lost his nerves opened his door to kill our mate but we were waiting with our bows pointing at the entrance and killed him. One of the hundred experiences I made and why I recommend you this game(I'm no native speaker so forgive my mistakes)

review: Heres the deal this game is great in lots of ways and also bad in lots of ways. The building loot gathering mini boss and etc systems are awsome and unique. Rust is always keeping you on your toes and when your searching for loot and resources you rarely get bored AND when you finnaly get that awsome loot drop from a crate or that couple thousand stone youve been farming for you really feel like youve accomplished something. and with new content bug fixes balancing systems a dedicated dev team and graphics optimizations being added every month this game is always being improved upon. BUT. no game is truely perfect espacially not rust when playing the game theres no system dividing groups of players from solo players and with 95% of the community being toxic scum every group of people you meet will gun you down on sight this obviously isnt good solo players and especially not for new players with no one to play with. With its own unique gun recoil and crafting system the game favors players that hang out in large groups and that have lots of time to play and master the game. every player you see will either have very few hours put into the game or very many hours put into the game thats because those who dont have an unlimited amount of time on their hands or lots and lots of friends on rust will usually be driven away from the game and those who do will spend all their time playing since ethey probably dont have anything better to do (no offense). on top of all this no new official servers have been added since the game's launch and those original servers havent been expanded upon either which means that servers will often have ques to get in and will be laggy for those with a slower internet connection.So. in conclusion. if you dont lots of time and a strong will i dont recommend buying this game.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a game about survival. But that takes time. Initially it's just about death. It's about freezing to death and starving to death being shot to death and getting bitten to death occasionally mixing things up a little by slipping on a warm radiation coat and fading faster than your faith in humanity after being stabbed in the back by a supposed friend's hatchet. Sometimes you get gored to death. Other times bored to death. It's not easy surviving post apocalyptic civilisation with nothing but a rock especially when your enemies have guns and double especially in a game that makes you work just to earn a pair of basic trousers... Stefan.

review: Rust is a fun distraction and has the potential to be something great but in its current state Rust isn't worth the twenty dollar investment. To start the review off on a positive Rust has a great sense of humor. The game doesn't take itself to seriously as you start off almost naked with nothing but a rock to defend yourself. I find this immensley funny. Another positive would be that the games world (depending on what server you choose to play on) is very large. Gameplay is standard and nothing at all revolutionary but it fits the game and serves its purpose. On to the negatives. Although the world in Rust is big and filled with wildlife enemies minerals and the occasional ruined town the world often seems bland. This is counteracted by the fact that there are usually other players to play with and come across. This is not a great experience though. Other player unless they are your friend will usually just kill you for no reason. When you see another player you won't instictively think "Are they good or bad ". You instead think "I should run or strike first". Sure it's true that you may occasionally find a kind player but those moments are few and far between. Another complaint is that the game just drops you in with no instructions. This means new players will die alot until they get the hang of. Combine this with the terrible user interface and an ubandance of bugs and clipping issues you get a game that is far from done. But thats okay. Afterall it is an early acess game. I've had alot of fun with Rust but I cant justify suggesting it you twenty dollars. Hopefully in later versions and even the final version my problems will addressed but until then the current alpha for Rust gets a6 out 10.

review: Time for a review!introduction I've been watching rust video's on youtube for a while and when it came on sale this summer I felt like I had to buy it so I did. The game exceeded my expectations in so many ways!visuals The video's I had been watching probably were older because as soon as I joined in (highest settings) it looked so much better. Sadly I had some console like fps especially at some moments so I turned my settings down a bit after which it still looked great!some gameplay My first days were spent on a server with around 100 people online at the busiest point. A friend of mine showed me the way and helped me set up camp and get gear the first day. after that he didn't play a lot anymore but I did and I learned a lot. first shoot people then ask questions never throw away scrap skip the key lock fase and go straight to the numpads (with teammates)after these days the server reset I bought some new games and I kind of forgot I had rust. Until that same friend invited me to start a team with him and 2 other friends. So I obviously joined. The server was pretty peaceful but you still had to watch out. but because we played on a canadian server instead of a european one we were able to get a lot of good gear while the canadians were asleep.We've had to deal with door campers so many times sometimes even three times in three hours but our base survived every raid because we played tactical. So here are some more tips on how to play you never have enough doors is 19 enough you think? no double it! choose random door codes and just save them in some sort of file especially with 38 doors. never go outside when there are doorcampers. ran away from shots and explosions even if it sounds like it's far away. try going on loot trips with buddies you will die at least twice as much if you go without them.community I wouldn't say this community is 'bad' their behaviour is just really defensive because some people will otherwise up your experience. But if you manage it to make some friends it's great. And making friends in rust isn't hard at all with such an active community. I never expected so many people to be online and I also never thought I would have so many encounters in such a big map. I don't know what they did to make this game so attractive but it 100% worked.conclusion This is a great game and I am really enjoying it. but that doesn't mean you will too. I don't really recommend you to buy it for the full price with or without friends but without friends you just shouldn't do it. This game also sure has it's flaws like so few animals. From a technical view this game is pretty good and optimized but I don't see anyone getting decent frame rates on some built in graphics.

review: There are alot of Negative reviews here from people who havent really experienced the Joys of Rust. I would reccomend picking up a friend or two to make your time in game alot more fun and enjoyable but the game is very soloable. I have so many Great and bad memories with this game The feeling you get when you spend all day gathering Materials for c4 to raid an Enemy you have made or hell even your neighbor and you start blowing through walls until you get to where they are storing everything. You open that first box and you just made the materials back you spend the last few hrs farming for then some. As you load your inventory up to run back to your base your heart starts to beat rapidly you want to keep all the loot you just got as you start running back to your base you see a naked run up to you. In your head your thinking o thats fine he is just a naked as you run past him he pulls out a shotgun kills you and takes all the loot you just got as this naked screams into the mic WELCOME TO RUST! It's encounters like this that make Rust well Rust while its very diffrent from how legacy rust use to be and you dont run across it as much as you use to it's still a very fun game and you pick up some really funny stories along the way. So go pick up a few buddies and enjoy the game you wont regret it. While the new version of Rust can be harder to run on older PCs and can be a bit laggy at times but it is worth it if you know your pc can run it. Hell id still buy it while its on sale to play it later

review: Rust is a PvP battle royale where the only goal is survival. Players spawn on various maps naked and alone except for a torch and a rock. From there it is mad scramble to find food and resources build bases craft useful items and weapons and above all survive. Strategies vary depending on whether you play alone as a duo or join a group.New players are advised to start on low population community servers with few or no other players on it. THere you can learn the mechanics of the game and what resources are avaible to craft better tools and weapons. This is because official servers are filled with high level players who reside in elaborate well defended base guard resource sources jealously killing new players on sight. There is a steep learning curve to this game but an active online community can help with that. If you like such games you will enjoy Rust.

review: This game is great i have logged so many hours which is evidence that it is extremely interactive always changing and is different each time you play it. However with change there is good and bad the bad id have to say in this instance isnt the game itself its the extreme amount of people using scripts hacking ddosing servers aim botting esping and so on. On official facepunch servers this is probably the most common by far as there isnt an active admin group to respond to blatant abuse. Even servers with highly active admins however like rustafied for example its still difficult to get a situation taken care of quickly and unfortunately the quicker the better in this type of game because in this game the time you invest is the outcome of your success time spent building skill harvesting and overall advancing forward can all be taken away from you before you know it which is why this game is so fricken awesome but when someone is abusing using scripts hacks and so on thats when its easy to find yourself hovering your mouse over that uninstall button.

review: At first I hated this game more and more and more. I stopped playing it completely for a couple months but then I saw a video on youtube of some guy making a Trap Base and thought I'd give it another shot. Started out hating it again until someone random on a server decided to show me the ropes. Got good fast and learnt the basics then the advances. Soon I was raiding making kick strong holds PVP the works. The graphics are nice The sound design works well the amount of weird things people say and do on here will get a laugh out of you. Even the combat has a learning curve that gets pretty rewarding when you get the hang of it. Don't go in especting that there will be tons of online players trying to be your friends and help you out. Its not going to happen Its every man for himself and when yoy realise that then you will see how its a good game. A game thats always going to challange you. A game that will reward you for taking risks and also punish you at all the same. I recommend it if you have mates to play with then its even better. I will say though the biggest nagative I have about it is Chat can be toxic and this game wastes loads of time. Though with all that in mind its still a game that will be the closest you will get to the most hardcore survival.

review: Honestly one of the best games I have ever played the experience the community and the concept are what makes this game a true success. Being one of the newer players I can't say quite as much but every time I get on and play there is always a task I can do. This game will not bore you even when farming you will be on edge as the unforgiving players on the server try to take your stuff. This game lets you have the ability to make each wipe your own and every single time the server does wipe its a whole new experience. If you love PvP but hate grinding then you can go kill those who do farm and play this game without much grinding at all. If you don't PvP that well you still are in the fight with the ability to blow into anyone elses base and take from them. This game enables anyone to succeed and after you get past the somewhat steep learning curve you will be completely hooked.

review: Well after some hours playing it I have to say that for me Rust it is now probably the top survive game side by side with Ark.The game optimization its just great nowadays.The BP system works good and as long as you join the servers when the wipe (full one) is done you always have a chance to fight and survive.Teamplaying can be fun but solo its great.You start with a torch and a stone that you use to gather your first wood and stone by hitting trees and rocks and from there you build your first tools ... with luck you can get them from loot box you find those in roads or shops / monuments and then its all about surviving ... hunting ... and building your base (and make sure it lasts P)Community servers are awesome as they give you the chance to either play in a no team limite server or you can play solo or duo or trio ... There are some Mod Servers too where you can have fun and perhaps try out things in faster pace servers with higher rates like 5x and 10x servers.Surely having fun with this game.

review: Get clan raided until your last drop of water... The pioneer on its genre. Surviving crafting raiding and trusting others are a few of the many challenges that Rust provides. Unfortunately this was the old Rust the Rust Legacy. Sadly the new Rust is the opposite of fun cause Everyone will shoot you on sight there is no random encounters where a chat partnership or even a clan can begin out of nowhere. It seems that everyone on the server is afraid of dying so they would rather shoot before anything than risking losing their loot. You'll farm a thousand resources just to wake up naked in the beach the next day cause you have been raided by a big clan that dominates the server even though the wipe was a day ago. Oh and playing solo is a death wish... You'll be headshoted 100 miles away with a single pistol bullet. Most of the encounters will be you with a bow against someone with an AK. Rust was transformed from a truly survival experience into a game that people only seek to be better than another group of people so they rule the server by themselves. Having a lot of members to farm every single rock and shoot every single naked spawned player. " As I've said before the old rust was amazing but this one... it sucks. " Category Grade Gameplay 9/10 Graphics 9/10 Soundtrack 6/10 Overall Rating 8.0
title: Rust

review: I have over 400 hours played in Rust. And i went from loving it to hating it with passion . Rust is now stacked heavily in favor of groups/clans and offline rading. As solo player you get almost 0 chance. And with every update its getting worse and worse for a solo player to play. The component system was fine when the loot crates were spread out all over the map giving you a chance to atleast build your house and some protection but now they moved it all to just a few places and roads making 60% of the map pointless and solo players zerged while trying to get basic components . To top that off they remade the resource nodes so now you need to travel huge distances to even find some building basics or make a basic tool. They keep making more Hot Loot zones (like the new launch site) where clans and groups dominate and the solo player can't hope to survive thus making the game even more stacked against you (solo) because while you trying to survive and make your first tools and house groups who camp hot zones are showered with loot and running fully geared and with AKs few hours from wipe. The new twig/ladder raiding also kills any motivation to play .....Top that all up with the worst community you will ever meet in an online game which is being encouraged by devs .... and you get RUST Horrible and nerve wracking experience .
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: Great shooting and building. It is the most challenging game I have ever played. Public servers will have you frustrated early so I would recommend a low pop server with higher resource farming abilities just to get the building and crafting down. Also keep in mind that even though there may not be a lot of people online at the same time you are because of timezone differences your base may be raided while you literally sleeping in your base. This is the most frustrating part to me I would spend hours farming resources building and protecting my base from raiding and glitching wildlife only to have a large group of people that would get on as I would get off and raid my base...not complaing just saying that this is how this game works. If you are looking at trying this game out I would look into all the more recent Youtube videos from players who play this game and see if the game play looks like something you'd be interested in. I have spent weeks on this game having a blast and then not touched it for a year only to come back to a better looking and running game. That is where this game is set apart from many games in this genre the devs care and answer to feedback.

review: This game is for the people who love the grind and hardcore PvP. Rust takes a step forward when you can create and protect your base from coming threats. The servers wipe after a period of time so there is always a chance to be the best geared rust player in the server. I kinda like that they did that because imagne building a base and suddenly a clan of 10+ people who has been grinding on the server for months just attacked you and destroyed your stuff with their overpowerd gear. Well this does not happen since this game has wipes. I Would Reccomend the game to anyone who likes Survival Games and isn't too salty about loosing their hard earned items.Rating 8.5/10Peace.
title: Rust

review: this is seriously how the game goes. and if you buy it you WILL experience this too. you spawn in a server if you choose one with at least 15 people this is how it will go.. if you choose one with 50 or more just skip the rest below because youll just die. anyways youll join the game with a rock a bandage and a torch.. if your lucky you wont spawn near a person or someones house. youll run and hit a tree or a wood pile to get some wood and youll hit a rock for some rescources just to hear the sound of foot steps behind you were a guy will ask you any number of things OR even tell you hes freindly either way when you turn around or try to run he will kill you... congradulations you now are back to square one with a rock a torch and a bandage... lets skip ahead a little say youve been gathering a while you have enough recources to start building foundation and walls... well while your building your building a guy will most likely come up to yo u( whether he only has a rock or a gun) he will most likely try to kill you but this time you are prepared you have made your self a pipe shotgun and you manage to kill him. only for him to rage to his buddies which you dont know about and they gear up and come finish the job.. killing you they take everything from you and they can RUIN your house... they can place a wall in the middle or foundation and make your house unfixable. lets say somehow you have made it further... you have built a house its a couple story tall you have a few steel doors.. and your in your house... and you hear click click click click click BOOM as C4 blows up your wall but your safe cuz there are more doors/walls they have to go through... you hear another clickk clikc click click boom they blew through a wall and now have acess to the majority of the house you happen to have an mp5 so you manage to kill1 or 2 but the numbers and m4s overwhelm you and you die... you spawn at your bed where they are expecting you and they kill you again. now yo uhave to wait 5 mins before you can spawn at that bed again so it spawns you randomly in the world somewhere... meanwhile they are looting your house of EVERYTHING and you have to find your way back to your house. which when you get there you have destroyed walls and absolutly no supplies... so basically back to square 1.... so if this sounds like your kinda game then go for it

review: Entire review is based on my opinion just like any other review out there.This game is absolutely horrible. I've been playing this game on and off for about 3 years now. Everytime I come back to the game I wonder "When the hell are they going to finally fix and release this game?!" Everytime I come back they change aspects for the most part make the game worse. For example they added a new leveling system that doesn't involve going to special locations to get blueprints. Instead barrels are scattered everywhere. Why does this suck? There's no more special landmarks in the game that mean anything anymore. The dome is no longer a constant warzone between the biggest clans in the server. Everywhere there's noobs middle schoolers running around looking for nakeds to slaughter because they're bored.Does anyone remember the glitchy animal A.I. that can somehow running through rocks and walls? When it's not running in walls it's running in circles. Does anyone remember that glitch from a few years ago? Yeah it's still here!The community also has gotten more toxic. Anytime you mention any of the bugs or glitches and how the devs are never going to fix it people attack you. It used to be they would agree but now they're stuck in a constant state of denial and their response always is "They're fixing it just look at the Dev forum if you don't like the game then just leave."To anyone looking to buy this game. It will be a fun experience phase for you for a week then you will get bored and tired of the glitches and regret buying the game. Save your money and pass this one until it's fully released. It's no where near finished.

review: Was lucky enough to get into the game with a good group of friends from the start and then put in essentially all of my playtime in one go. Had an absolute blast for those 400 hours however the game has and continues to change immensely since then. Facepunch is currently experimenting with features like a map that shows you exactly where you and monuments are on the map at all times and an on screen compass which I find really ruin a lot of what I found compelling about the game. That being said they are extremely receptive to feedback and criticism and put out regular dev blogs even all these years later.Even though I don't agree with some of the feature changes the game has constantly improved both mechanically and visually. Building is The current price of $10.00 is an absolute bargain for how much one can get out of this game.Compelling building mechanics that encourage strategy satisfying PvP that encourages player created endgame events like raiding espionage faction politics and all out war and new emphasis on dev created PvE/PvP hybrid events means there's more than enough to keep you busy.

review: I love this game. It's fun to build a house defend against raider and form friendships.This game is just a blast to play. But I feel like I have changed from when I first started playing. On my first server I let a man in to my half finished home. Then he pulled out a spear and I freaked out and barley managed to kill him with a hatchet. After 100+ hours I was a little more aware off how to survive in this harsh landscape but whenever there was a player near me and I was holding anything valuable I was more scared than in any horror game. And now I don't even flinch when taking the lifes of others who theaten me. I wound strongly recommend that you play on a server with low population if you don't have anybody to play with.I am scared of what I will be like after 1000+ hours.10/10 would turn in to a heartless monster again.

review: I haven't even had this game a year and it is already my most played game on Steam. It's hard to put into words just how great Rust is you really need to experience it for yourself. There aren't any other games that feel like there is a true THRILL to surviving. Not many games punish you and yet remain user friendly at the same time. Rust is such a strong balance of strategic creative and challenging. On top of that this game actually updates every. Single. Week. (I'm looking at you nearly every other survival game on Steam) And the updates are always beefy. I haven't been disappointed yet by anything in this game except for maybe the amount of people who think 'shoot first talk later.'

review: As a Survival game enthusiast I thought it would be right up my alley and I'd meet some friendly people to build a base with..I knew for sure there would be some 'foes' on the servers but thats part of the fun right? Boy was I wrong.. The first time I spawned I woke up without anything (which I thought was normal). In actual fact someone had robbed them off me (this happened more than once). This was cool until every time I encountered someone they would say they were 'friendly' and then me over once my back was turned. This was also ok. Once I decided I should just kill on sight (and contribute to the problem) I'd last about 10 minutes before being shot by someone with a Bow or Gun..I turned to the server chat to ask anyone if they wanted to team up..I was then told to 'get better' 'kill myself' and 'get cancer'...For just being new to the game. The game itself is beautiful the mechanics are tight and the idea is amazing but the community is horrific frustrating and downright immature.Save yourself the stress.

review: I have almost 1300 hours in this game and have played it since legacy. I recommend this game to anyone but this review is mostly to express my worry about the direction it is heading.It seems like every update since late last year has been to improve the quality of life of large groups. As a small group or solo you will likely have some basic stuff within two days of wipe. However large groups will already have everything they need and will be raiding all their neighbors. The servers die quickly due to that mostly. Also if you only have time to play 8 10 hours a week then this game is not for you. There is a grind aspect that requires a lot of time investiment and the fact that you are likely to get raided by larger groups rather rapidly it makes that time investment important. The more you play the more crap you'll have and less likely you'll get raided because no one likes an online raid.In another six months this game might just be unplayable for the casual or solo. It's still a great game though. I just go into knowing I'll get a day or two of fun and then pooped on and eliminated by a large group after that.
title: Rust

review: I think it's safe to say I have played Rust for a little while ... I have played solo duo and in groups. I have played on official servers vanilla servers modded servers PVE servers and I have run a few of my own servers. I have also bought more skins then I think I should have.I played through the blueprint system the XP system and now we are into the scrap system.The scrap system is a grind just like how the XP system was and it sucks and we are still waiting on rideable horses We got boats .... because that's useful on land where most of the gameplay takes place..... They had started on a sedan that was quickly forgotten about but admins can spawn them in Good luck finding one who will though.If you want to build bases and raid people then Rust is exactly what you are looking for but have fun grinding for work benches and everything else you need in order to fulfill your raiding desires ... But if you want a game that has more then I suggest that you look else where because Rust has zero quests or missions to do and has absolutely no story what so ever. Rust has server events that only fully geared/grouped players can take part in unless you're on a dead server If you are playing solo on a higher pop server your only chance at getting guns is to grind/slave/gamble for them or get lucky as and hope you don't get ambushed and taken for everything you have.I also don't think the Devs play the game because if they did they would be working to balance research costs weapon damage clothing/armour protection hunger and hydration base upkeep and adding land vehicles. Instead they are spending all of their time adding in useless like the up coming L96 and slot machine.This brings up another point it seems like every other month one of the Devs is going on holiday when they aren't to busy jerking off Imagine if these guys would smarten the up we might actually have a full game by now but nope they have in hand to their next holiday spot.A lot of people will say "Oh you don't know what you are talking about" Then how do you explain Devs teams the same size as the one working Rust who have made full games 10x the size of Rust in half the time!?!.... There are games being made by only one or two people that have more done then Rust..... And I know from experience it doesn't take 4 or 5 months to make a game ready model because I can grind one out in under a week and a handfull in a month.In its current state of development it is not full game release ready and should only just be entering "Early Access" I blame Facepunch for their poor work ethic and I blame Steam for allowing it.But whatever I have done my time in Rust and finding a new game to play is long overdue Besides the Rust community is toxic as and is highly unlikely to ever change.

review: Rust makes better use of voice chat than any game I've ever played. You are naked and alone on the world's silliest island. There is no narrator or announcer so instead you submerge in the quietude of the unkempt grass crunching beneath your feet as you uselessly smash your rock against the nearest pine tree. Perhaps you've also harvested some mushrooms and a few bundles of flax enough to stave off the hunger pangs and fashion yourself a burlap shawl to cover your shame. If you're particularly industrious you'll have furnished a nice wooden shack a stone's throw away from some fresh water and reliable resources the entry level homestead necessary for any successful Rust campaign. I don't know what it is with this game. Maybe it's the fact that you spawn unclothed and uncensored maybe it's the brutal vastness of the design or maybe it's the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings but Rust has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat merges with the draw distance so when you're spotted by an idiot you'll start hearing the talk quietly tickling your ear. They get closer they get louder and more confident and suddenly you're hopping over shotgun shells while absorbing an entire dictionary of insults.

review: Product received for free. I've played the game in bursts from January 2016 up to now most of the time as a solo player. Trust me It's a game that gets the heart pumpin fast. I find it more of a suspensful game than a survival game. Nowadays Rust feels more like a full time job than a way to relax and have fun.That being said I strongly recommend you play this game with a friend it is so much better that way. As a solo player it gets boring and makes you quite paranoid that anyone could be lurking around the corner somewhere. But with a teamate it can be a good laugh especially with some of the people you come across on this unpredictable game.In addition to that Rust I find is a very funny game especially on servers like combat tag where you can talk face to face without worrying so much about losing your stuff. Sometimes I laugh uncontrollably from the things that come out of these people's mouths. Of course as we all should know the community is very toxic but I've made plenty of great friends on rust. Sometimes there are s and sometimes there are some pretty chill dudes who just want to have a good time.Taking all this into account I recommend getting this game especially taking into account that Rust is constantly changing with weekly updates from the devs and much more.

review: I've Played 264 hours of this game and I can say without a doubt that Rust has beaten Ark Survival Evolved for having the most toxic player base there is with little else to do in this game aside from rushing to build a base on wipe day which occurs on a monthly basis and raiding other players bases this game harbors a toxic community from the side chat to fully geared players trash talking you as they stand over your lifeless corpse with nothing but a rock to your name. On top of the community and little content in the core gameplay The game "features" include no offline base protection and sleepers (your character stays in the server upon you logging out) meaning other people can raid your base and kill you if you don't have 24/7 to babysit your base. I've personally watched a Dev of Facepunch (the company behind this masterpiece) ban cheaters on an official server which is good considering how many hackers there are in a game with so little content however shortly after witnessing the ban's he proceeded to fly around the map and upon meeting my group of friends started spawning zombie like creatures which later he stated were leftover assets from Facepunches abandoned game called "Ruin". To me this is worse than Badmin's on player run servers as this is an Offical Facepunch dev trolling its community.

review: I spent a good week playing this game. It's very addicting and fun to build your house. The idea is great. However the game is completley overrun with hackers. To the point if you don't hack you don't stand any type of chance. People will kill you over and over just for the hell of it. It doesn't matter if you hide they can see and shoot through walls. You can't run the hackers can fly.Then there is the kids 12 yr olds love this game and they love screaming in to their mics. There is no mute. You will need to remove your headphones or turn your speakers off.If your lucky you will eventually get a weapon that can shoot some sort of projectile whether it be a bullet or an arrow. However the weapons system is so glitched you will die trying to aim at a lagging target. But it never fails the hackers will turn around and head shot you. You damn near have to hack in this game otherwise it's time wasted trying to do anythingI read on Rust wiki the game made 50 million dollars. It seems like management could pay some nerd minimum wage to watch the official servers and kick the hackers. It makes me wish I would have gone into coding. There isn't much product no management and the game overall is . Looks like some coding intern made it.I look forward to the day a company puts out a good MineCraft meets a First Person Shooter survival game and gets it right. There is potential there. Maybe some day I'll try again once the game comes out of Alpha. For now I'm throwing this game in the trash.

review: This is a decent game... when you're alive. I bought this game in hopes that a few friends and I could go into a server and build a little base together. Finding eachother was very difficult because you spawn in different places on the map and the map is fairly large. Once we found eachother (using maps we found on the internet and using landmarks as guidance) we were able to build up our base which was pretty fun. Unfortunately pick your servers wisely because there are a lot of people out there who seem to "run" certain areas of the map. We spent hours building and fortifying our base only to find out that when we woke up the next day that we were all dead and back out in the open far away from eachother. This happened about 3 times (in different servers) so we ended up giving up on the game.
