review: Rust is a great game so far although I haven't played too much of it yet. It feels fresh compared to Minecraft. Before I say anything else however I just want to let you know THIS GAME IS IN ALPHA! So do not buy it unless you're okay with some features being broken. Once the game became unplayable for a few days. So think hard before you buy it but if you're okay with work in progressy games I suggest you buy it.Fresh. That's the main word I think of when playing. It looks so mucb like Minecraft on the outside but in fact is so much harder and so much more pleasing if you know what you're doing.First of all I suggest you play this game with friends as it will help the experience and make sure you don't get killed immediately. So if you can get some friends to buy it when you do that's perfect. However if you can't do that try to make a friend on the community page for Rust and see if they'll play with you.Voice chat is an interesting feature in this game and works pretty well. You will run into the people who scream curse words in your face as they kill you but if you don't like this I'm pretty sure you can turn off voice chat in the settings.Now on to the community. Now although I have ran into nice people who want to team or leave me alone many are idiots who as I said earlier will scream curse words in your face as they kill you. But if you want a nice group of people to play with there are many small servers out there that will be good to you so just try to find the perfect server for you.Overall it's tons of fun with a semi high learning curve so if you do decide to buy it try to find a good tutorial online of how to survive and it will save you many hours of trouble. But if you can handle all that I've said above go ahead and buy the game it's awesome.

review: I've played Rust ever since Markiplier played Rust Alpha back in 2014. I've seen this game go through dramatic overhauls controversial changes and thought a whole lot about exactly why I hate this game as much as I do. And yet despite all the terrible things I hate about it and about the developers' decisions I still love the core gameplay and want to continue playing it.Rust is a survival game. But if you take a look at the community today it's clear that Rust has gone from a game about surviving in a harsh environment to a game about surviving from other players. That was probably the most significant shift the game went through and it happened gradually.Here's a list of most of the things that I dislike about Rust. The controls are clunky at best and at worst just bad. The game is terribly optimized and has long load times. You WILL lose all of your progress either to other players or a server wipe. You will be repeatedly killed over and over by toxic scumbags who have better weapons than you. You will spend hours and hours and hours getting resources only to have it stolen by a group or clan with more combined free time than you can ever hope to have. You will die a lot and a large percentage of your deaths will be from PVE t not because somebody was better at PVP than you. The developers do not listen to feedback and make extremely questionable decisions such as purposefully removing or omitting features for the sake of "realism".Despite all of that I still love the core gameplay of Rust that was introduced in 2013 and I encourage you to go watch the First Day trailer that convinced me to buy the game.The problem is that Rust tries to be both a Sandbox survival game AND a PUBG style pvp deathmatch game. It just doesn't work. However I will continue to adore the Sandbox Survival side of Rust and I hope that the developers see the potential that is being wasted by the direction this game is heading.

review: EDITED 7/5/18 I have waited for a few end of month updates before griping but I guess I will now complain. Linux build has always worked reasonably well for me at minimum and generally it was just shy of perfect. Naturally since actually releasing the game it is unplayable. I have learned that I am not alone so I feel justified amending this as the game is as of now for me suddenly unplayable. And it does not seem to be a problem that anyone cares about.Rust is either a survival game first person shooter role playing game troll's paradise or a clusterfleck of creative stupidity depending upon who you are and what you want out of it. It's more or less a sandbox that nurtures a style of play but it rarely constrains from playing using other styles. Despite the reluctance to label the game in part because that reluctance is what makes the game so uniquely interesting the fact is that you cannot avoid it being a shooter fairly exclusively for a large part of the player base. That means you will be shot at. If being shot at is a problem for you the game is likely not for you. Unless you seek an environment where such things are possible you generally will not be frolicking merrily through nature gathering materials. Well not for long anyway. Those that like to shoot seem to detest the gathering side of things so they are happy to allow you to do the work for them and work on their shooting.The player that simply can't engage in this sort of interaction is the sort of player that will be unlikely to find a niche in Rust. While the teaser from the developers remarks something along the lines of 'your only goal is to stay alive...' the reality is that it couldn't be farther from the truth. Dying is little more than an inconvenience. And often the greatest moments in the lore of retribution are born from a willingness to take a few .556 rounds on the chin. The message here somewhere is that mixed in amongst the serious shooter fellas that live to plunk anything moving are those that thrive on aggravating the serious shooter by mocking them relentlessly and resurrecting themselves to repeat the act until eventually the shooter realizes that he has gone through a pile of ammo to shoot at someone that seems to enjoy it.Such is life in Rust. or Death. I don't often review games and this honestly is a hard game for me to play regularly but I've put some time into it because it is for someone who grew up with the 2600 and Coleco just such a unique game in its diverse ecosystem of lunatics and tacticians. And despite the intermittent nature of my interest in the game all in all I'm not sure I've gotten better value out of a game. Even simply observing the development process and weekly updates is worth the price of admission.
title: Rust

review: Rust Gather resourcesHunt animalsEngage in gripping fights with a variety of weaponsMeet a high functioning autistic and naked indian man begging for items?The community is for the most part unintelligent seldom friendly and usually bearing a faked foreign accent.But it's great.It's difficult starting when you're alone especially when all the powerful and geared players possess the aforementioned idiosyncrasies. You will die. A lot. But its worth it for the fun experiences along the way. Once you get your bearings and gather a decent amount of supplies you can begin constructing a base and continue scavenging. If you work hard enough you can even acquire a gun eventually. It's great fun with friends and can even be scary at times.If you love the hunter gatherer survival genre this game is for you. It's easy to pour thousands of hours into this game and that's coming from someone with only 10+ hours. The devs are constantly improving the game and I see it going to bigger and better places in the future.

review: This game is great!There is actually only one negative aspect of this game and that is the community but there are so many servers so you can choose your "community". What is very important thought is DONT TAKE THIS GAME SERIOUS!I see many people complaining about the start of the game as a naked. If you have troubles to get started on a vanilla server try to find a modded server with more reccourses loot no Blueprints needed etc. It's simple as that.If you're completely new to the game find an empty server to figure the mechanics of the game or even play on LAN.Also if you dont understand the wipe system and you go into a full server after like a week of the wipe it's very easy to get frustrated. Don't do that except you exactly know what you're doing. Or you have friends on the server hooking you up.The build and craft system is the best I ever experienced and if you get the hang of it you can easely buld a starter base (1x1) in like 30 seconds. Or even a 2x2.There's even some "minecraft like" servers you can build the fortress of your dreams and live in peace. Therefore I dont know what else this game needs to offer to satisfy "all" gamers needs.Hope this helped all doubters )

review: THIS GAME IS PURE CANCER and is steadily getting worse. Currently it is not worth buying. The community consists of possibly the most cancerous filth in existence more so on any competitive server. The cheater problem has improved slightly but is still a big issue. Many players play for the singular purpose of causing maximum grief. They would rather camp your doors for 6 hours run into your turrets for 3 days straight to drain ammo wait all day to offline raid your base and all around grief you than play to have a good time. Mountains of trash are also talked non stop regardless of circumstances. There are non stop accusations and crying. Everyone is a " " "scripter" or "cheater" for simply killing someone. Even server administrators are cancer with false or harsh bans but I understand why with this community. The developers have habits of fixing what isn't broken breaking things and half finished irrelevant updates because they would rather listen to clueless crying roleplayers on reddit than people who can play well. A less than perfect but fairly skill reliant recoil system was replaced with a terrible aimcone system so any trash can could kill someone and now a recoil pattern with slight aimcone for only some guns that lets anyone become a god among men with easily obtainable scripts. Any step forward is followed by 2 steps back. The current game systems are as cancerous as the community. A simple component system for crafting was turned into a terrible blueprint system. A simple time based base decay system is now an upkeep system requiring large quantities of resources to maintain any base remotely close to large enough to protect loot. A medium sized base will last 12 hours or less before decay starts and a large one may be less than 6 if no one is on to refill it's tool cupboard so casual players are left to live in weak loot shacks. A neglected base decays in a few hours. The tool cupboard used for building privileges and upkeep can be easily griefed. If your base is raided an empty tool cupboard gets walled in and it decays away. A fresh server and blueprint wipe requires at least an entire day usually more to find and learn blueprints for effectively gathering building and fighting and much more time to find everything needed even with a big group. If you want to change servers you have to find all the items again on your new server making switching difficult. Tier 3 items require massive amounts of scrap to research and more for workbenches to craft them. You may need something but the guy with the blueprint is offline so too bad. Normal gameplay feels like you should be paid minimum wage just for doing it. Many groups are now running 20+ deep to compensate for these terrible systems and they do not care about crushing smaller groups. Most vanilla servers have at least 1 group like this and popular servers have many. If you like casually playing solo or with a few friends solo and small group play on big servers is not viable at this time. Unfortunately the game has degraded into almost requiring cancerous zergs of 20+ players and continues to go further in that direction. There are servers with low population group limits or mods which can be fun but these are restrictive not as competitive and are not the true game experience. This game is still and always will be. Edit They fixed it. Everyone is still cancer but the game works.

review: I had previously made a review about what I thought about Rust for the first 20 hours which went to the effect of "this game is not fun for solo you will get tilted do not buy" but I decided to delete it and give it another chance because I legitimately wanted to like it. I bought Rust to try something new. I heard it was pretty fun and from what I seen from people on youtube it was. After those six more hours I have to say sadly that much of what I had to say then has not changed. Tl Dr Don't get this unless you're fine with complete pvp toxic behaviour and a lot of death.Solo play is not only hard for any new players but will result in death eventually meaning even if you build a sizeable base and grinded your off someone will take your stuff and make you start over. You can just wake up on the beach and there will be swaths of people running around trying to kill freshspawns like you for no reason. Everyone wants you dead and even if you're lucky enough to last a few days someone or some one of the many clans with large towers camped on a nuketown will kill you and raid your base of everyhing you spent hours or days collecting.The only way you just might survive is by playing with friends and getting a gun/armor as well as being lucky enough to not be online raided. The problem stems from the fact that guns are locked by either the massive radiation from nuketowns where they commonly spawn and the campers already with guns who set up base there or the random drop blueprints. Not to mention the fact that for the most part players don't actually interact with each other unless they are also low level so joining a clan is unlikely. I don't know about the more experienced players but it feels as though the stars have to align for you to even begin to progress to end game. I guess I can't say this game is terrible because the premise is still really appealing but the gameplay has become so inseperable from the list of things wrong with this game. If you came for the crafting and long term exeperience go get minecraft save your money. If you like complete pvp and don't mind dying a lot get this game.

review: I bought this game like 3 days after it was released back in like 2013 or something in rust legacy.Used to be my favourite game but the devs ed it up in so many ways and funnily enough the reason its ed up is cause they actively listened to "the community" who have no idea how to make a good game.I witnessed the development of this game as they interected with "the community" on (((reddit))) who are 95% who make terrible suggestions and make awful opinions about how the game needed to be "fixed" just because they wanted to feel special like they're helping or something and get loads of dumb karma from their fellow reddit freaks.Reddit gave us &gt removal of standard blueprints ( ing quality system that worked really well)&gt the xp system (total fail now removed)&gt scrap metal system (which is ing boring and takes literally forever and is out right impossible if youre a solo player)&amp gt spawning locations and no good weapon loot from barrels (no way for naked newmans to easily team up and go farming/pking) This was when rust started to become really ing boring. We used to mostly spawn in like an esturary beach area on the map and thered be plenty of loot and to get. You could actually PLAY THE GAME as soon as you logged in but the freakshows who use reddit decided that wasnt good because theyre all fat stinking neckbeards who want to play 24/7 without seeing another player until theyve build a massive off fortress with their team of 100 people so then they can go out seeking peolpe with a 2x1 base so they can them up epic win style.Redditors said "oh pking newmans for their 100 wood huh? huh?" and actively moan about it on reddit. the problem was that the majority of people who killed newmans for 100 wood at the time... were other newmans just playing a different start up strategy. There were different ways to play the game when you started and that choice made it fun and interesting. Now you can only do one thing farm wood and hope you dont get shot by some bored bandit player. Maybe it would take 2 or 3 attempts to get decent stuff without dying. That was part of the game and also kept the beaches full of players so starting wasnt boring. Now instead you can only farm because theres no newmans to pk or any other alternative starting gameplay then after a couple hours you build your house log off wake up the next day to find yourself raided by the biggest clan in the game because that clan had literally nothing else to do because it became so easy for them to dominate the game as the game was purposely biased towards massive clans of organised nerds rather than normal people who just wanted to play for funThey tried to make the game fairer for newspawns but made it a lot ing worse. The adding of the sashes for people with "weapons" aka a ing stone hatchet or wooden spear etc was one of the worst ideas. Tricking and being tricked and the element of surprise and uncertainty was another thing that made the game actually fun. When they added the sash you just had numb skull clan members headshotting you from the roof of a building and running down to collect what they wierdly thought would contain ak 47s and rocket launchers. just because you had a sash on.Facepunch made it very difficult for newspawns to find friends and that caused a huge deteriation of communities within servers and ultimately lead to most people playing to either be sweaty nerds in 20 man clans or irritating 12 year olds with a combined server IQ of 41

review: Rust is a LOT of fun initially especially if you play with a bunch of friends on a populated server.The survival element is overcome early on and it quickly becomes nothing more than a king of the hill PVP battle arena.There's plenty to do and it is in a constant state of development. I recommend visiting rustafied for the latest and greatest news.My wife and I got this game through a contest to draw the best RUST artwork long ago and we have purchased this game for a number of friends over the last 2 years.Oddly it's something that keeps whispering to me after a long respite. "Come back" "We have a rock with your name on it"I would not doubt that this game may very well become a cult classic.

review: Great Game I Absolutely Love IT I recommend getting a friend with this game additionally.It is really perfect who the two types of people (In my opinion) that enjoy the survival games The crowded bigger servers for the bigger fans of PVP that would rather have a smaller base The smaller unpopulated servers for the people that just want to build and build (Me)The community is toxic but you'll only find that on the big servers the server that I spend time on everyone is cool. A main critism I see of the game that it doesn't see much in the terms of optimization and content. It is somewhat true but what I'm guessing is that it just rocks a smaller development team. The game continues the look better and better. It runs much friendlier to ARK and the menu looks better.As it is alpha here are some things I'm hoping to see in the future 1. More building options. As the game does have a building community I'd love to see more options to make more unique buildings.2. Furniture just look above for an explanation.3. Mounting Horses I heard this was in development but please.

review: This game is a heeping pile of toxic trash. It's supposed to be about surviving and building your base. It's not. You do that and you'll be called a role player. Most of the players are under age and many do not speak english. Expect annoying kids to jump on your head. Expect to be killed for your rock as soon as you wake up naked on the beach. Expect to be called names. Expect to bullied like you are in middle school. Expect to gather important items just get shot and lose them all. Then you do it again and get shot again. Expect no one to help you and then call you a noob. The game is complicated with annoying animals everywhere that randomly spawn in your path. The game lags. Guns are less powerful than a bow and arrow. Running from someone and finally making it to your door not be able to get in because of glitchy game mechanics. Die at the door base is raided unless you have air lock. Door campers. Tool cabinets are worthless because people use ladders and twig to climb your base. ANNOYING Kids kids kids and more kids. No one takes the game seriously and just shoots everyone. Have fun smashing your keyboard. There is no reward for acheivents. Blue prints are wiped every two months. Maps are wiped sometimes weekly. You don't level up. Nothing to show for your progress.

review: First Day Died a lot but found a friendly guy and me and my friend killed him and took his house. We starved to death.Second Day We tried again after wipe. I found a friendly dude who helped me make a house while my friend was brutally slaughtered over and over again.Third Day Got good Lost it. Got more good Lost it. Repeat like 12 times. Get off. Stop playing. Friend messages me saying we got raided. Got online. Some ing guessed my door codes in 30 tries and left a note telling me that. He also arranged rocks in my inventory to say FU. Logged off to a man smacking my house with a mace. Wrote this review. Friend logged on. Told me we got offline raided. this game. our outside door was opened and the inside door gone meaning they must have guessed the codes or if it was the same guy twice he was likely hacking. someone guessed our codes twice in one day. . this. game.7/10 its a good game at its core but it pisses me off more then any other. i'm conflicted with this game. everytime i got something good i would loose it within an hour. the only reason i got to the stage where I built a base was because i found a guy that helped me. on the other hand it can be fun. mostly when you arent getting jumped by some guy with a gun or crossbow from 100 feet away but instead when you are the person doing the jumping. unfortunately all i ever got to kill at the time of making this review were nakeds. if you can handle a game like this go ahead and get it. but if you arent willing to constantly loose hours of work over and ing over again dont buy it.
title: Rust

review: Best survival game nice graphics smooth transitions and beautiful pvp. This game is very grindy with a chance of losing all your progress in a split second but the reward of killing or raiding is amazing. People complain about the toxicity but that makes this game incredibly interesting. I have had so many incredible memories playing this game. To having people shouting bad words at me to people wanting to be my lover. This game will make you rage but it will also deliver the reward we all look for in survival games. This game also requires cooperation being a single in this game is terrible but if you find a good squad it is amazing.

review: This review will probably change with time.At the current state I wouldn't recommend buying the game. I regret buying early access. But why?1. Devs doesn't seem really know in what direction they want to take the game yet. And some has said they having been banned from the forums for having different opinions(?).2. It has been mentioned (AMA) that there probably won't be any way to see if someone is a "bandit" or not. This leading to point 3.3. The gameplay is basically a sandbox FPS (DM/TDM) and the survival aspect if fairly non existant unless you count being shot on sight by every player on the server. 4. Hackers. There has been messures take to fight hacking but they still linger. Build gather and see everything taken away from you in matter of moments by a hacker. And you will probably get banned from a server by having a good aim.5. There is no point playing on a pve server at this point. The only dangers is other players.I would recommend this game if 1. You like running with your pants down with the need to constantly cover your butt. Wild animals are a joke other players aren't.2. You love adrenaline rushes there will be plenty of those moments.3. You are ready to accept that you will be shot on sight no mater how friendly you are. And there is no telling who is a scumbag or not and there will probably never be a way of telling ever.4. Building a base is fun get ready to lose it to a hacker(s) with c4 or by non hacking raiding parties with c4.5. Good roleplaying possibilities.

review: Dev team is insane. They update it constantly they keep blogs that show what they are doing as well as what the community is doing. They don't always get it right but they listen to the community and make changes once they can come to a compromise. Put simply they are doing early access right.Now for actual gameplay.At it's core it is fairly polished and fun for early access. Guns are challenging to master and aren't just point and hold the trigger *boom* enemies dead. You'll look like an idiot if you do that.Base building is largely tactical. You can make some awesome structures but often you are limited by the meta of building the structure that will most efffectively deter raiders. They are addressing this with updates but it will largely remain the norm.Not recommended for Solo players unless you are actively scouting out for friends to team up with. Playing solo often ends up with disappointment and relocating to a modded server with 1000x resources just so you can reach the end game without waking up and finding your mini base blasted to smithereens.Community is what it is. Like all online games there are jerks. This one allows those jerks to be really in your face about it. Just be prepared for it. One day you will be a jerk right back at them and you'll love it. All's fair in love and Rust except for...Cheaters. Again like all online games there is the occasional cheater. Also again the devs are awesome about doing everything in their power to keep cheaters in line. It definitely hurts having your efforts thwarted by cheaters in this game but it is always worth picking yourself back up....Also 10/10 for the swarms of naked people with rocks having orgies on your corpse.

review: One of the best survival games ever created. Still in early access and under heavy development. The Dev's update the game WEEKLY with an awesome devblog and they really listen to the community.My two biggest problems with this game is that 1. Clans run everything and it seems to only be getting worse. Solo play often leads to daily raids and unable to progress.2. Lack of PvE content. The animals are a joke. Bears are very strong but are so easily outsmarted. The pathing for animals will send you into a rage when you really need animal fat and they no clip straight through huge rocks.Even with this issues this is still by far one of the best Survival games available. If you're interested in survival games at all and you don't have this change that.

review: Well it's out so time to NOT recommend this game. Though I DO like some elements in it and it CAN be really fun it essentially boils down to this You log off and someone usually with a big group of players that plays 23 hours a day destroys hours of your work. And by that point you've lost so much you can never hope to catch up in time so you might as well leave the server and find a new just wiped one.OR You get 5 friends and destroy xXxTHEMIN3CRAFTBEAST08xXx's shack that he spent 10 hours building and ruin his day. Hooray?It's either be the or be subject to s unless you want to set up patrols with your friends or play all by your lone self. At which point the game becomes a mechanical chore rather than something you look at your steam library and go "Hm yeah Rust seems like a good game to play today". No. If you start playing Rust you better get your on the server or get a friend on the server to grind for better resources and structures the next day or you can kiss all your bye bye.The hard problem is that this does NOT seem to have an easy solution it has been speculated that whilst yes you could adopt a system akin to Arma 3 Exile in which you keep your inventory and actually disappear when you disconnect but this game has attracted a very vocal niche of players that would oppose most if not all changes to the core login systems. Because in Rust your character stays in the in game world whenever you log off "Sleeping" meaning that you can get robbed and killed while you are not playing. Whilst this does add to the tension of it there is nothing fun about losing your to "SasukeUchiha065726" when you were asleep. Whilst it is not uncommon for games to reward you for playing them this is the only one that will actively punish you for not doing so routinely.It rewards the few that can and want to play it (And only it) constantly throughout the server's lifecycle and punishes those who even hope can catch up.
title: Rust

Your main objective is to survive and to do that you must feed clothe and provide shelter for yourself. Once you get a foothold then you start focusing on making weapons and going on the hunt for supplies. To get the full experice though I highly suggest you find a friend that you can have fun with. If you are looking into this game make sure you prepare yourself for a bit of a learning curve but once you get over that this game can eat away the hours

review: Cons You know Rust there is a lot of grind and the community is mostly comprised of antisocial psychopats. That being said I am still giving this game a positive review because of the following pros Pros + The MAIN pro is the availability of modded and community servers. Modded servers take most of the frustrating part of the game away. Servers with increased gather rates and Zlevel make the game enjoyable even for casuals like me who can not afford to spend 8 hours a day in the game. Other mods include the ability to teleport to other players set and teleport between your homes erase walls inside your base and pick up tier 3 workbenches (yay to that) voting system to skip night time starter kits etc. Basically those modded servers make the game less punishing less grindy and more fun for casuals like me.+ No pay to win. You pay only once for the game. You can buy skins if you want to look cool but that does not affect item stats.+ Great atmosphere graphics outstanding sound design+ Well thought of crafting system+ Overal balanced gameplay good gear matters but it does not define who is going to win the fight.+ You can build whatever you want and there is a great freedom when designing your base you wanna do a trap base? a roleplay base? a castle? a cozy log cabin? Rust allows you to do all of that and more.+ Devs are constantly adding new stuff to the game fixing bugs and taking the game to the right direction IMO.

review: I would consider rust a game that can be both extremely fun or a painstaking experience in most servers there is a lot of griefing as you'd expect in any survival game especially to new players whenever this game comes on sale.If you know what you're doing the game isn't that hard in the beginning but getting to that point either requires a fresh server (wipes happen frequently but there's always the search for a good enough random gen map to survive on)my biggest issue is how the game deals with solo players the experience by yourself can be quite boring and tedious and I'd suggest a team of 2 3 people on most serversIn general this is probably the best survival game out on steam and has some good polish on it besides some LOD issues which by god it's terrible if you can put up with the initial learning curve of the game you should be alright.
title: Rust

review: Originally meant to be a reply for Kelmont 's review but got too long. (Text is written as if he was the reader)I don't agree. In the list below I'll be showing counterarguments from my perspective in your order.1. Solo might be hard and unsafe but that is why everyone else is also recommending that Rust is a game that is played best with friends. Bows and spears are still amazingly good and doesn't need to get better. They require practise and that's the whole point. Get better get bigger.2. If you have a problem with noncommunicative stranger players then you should try find a specific server that supports people looking for a friendly atmosphere.3. A lot of people still talk over chat. Most likely talk over other 3rd party programs such as discord teamspeak or skype. Again if you want people to talk more find a server specifically made for that or host your own.4. ...Mic? really? if that is really your central negative perspective of the game then you should try doing the above that I wrote still. There are many friendly servers with helpful people all around.You "undoubtly" sound like your angry and just have experienced the basic "after raid feeling" and you have gotten tired of it and given up.I have had many hilarious experiences with strangers strangers to friends and friends in Rust. Though Rust is fully released they are still making the game better as the great developers Facepunch are. Your target is a part of the community/people that doesn't even nearly describe Rust.You can't change toxic people. They are in every game (Those neckbeards smh.) But stopping people from buying the game is basically going against yourself and improving the percentage of toxic players. (As I'm assuming that you are talking to non toxic people.)Facepunch is continuesly making the game easier for newcomers and creating a more exciting and more skillbased world.There is the old motto from Rust legacy that still stands as we are in the new Rust "Don't trust in Rust". They are many types of people in the game. Some will take advantage to your empathy and backstab you. Some are generous and will help you and a few will just be a standard player between the both as they wouldn't come off as a and not putting themselves in risk of getting backstabbed.It is indeed sad to see how newcomers are greeted with getting into Rust without any knowledge in the game and gets insta KOS'ed but that will be enough to have then be able to adapt to the game.The only people that would have a hard time at the game would be high tempered and sensitive people in my opinion.But...*cough cough*There are downsides to the game. It takes A LOT of dedication to get the full experience. Either you play on a modded 5x server that is just 100% KOS or you'll actually have to use around 2 5+ hours everyday. Oh yeah and zergs steamhappy
title: Rust

Like workbench level 1 is good but two? 500. Seriously? review: Rust. Hmm what to say. I love it but yeah its frustrating.If you have some friends it is way more enjoyable. No you don't need a zerg clan of like 15 or 20 to have fun. With 2 or 3 dedicated individuals it is a lot of fun and you can accomplish a lot.For those whining about being killed by zergs go play on servers that have group limits.The gunplay is great the building is really fun as well.If you are the whiny quitter type don't bother playing Rust its not for you. As exemplified by a lot of the latest reviews.Yes you are going to get killed by a guy with an AK. Yes you will probably be naked at the time or just have a bow. There will always be tool bags out there that kill nakeds they do so because they can't kill similarly geared players. Its like this in every game.To summarize Rust is a great game. Fun combat. Great building. To newbies out there i suggest playing on smaller servers (community) with limited group size. Learn how to do things like build a base and then go to the bigger servers with some friends and it will be a lot of fun.

review: Updated July 2018 I don't understand why this game is so popular. It had a lot of potential at one time but never really achieved that or anywhere close to it. A lot of the features now were ok when the game was very early because they were simple albeit poorly done but at least they existed. The fact that they are still there is just bad. The crafting and overall game is very uninpsired. The entire game play just seems like the least amount of work or content that they could possibly add then just kept running with that. 4yrs later and there are MUCH better alternatives in the survival genre. Go play those. 2014 review It could be a good game eventually but I think it still has pretty far to go. There really isn't much to do in it yet but build some VERY basic buildings and find a few tools.

review: Pros This is by far one of the most intense and amazing games I've played in the last few years. I bought this game 1 year ago on my other account and have played over 350 hours. There is so much to do in this game and is so many possibilities and opportunities to have fun and do what ever you wish. There are modded servers official (vanilla) and community. All of which are fun. If you don't like the PvP aspect and like the suvival play PvE if you don't like the gathering mechanic play times 1000. There are even servers dedicated to Battle royal PvP Times (#) PvE etc. Cons This takes a really good computer to run so if you get bad FPS I'd recommend turning the resolution down to 1280x720 and graphics to Fast. I average 40 Fps at those settings with an "Okay" computer.I would recommend this game to every kind of person because there is a game mode for you. This is my alternate account and i Game shared it to this account. I do own the game and have 350 hours in game.

review: Let me start by saying I had many friends recommend this game for months and I was not looking for yet another survival game. I put it off for a long time. Then under the instruction that a few of my closest friends would hang out and we could chat again I made the choice to buy it. Holy crap I don t know if they named it RUST because that is what your car will be doing while you are too busy playing this game or if your mind will rust from all the naked wangs in your face as you continually get beat down by strangers. Yes this game is amazingly fun. Way better than all of the other survival games I have played. If you are on the fence about this game as I was buy it now. You won t be let down. I love playing with my friends again and this game is a hoot to say the least. Just pray when you login for the first time that you are well endowed as a man or a woman so you to can Wang Chung tonight.

review: When I first bought the game I started to doubt on it's performance graphics and how stable it was. Because it was in Early Alpha all thees were a problem and I hadn't played it for about a year.But now when I start it again after a years time when it seems to be out of Early Access. It has dramatically improved it's graphics are remarkable I adore when the sun sets because it's just like being there. Survival is the main aspect of Rust and you are able to roam in groups or solo trying to get other groups assets raiding killing animals for food cutting down trees finding stone making a shelter etc. This game is one of the best I've played and do not hesitate to buy it.

review: Edit After having this game for a while I can say that it still is a great game with friends yes the community can be toxic but honestly just ignore it. This game is to good to not enjoy (i.e. play on emtpy servers or just with freinds.)Rust is one of those games that you will either love or hate. The main reason being is that you will die A LOT. This game revolves around two ideas. Looting and Building. These ideas are supported by one "Thought". Killing. Here's a tip for you. Never ever by any circumstances trust a naked man stating that he is friendly. He WILL kill you. Honestly thats how rust works betrayal murder and MANY deaths. But all in all Rust is a pretty solid game when it comes to fun. Especially when you have a group of friends with you. The building is fun the combat is fun and the experience is just hilarious. (AND HORRIFYING)I'd rate this game a 9.5/10 for probably being one of the best sandbox shooters on the market.

review: Rust used to be fun but at many veteran players will tell you it has gone massively downhill due to an extremely toxic fanbase as well as development updates. Facepunch looks to the future and optimistically talk of console releases and a 'final release' though continue to ignore the massive optimisation issues and buggy gameplay that plagues most every player trying to get ahead in the game. Frequent stutters when entering PvP as well as frame drops and crashing is something experienced by every single player to some extent. This game was far from ready to be released from early access. Not worth paying for full price at the moment though perhaps a t a 50% discount.

review: Product received for free. The game is very fun to run around in get loot and build bases and go to popular places to get more loot and meet new people whether its in a gun fight or just talking to random noobs around the map. I would only recommend this game to dedicated gamers though because it takes a lot of work to get a good base and good loot and there is a lot of grinding in this game. Also everything gets reset every month or week to allow new players to have a chance. I personally like the 5x or above servers since I dont have a lot of time to spend grinding but overall the game mechanics are great and graphics are great. I bought this game to play with friends and it has been super fun so overall I would recommend it.

review: Hmmmmmmmm tricky I hate love and like this game all in one . Obviously it's in early access and they are still making this game fully and it's got a long way to go. Yes I do recommend it but I feel like this game gets better with some updates and then gets terrible with other updates. If you like a open world survival and overall grindy gameplay go for it buy this game. but this game does have a lot of potential... lets get into it First if when I bought this game I loved it. I played it for days I recommended it to all my friends and continued playing it. But slowly as each major update came I grew slowly and slowly away from it until I can't be bothered to play it anymore and I'm waiting until the game fixes some of the issues that have been there for the start of the game like when your aiming you gun it's shakes and makes it hard to aim the recoil on some guns are terrible when you shoot it flames come out after the bullet making it hard to see where your firing animals going inside mountains and many more no matter how hard we complain about them they never get fixed. So my issue is that yes it's an early access so listen to the community and what they want fixed so that you can make your game better other than that the game is pretty solid. It gives you hours of gameplay addictive game mechanics while your trying to survive the harsh wilderness of rust and overall a fun experience for you and your friends so finally yes I recommend it but it has some serious problems that need to be fixed. So if you want my advice buy it try it out if you absolutely hate it refund it or if you like it play it and if you sorta like it hold onto it and wait for future updates because this game has got massive potential )

review: Where should I start well... the game is loads of fun although I dont have a whole load of hours in the game I do thoroughly enjoy it but I find it's only enjoyable with friends. In my case (and many other peoples) this game is only ever found fun with other friends and in groups not many people enjoy the struggle of playing this game solo as the majority of servers are heavily populated and can contain big clans. The overall gameplay is great if you enjoy minig and resource collecting it has that aspect if you enjoy intense PVP it has that apect if you enjoy both well lucky you it contains a very heavy dosage of both. All in all this game is very strategic (base placements and raiding) intense (PVP) and buckets loads of fun! On a side note the level of developer attention is phenomenal as there is wekly updates (every Thursday) and the game has gone through various changes in order to find a sweetspot for gameplay so expect pretty rapid development and a lot of neat ideas and in my eyes definitely worth the buy! (Especially as its only 15!!!)

review: Fun concept and probably the most refined game in the "anarchy" genre there will ever be but in the end it's not really worth the time investment. The 10 hours I have played have been interesting though.I get a lot more enjoyment out of watching Ramsey's insanely well edited YouTube videos of Rust gameplay than I do from actually playing Rust and for a much lesser time investment.Perfect for NEETs who somehow own a gaming machine or any stupid LARPer who would end up fighting with ISIL if they weren't playing this. Otherwise don't buy unless there's a 33% sale or something I'd say. Disclaimers I have been playing without friends to help which is probably not as fun. My computer's GPU is a fermented potato which may have affected my ability to engage in combat. My only experience has been playing on a server less than a week away from being wiped. Some notes about my specific experiences I was on an Australian server generally ranging in about 30 70 active players. I wanted to go for a diplomacy and stealth oriented gameplay. * 'Stealth' raids are unlikely to be achievable solo and without the resources. * There are a lot of diplomatic players who just aren't interested in killing solo players or newbies. The immediate response to strangers in a lot of cases is to just throw objects in front of you. This is how a lot of trade ends up happening amusingly. + A very nice chinese boy actually helped me upgrade my base. It was awkward since his only English was "I'm so sorry " but I ended up with a metal door and stone walls in the end. * However not all players are diplomatic. Sometimes it's just their way of playing the game and perfectly rational and these players will not take things from your corpse that are valuable to you and not them. Other times especially close to wipe people are just going out of their way to ruin other people's fun and won't actually play rationally. + (tl dr people who play this game can be stupid but powerful pieces of A group of relatively crappy players who happened to have much better weapons than I did killed me while I was collecting wood despite yelling at them to stop. I assume they were going raiding. They took a key to the cabinet in my base (never will I have a key on it again) which made it sort of difficult to continue after logging off because my base would degrade. They did not get into my base as far as I know because it was pretty well secured. I had a lot of resources that they might have wanted. If they had stopped to listen to me I could have been diplomatic and offered them resources very valuable to them and they would have not killed me and stolen my cabinet key which was only really valuable to me. I would feel a bit more salty but they probably saved me from wasting another 5 hours dicking around on a server that was close to wipe. Getting enough scrap to do anything is damn annoying. When your microphone doesn't work you're pretty much dead whenever you see a person with at least as much gear as you. I found a guitar which was pretty cool and a fun way of trying to demonstrate friendliness but it sounded a bit glitchy. It takes a while to end up feeling safe enough on a server to log off and you feel the need to be logging on before your base starts degrading from lack of resources in your cabinet. (Even then someone with a lot of explosives could raid you while you sleep). Rust would be a very different game if this weren't the case though. If I had a week or two where I could play on a Rust server from wipe with a couple of good friends full time without destroying my life I would love to do so but sadly this will never happen.If you read all of this why the hell did you read all of this?

Should you?How far are you willing to go to survive?

review: This game was amazing with it's novelty but since the past years the game mechanics haven't drastically evolved which left us with a salty pvp oriented game in which you can almost only play with a bunch of people in order to have fun past 50 hour of gameplay. There's also the fact that without communication there is absolutly no way to have safe relationship. Which lead to the problem of having to exel in english to play the game which is something that I've found really blocking. Rust is about a wide generated world where there is no rule it's like a big sandbox literaly. . I would'nt hate seeing RPG content there's alot of room for many idea as I said the game mechanics didn't really improve it's pretty much the same as in the first first rust. Even if I truly enjoyed this game when I played with friend (because alone it's pretty much impossible) I would give this game a 6 at first I would have given a 8 but considering how stagnated the game is well it doesn't deserve more than a 6 for now at least hope this game and it's concept can get further.Edit Oh well playing alone is now even harder to keep up a somewhat hard to raid base you need to grind big ressources to avoid decay to get some somwhat usefull blueprint you need to grind for ing 10 hours straight assuming you're not getting killed too much think about it 10 hour of gameplay to do only one thing breaking freaking barrel that give you 1 metal scraps and then you gotta farm 5000 scraps to have decent equipement and then there's the wipe you ing grinded your whole life on freaking barrel to have gun bewhile you got raided and you didnt have luck so suck for you man good luck for next wipe. Yeah. This game in its current state is really not for playing in solo I don't recommend that you buy it if it is for playing alone you wont have fun for much that optimistic 50 hour of gameplay tbh I'd say that after 25 you'ill be bored asfck. Glad I only paid 10 15 $ for the early version years ago I for sure would never pay 40 $ for this incomplete game

review: Never play in a highly populated / medium populated server if you're a solo player. You'll just get your kicked by everyone else who's already ahead in the game. Its better to start from a low to zero populated server and learn everything first. Even then you'll still get owned. The game is very immersive you would hardly notice the time pass by as you think of the plans on how to build your base. Unfortunately after a few minutes it'll get raided. It's a PVP game after all so you cant complain. Majority of the players will also kill you on sight so rather than thinking you're playing with people you can communicate with it's best if you either run away or try to kill them. If you're only a casual gamer like me you'll find it very difficult to progress from this game. You will need to grind to keep your base from falling apart and you will also have to keep watch from getting raided.

review: Rust is a solid game. I can say after having played for over 150 hours solo and with large groups. Rust is honestly a lot of fun. However that does not mean that the game is not without it's fair share of problems. PROS Fun easy to understand average survivor elements very large open world decent and simple building system constantly updated and worked on decent graphics even on lower settings. CONS Price of game doesn't quite match the value of the game in my opinion PvP is far too encouraged making it hard for new players to enjoy the game not enough in game activities game is easily hacked. Overall the game is fun and easy to understand however the lack of in game activities and heavy PvP incentive means that most of the time you will find yourself doing 1 of 4 things...gathering building raiding or being raided. Which isn't inherently bad but it makes the game seem very 1 note and dull at times. I have personally found myself bored at times after all the raiding and building is done there isn't much left to do. I spent a lot of time just sitting in my base making metal fragments and organizing my storage boxes. In short I feel that the game needs more PvE elements. Something that will give people more things to do while also steering the game slightly away from PvP while also keeping it an option. All in all I do recommend the game if you're looking for a new survival game with less survival elements. Just note you will be mostly building gathering and raiding and you will find yourself becoming bored at times.

review: Its amazing how a great game can go from good to bad so simply. I have had issues with alot of the new content since its adaption from Legacy. Some have been fixed others seem to remain as permanant reminders of a game that still in its alpha beta stages. The Devs while capable programmers seemed to have lost sight on the playability of the game for small clan or solo players. Back in legacy there was only one real way to raid a base and that was to fight your way up this worked because damage was focused on a singular path but since the introduction of rockets you can just mow down a whole base from a safe distance and the bigger the clan the more rockets youll own thus giving even a group of three or four people no chance to make a base big enough to withstand an attack should it be raided. Then theres the insta wall im talking 2 story high solid stone or wood walls. Just dropped down anywhere outside a build zone as a baricade for raiders the realism in this is so broken which in turn makes the game broken as well.Then theres the other implementations that come and go like the xp system ladders on any wall able to build thatch within build zones like really thats just offline raiding simplified. All these add up to the devs struggling to balance the game by over complicating it or bringing elements that may seem realistic but in a game just make bad play. Then theres the grinding long before I gave up trying to defend a base I grew bored of grinding for materials. Its not that you shouldnt have to do it but only to get established but after that game play should be directed away from tedious chores and directed to the fun stuff. So why do they nerf the only automation of resource collecting in the game?Initially youll enjoy the game but eventiually you'll get tired of the broken systems the trolls and other menial mentalities that seem to be attracted to this game and eventually like me you will end up regretting having wasted hours of your life feeding a sub culture of toxicity.The devs do their best to prevent hackers but there are so many out there and have made this a pay to win game in a way depending on the server admin try to keep the hackers out but they cant be on 24/7 and in one major server I played on a hacker was a major donator and openly flaunted his superiority. (Yes niglet of Rustralasia name and shame your just scum of the highest degree for ruining onlines games for everyone else)Despite the negatives I have mentioned the game can be fun if you find a server with active admin these servers the Hackers tend to keep a low profile which gives the game a more playable experience but these are rare and youll be lucky to find them.

review: Rust is a game I absolutly love ruined by a community of absolute hate.Horrible grind The majority of getting better equipment to defend yourself and to build a better base relys on luck not skill. Large loot tables gives you very little opportunity of finding exactly what you want making the game about just searching randomly across the island and hope you stumble upon what you're looking for. s everywhere This game is shoot first don't ask questions. The community is mostly made up of mostly people who want to kill you raid your base ruin your progress and move onto the next person. PVP Total garbage. Whoever has the better connection will win 90% of the time. YouTube So many YouTubers emphesize that the fun of the game is only in RAIDS and killing SALTY PLAYERS new players feel like the game is about hating and killing ever single person you see. It's really great.So if you're still reading then let me tell you this under all this that has come up with Rust there is still a great game. It's beautiful the crafting is quite fun and exploring is really amazing. And if you're brave try to befriend a stranger in game have a conversation build a base together and log in 12 hours later to see that your trust was well placed. And there you will find the true beauty of Rust.

review: Ahhh you look at that trailer and think wow this could be a fun little game... YOUR DEAD WRONG.STEP 1. SPAWNSTEP 2. RUN FOR YOUR LIFESTEP 3. DIE BY HIGH LEVEL PLAYERSSTEP 4. BUILD A LITTLE SHACKSTEP 5. GET FLAME RAIDEDSTEP 6. RINSE AND REPEAT UNTIL YOU LEARN SOME THING. Then go wow I lasted longer this time and I made a couple cool new items I mean I died but I took a step. In all serirousness "Rust" is not friendly nope proabably never will be and that sucks for new players and people trying to solo this game but it's just what rust is. It's not minecraft it's not ark survival it's rust... A hardcore survival game and if you don't plan on playing with friends or at least having the patience and time to make new ones or try you are proabably not gonna have fun and I say stay away from this title otherwise you will most likely regret it. But if you put in lots of time patience convice a couple buds to hang on for dear life with you... you might just have some fun and have a good time.STEP 7. CRY LIKE A LITTLE

review: This game is decidedly in every sense of the word alright. While the gameplay and content are of high quality and I've been following the development of this game (by the creators of Garry's Mod) since its first build it simply isn't shaping up to be what I had originally hoped. The community is rather toxic and focused on ruining new players experiences and playing by yourself is a sure way to have a bad time. The game is entirely online on individual servers meaning that you generally are forced to play with people who want to give you trouble. There is also a huge host of community made consmetic items that are in a sort of soft lootboxy steam marketplace position that I don't feel comfortable with. The revolution in playerbase attitudes that this game would need to appeal to most people is unlikely to ever happen. I could only recommend this game on some sort of sale but only if the buyer has friends to play with. Giving a negative review after so many hours of sticking around to see where things go makes me upset. That being said I'm going to keep checking in to see if things improve and if they do I will update my rating accordingly.

I proceeded to make a small but cozy fort conisting of stone. The night was dark cold and mysterious. I then hear 4 5 people running past my small cozy fort. I try not to make a sound I open my small box a few feet from my in game character. It made made an obnoxious thud. I shout. The foot steps quickly halt. I try to remain silent but my efforts are in vain. THEY know I'm here. One calls out "Who's the stain living in this pile of " I was undoubtably scared. Although I wasn't going to take from anybody who dares discrace my base's appearance so I build up my courage I chant I can do this over and over I sprint out with my trusty rock which allowed me victory with my previous hostile encounter I hit one with a solid hit knocking him unconcious I turn to the other I pounce with primal instincts dictating all my actions I bash his face in with a solid blow from the right He was tougher than his buddy The strucked raider regained his footing and hastily pointed his gun at me. I quickly swing to the right staying out of the range of their flash lights...... Too be continued.

review: REVIEW UPDATED APRIL 4TH 2018 Please consider this review if you wish to know the most honest review for this game from someone who has a mature ethical point of view for life. Played for over 380 hours and it took me only 25 to realize all this. My score for this game 5/10. Yes score first. Because this game is currently impossible to play. I uninstalled this game about 2 months ago.Pros Very interactive game very fun to play with friends PVP and building creativity can pump your heart with blood and adrenaline. With the naked bodies funny motion movement and the aggression of low quality players the game shows a strong sense of humor especially during PVP. You will lose yourself a lot and get laugh tears during some interactions.Cons IMPOSSIBLE TO PLAY UNLESS YOU ARE WITH A GROUP OF 5! With the addition of the new blueprints components and decay it is has become very hard to keep up as a solo player. Especially when clans of 5 20 people roam around the server destroying every fresh spawn/duo/solo they see. You can spend 40 hours farming and researching and then get demolished in 15 minutes by a clan of 10 who split hard work you just did. HACKERS! HACKERS HACKERS! Yes Facepunch doesn't seem to care about the ruined experience in games. They would rather have a couple of hackers rebuying their game due to VAC bans. Aimbot ESP file scripts flying all kinds of things are common and seen daily in almost every server in SEVERE amounts (25% of all players in an official server use some sort of a hack and try to make it less obvious on purpose with all kinds of tricks). It make take weeks for official servers to ban a hacking player. Facepunch spends their time enhancing the design aspects of the game (adding lots of useless items colors trees etc) but not the overall user experience. NO AGE/INTELLIGENCE RESTRICTION IN THIS GAME! You will find A LOT of little kids who will try to chase you with a rock and yell the dumbest and immature things into their budget microphones. If you are above 20 you will have issues losing your temper because some kids will just you off to a brand new limit. There are a lot of immature 6 14 year olds playing this game with poor logic skills who will interfere between you and the excitment of this game. There is a severe use of foul language coming most players foul language that pops out randomly in chat at a critical level literally for no reason (most think it's funny). I haven't encountered this problem even in games like Call of Duty. Little kids and some of their parents think this game is Minecraft but it's not. If you read the game description you will see VIOLENCE BLOOD GORE NUDITY and more. I've encountered TODDLERS playing this game and I am not joking when I say TODDLERS!! Bugs and graphics need to be improved and balanced. As a jr. game developer it is easy for me to tell that the game has an unbalanced rendering system. My gaming computer has a GTX 960 4GB with i7 6700K and 32GB of DDR4 and I temporarily drop down to 20 40 fps when it renders further terrain (medium high settings). This issue happens to many people I play with. I have tried a lot to try to fix the issue even reprogrammed the game and overclocked both GPU and CPU but that didn't do much with this game. I really do not want to spend another $450 for a top notch graphics card just because of the unbalanced rendering. Animations are sloppy and slow (but improving). You will find a 4 7 second delay every time you switch and prepare a different weapon. Getting you killed and ruining the pvp experience. MOST of community members in this game are very salty spicy toxic and mentally violent/ill. A lof of foul language sexual content and violent interactions between players. Something you will have hard time finding in other FPS/TPS games. But you have to consider this when you buy this game and when the game's fan base mainly consists of underaged kids and lazy puberty teens. Other than that the game WAS really fun addicting and made me stay until 5AM.I would NOT recommend this game. I hope it improves because it is hard to play this game with all those issues.

review: I love this game but I wouldnt if there weren't a few factors. 1. Community Servers have a less toxic atmosphere most of the time. They make playing the game bearable. 2. Some ( Community ) servers dont allow massive clans. Maxxing out how many players can ' team up ' so you dont have a group of 30 people making the entire server unplayable. 3. Ive grown with the game even when they broke core mechanics. It's not perfect and I dont think it'll ever be ' perfect ' but I can see myself doubling my playtime. It's worth the price of admission if you're willing to stick to the weird skill progression. I suggest going on community servers not main servers if you want to actually play. Otherwise clans will murder you wether you started a minute ago or if you've been on the server since wipe day.

review: I love Rust. I have played it for a long time and watched it progress from legacy. The only thing that is a dealbreaker for me is the playerbase. the whole core gameplay comes down to the playerbase. It is (was) the best thing about Rust. The game turned into a sizing contest about who can KOS better and who can Raid better. The community makes the game what it is and the community decided to make it a KOS and raid game. The "playstyle" of the servers are pretty much all the same now. There is so much more to this game rather than just killing everything in the server. the game is great and I have a great time playing it. The whole game boils down to one thing. patience. People will wait outragous amounts of time to door camp you or to wait for you to get offline so they can offline raid you. it doesnt matter how much better at the game you are if they wait longer you lose. if you want to have a good time playing rust and you have more than a day. Join a clan.

I literally never write reviews cause im lazy AF but i had to take the time to write this one to tell everyone dont waste your damn time. I cannot say it enough this game is a waste of time.

review: Rust is one of my all time favourite games. Look at my library and compare it to the amount of hours spent on other games. Rust tops every game I own almost 3 times over. That makes it in my opinion a good game. There are however negatives to account for. First of all. The game has been in early access for a long period of time (4 years edging on 5) but it is receiving constant weekly updates showing progress that the team at facepunch are attempting to create to enhance gameplay for us the consumer. There have been many changes in the "system" in rust. When I say system I mean how the game plays. The first "system" was the blueprint system and was within the game for around 2 3 years. This system was loved by many players for its simplicity yet challenging nature. It challenged the player to find scraps of the blueprint to obtain items within the game that are increasingly rarer. This went from lower tier items like roadsign armour and pickaxes to items such as AK's and Metal Armour. This system required the player to spend larger amounts of time within the game to grind for better items (Note rust is a game where time has to be available. One cannot simply join a server and expect to find AK's and higher tier items. This takes time and gathering). The second system was the XP system which was liked and disliked by many players. It took the aspect of grinding to another level. I remember when the system first came out my group and I despised it as it was simply farm kill harvest repeat until the golden level of 31 was reached for the ultimate item the rocket launcher. This change to the system was upsetting to not only myself and my group but hundreds and thousands of players who were thrilled by the raiding aspect of Rust. It was acclaimed as the system where farming and free time were key. After a wipe sinking 30 hours into a base and gaining level was a common sight for many Rust players. This system had its pros and cons like all the others but was generally the most disliked.The third and final system is the current system Components/Blueprints. This system was a comforting relief. I did not have to sink an initial 30+ hours to simply be up the XP level for an item I wanted but simply had to find the resources components and build away. I at first was unsure of this system but came to like its simplistic nature and accessability to the more average rust player who has to balance his/her life with work school or other activities and can only manage to scramble 5 10 hours a week. It gave the player a chance to have PvP guns and armour without sinking their life into what some would say a pointless video game. After a while the system seemed too good to be true. In true facepunch style (sorry for the hate but most players will agree) they f*****d it up again. This was when the component system was merged with a new and improved blueprint style system. This implemented an item called scrap. Scrap is an item which is used for most activities in rust such as researching an item to craft and use it later on making a workbench and recycling components. Now when this first came out I wasn't too fussed and played along not seeing what the problem was. This wasn't until our group started to thin out to around 2 3 active players a week. Gathering scrap was to say the least difficult. Items such as AK's require 750 scrap to research and not to mention the cost of a Tier 1 2 and 3 Workbench accumulating to 2000+ scrap. This is to simply craft items. Not to mention rust has an enourmous quantity of items in the game. Tier 3 items are the most sought after and usually cost 750 scrap each. Let's jsut say it is quite a lot of scrap for lets say a solo player. This system although good and bad in its own way is detering newer players from even buying the game. They look up rust solo for instance and see a player ranting about absurd scrap costs. This singular thing is stopping people from playing the game. It is hard enough to survive in rust and keep a base for longer than a few days and facepunch decide to complicate it even more by increasing difficulty every patch. I want people to like this game. I thoughroughly enjoyed it. It has been and experience going through new systems testing out new base ideas pvp'ing making friends and more and more. Rust can be a good game but facepunch please listen to your audience. Make the game more user friendly. Right now it is a game which acts like more of a deterent rather than an enjoyable experience.I want to recommend this game to all of the current people thinking of buying it but warn you of the possible negative experiences and time you will need to play the game. Shmack

review: *WARNING* Don't waste your money and your time regardless if it is an Alpha release or not.This game is PLAGUED by hackers. It is a hackers freaking paradise. You can easily spend hours mind crafting everything you need only for it to either be taken away or destroyed at a whim by a hacker.Types of hacking programs that hackers use in this game are Speed Hacking. NoClip Hacking. God Mode. Flying. High Jumping. Walking &amp Shooting through walls. Aim Botting. ESP. (ESP can locate all of your items and resources that you have hidden anywhere in your base). You name it these hackers pretty much have every hack you can think of.VAC &amp Admin bans are useless against players that use hacks because they just keep coming back. And when they do get banned you can be rest assured that a DDOS attack on the server is not far behind. Admin support is close to 0% active.Every server that you can think of has hackers. Some have less some have more. The worst are the official servers which tend to have hackers everywhere due to the lack of Admin's monitoring those systems.When I first purchased the game I was unaware how prevalent the hacking issue was. After about the 2nd/3rd month of hopping from server to server to find and enjoy a hack free game I finally gave up and stopped playing. There were talks that the development team was working with a new company which was to provide better security against hackers. So after a 6/8 month hiatus I decided to give it another chance. This was a huge mistake on my part. Not only where the hacking issues unresolved it seemed to have grown considerably worse. Currenlty the development team is revamping the entire Rust game onto a new engine. There are talks that you will be required to download a program prior to playing Rust. This program will monitor each player to identify if they are using hacks or not. When caught the program will immediately ban that player on the spot. Personally I think by the time they get it right there will be no community left that will be interested in playing this game.Originally I had posted a review back in the day. The review stated that if the Development team was unable to get a handle on these hacking issues it would end up destroying the game play and the community. Sure enough this has come to pass. The community for this game has shrunk greatly. Servers that used to be full of players are now housing only small handfuls here and there and yes hackers are still prevalent on these systems. I'm not sure when the new version of Rust will be launched but my advice is to stay away. Stay away until there are more positive reviews that the game play and community have been restored to somewhat healthy levels and the hacking issues have been properly addressed.My guess... That will never happen...

review: I've tried almost every survival type game known to man yet I always come back to Rust where I feel as though it's the only game that's done it right in every aspect. Yes the community can be toxic but also HILARIOUS! I've tried the game solo where I feared for my life every second i've stepped out of my shack. I've also played in a large group in a huge secure compound where we pretty much run the server and do what we please. Either way this game is always changing mostly for the better. Honestly what's better than literally starting out naked with a rock and torch scrounging for every resource possible. It's a survival game for a reason it's not meant to be easy. You are rewarded by how much effort you put into the game. Every player should want to kill every other player because you want those resources for yourself. Yes...it's a selfish mentality but again it's a SURVIVAL game. People who complain about being raided constantly need to suck it up or go play the Sims. Yes it can be frustrating but that's what makes the game so great...gameplan with your group and find out how to rise to power or learn from your mistakes and try a different tactic. And for the love of god always watch your back...because somebody somewhere is trying to kill you.

review: Even though it's not a noob friendly game and many people may be frustrated at the beginning if they are going on official servers Rust is one of the best survival games I have ever played. That being said I have read some negative comments and I understand their frustration but there is one thing to keep in mind... Rust is basically still in pre release even though it is "officially" released on steam. They have a long roadmap ahead for the next 2 years and I'm sure optimisations will come to this game sooner or later.Positives great graphics (wonderful water and overall look basically unity engine shines here) the gameplay is great if you don't go on the fullest/official servers great crafting progression monthly updates (before they were weekly) lots of mini games to keep you entertained (parkour tree chopping etc.) building a base is fun and it can also be a true test of your imagination (it's fun to build bases and then people can try to raid them but newbies probably don't get to experience this on official servers... even I don't sometimes) this game makes you a bit more careful with people since you can't trust anyone in this game (believe me I know) playing with your friends is mostly fun the only problem is when people are slacking off and they are not helping with the base mods are nice even though I didn't play a lot with them (played rust royale though hahah) skins are interesting since you can even craft boxes if you want with the materials from the skins you don't want (I think they drop once in a while for free)Negatives harsh environment for beginner especially on official servers building decay is a bit too much sometimes especially for a solo type of player (you can't build big bases since you will not be able to keep up with the upkeep) there should be a middle ground for people who don't like their characters (monthly character reset or something similar?) even though I like the idea of getting an unchangeable character depending on the steam ID but there seems to be an overwhelming amount of people who dislike it high PC requirements (I think that this game should be able to run well on Potato settings on almost any machine but there seems to be some struggle even for me with a 1060 random fps drops and stuff) load times are horrible for those with an HDDRust is a game you need to get used to. When bad stuff happen I now say "yep that's rust for you". The most frustration probably comes from the community but you know what? That's how it is in the real world also. There are many s and you need to learn how to deal with them. Sometimes with a good plan sometimes with smooth talk... and sometimes with a good bashing (not recommending this irl tho). Ultimately this is why I'm leaving a positive review. Most of the negatives don't bother me (I have decent PC and I got used to the community) anymore. If you manage to get past that stage I think that you will enjoy Rust to its fullest. ALSO Rust has huuuuuuuuge potential. Check out their roadmap... the electrical system should be one of the best features the game can offer when it's properly finished.

review: I consider myself pretty familiar with Rust in its current EA state. The vanilla system of survival is honestly so easy this shouldn't be considered anything more than a casual game that anyone can pick up and play. The building system is perfect gathering and crafting is actually engaging and interesting and the graphics (from it's legacy form factor) is somewhat breath taking. I had the pleasure... and in some instances DISpleasure of seeing this game transform and mold into one of my favorite games of all time. I've been here since Legacy Rust and it's been one crazy ride thusfar. Rust is like any cancerous and worthwhile relationship you might have It's love and hate good and bad mostly GIVE but you take a lot of good too. I highly recommend this game. 9/10.
