review: My experience with this game can be summed as thus every update I found myself testing the changes nodding in satisfaction then quitting the game to await the next update.Arkane knows how to make a good game. No question. But if you film an Oscar worthy movie and the lens is smudged while filming you can't judge what's underneath without acknowledging what's been marring your experience the entire time. PERFORMANCE Everyone is aware of the performance issues and these still persist to this day. It runs much better than at launch where it was literally unplayable but that's because the game looks worse than before the most noticeable change being the extremely aggressive LOD scaling. Out of the corner of your eye you notice the shapes of window frames and posters on distant buildings morphing in shape or the furniture at the opposite end of a long hallway suddenly blinking into existence. FPS dropped to 15 when stabbing a gravehound so they simply removed the inky visual effect that was causing the problem instead of optimizing it.Also Denuvo authentication is one of the longest "loading screens" of the game. Around half a minute to a full minute or more every startup. GAMEPLAY For the most part gameplay is excellent and is Dishonored's strongest suit. Dark Vision was changed to a blurry short range sonar so unlike Dishonored 1 you aren't constantly seeing blue and yellow because you had no reason not toAI is much smarterNonlethal combat options are a blastBonecharm crafting system allows for player flexibility and "builds"Each level feels lived in while maintaining the duality of directive flow and open options that made the first game so good.Emily and Corvo have distinct animations and final weapon upgrades. The animations are supremely cool.Each level is fairly distinct some with extremely interesting central "gimmicks." I do however wish the game relied less on them and had more "regular" areas.However under the hood lie other problems. Most of them are quality of life issues Gone are the hotkeys for journal inventory bonecharms powers. Only one "journal" exists now despite still having separate subsections.It took months for the power wheel to be fixed. It took almost a full second after activating to pop up and be usable breaking flow so badly I almost never used it in the first place. It's finally fixed now but this issue was glaring and it took so long to be addressed most of us played through without it fixed.Thrown objects don't always go exactly where your crosshair is. While this adds a layer of difficulty it feels noticeably more clunky than in the first game.Mana regen is pitifully slow. From using a power to fully regenerating Dishonored 1's time is 4.7 seconds &gt 3.1 seconds with Spiritual Pool. Dishonored 2's time with 4x Spiritual Pool is 6.3s &gt 5.5s. The devs said they fixed this effect but it was only made worse.Bugs. Street speakers not playing. Dying after possessing gravehounds. An arc pylon never shutting down after pulling out its power leaving it to either be dangerous to you to dangerous to your nonlethal playthrough. Some of these still aren't fixed. STORY AND ATMOSPHERE Reactivity Great. My favorite part of Dishonored. You need to hide from a gang member to access a certain black market shop and there are different scenarios and dialogue for if you hide if you run into him outside kill him outside or kill him inside.Emily and Corvo Emily and Corvo are voiced. And... they don't talk enough. It's good that they're silent for most of the game but there are times when you come across a portrait or photograph with an "Inspect" prompt. I'd love to hear Emily's thoughts on the High Overseer as see how that compares to Corvo's or if it changes based on whether or not you accept the Outsider's Mark. Instead all I get is the protagonist muttering the name of the person pictured. What's the point? Might as well keep them silent.It made sense to me to play Emily first but her story felt lackluster like people at every turn were saying "check your royal privilege" despite my efforts to resolve everyone's problems without drawing blood. Corvo's is MUCH more interesting as a veteran of Dishonored 1.The Outsider and The Void I hate the new Outsider and his new voice. He felt threatening and malicious in the first game due to how calm and composed he was and the Void felt like a strange and otherworldly place. The vignettes of Dunwall made it feel both unnatural and unnerving yet fundamentally woven into the universe. In Dishonored 2 it's just smoky blackness and sharp rocks. The Outsider is much jollier and moves around erratically making grandiose hand gestures. They actually had a plot plot that could explain this change but it was never addressed so it just seems like a pointless retcon to me.Main Plot Dishonored's worldbuilding was always one of its appeals and that remains true in Dishonored 2. However the villains felt lackluster. Only the main villain has a real presence throughout the game whereas everyone else feels introduced abruptly only to fall by your hand all within the same mission. In Dishonored 1 everything felt personal and real. Perhaps it was because of the long intro where you interacted with most of them or the Hound Pits's cast of characters all having different connections to your targets. As you can see I've played this game a LOT and have put a lot of thought into it. It was definitely worth all those hours and all that money but the condition it was at launch and the sluggish drip feed of support we barely get now is unacceptable. To set a precedent for future games I can't recommend buying this unless they manage to fix all the performance issues and bugs which doesn't seem to be happening anytime soon.

review: ( !!Tl dr warning!! )Firstly to anyone reading this post THANK YOU! Now on to what I'm about to say. SOLO IS DYING!!! No not the game in general that aspect is actually doing VERY well lately. What I'm talking about is players that have no friends no 'clan' to back them up going out straight from the beaches where they spawn and building up thier base. That whole chunk of the base of palyers is dwindling. It is increibly hard to be able to go alone in this game without having all of your hardwork torn down again and again AND again...and I know some of you can relate to this heavily. To be able to defend this way of playing the game we (the groups of people who go solo) need to raise of voices up and be heard saying 'Hey we're getting SCREWED out here can someone get things changed around here?!' I'm not saying mess over the whole game just aspects that kill off solo players so easily. *cough* Xp system *cough* grinding *cough* So basically what I'm saying is for gods sake don't kill off us little guys!! Please Facepunch!! But don't screw over the rest of the cummunity as well!! We need a balance to where we can defend ourselves in this torturous game without having to slave for what seems like endless hours only for a metal shack!! But seriously though I will NEVER call out this game as a terrible product unless it ever (sadly) becomes that. Thanks for reading this guys!!

review: Why No ?*please keep that on mind that this review is just my point of view at this game.* It changed a lot.Original idea that was rust how it was created how it works changed a lot as legacy player i seen all versions of this game and as far as i can say i enjoyed Legacy version most and somehow i played Rust until XP system comes. Lot's of things that where promised to old community and they where never been delivered to us.I don't know who was it if it was Garry or another developers or whoever was responsible for this game at the times when game changed from Legacy to newer version. But it was promised to us as for the old community what we recieve few changes. First was original legacy map that should be named as "Hapisis island" that was complete bull***t ? Why ? Simply this map was expecting by whole old community when it was delivered in patch it was something diffrent completley diffrent and unrecognizable from legacy map. It was not even explanined they did never say why did this happen and current appology is that it is hard to make 1 1 Old legacy map. For me this was one of the nails to coffin. We can talk about things like debuff's that was promised but never actually happend. Lot of players just leave the game because simply they never truly told us what is happening with game and why actuall promises in devlogs where never delivered to community. They considered to give us a level editor at launch of course it end up as promise that never happen... Current system. Dear lord i will recieve a hate for this but this is actual problem for me i was learned in this game to grind week a whole week of grinding hard working on blueprints fighting and now ?...Whole randomness that was given to us with blueprint system is gone. You start with 0 blueprint's that's ok so then you grabbing from barrels then you running like a madman trying to find a hazmat. Do lot of runs but where is randomness ? Bascily when you need something you know where you find it... want level 3 weapons go launchside want weapons grind barrells. This is why this game comes down from Week gameplay to a 3 day's gameplay. Peoples jus't now they raid like crazy it's not even hard right now... and at third day server is almost dead. Blueprint was more random and i feel it was made for this game ? Why... imagine situation like now. You have everything for raid and some simple gun before component/bp it was risk to go raid. Why ? You never know what that guy that you are going to raid will have. Sometime's he played pistols and guess what you come raid him he pulls AK47 stright away destroy's you whole raid just failed because you did not observe your target and never actually get's any information about him now its more like pingpong he comes outside and you can tell if raid will be or not sucessfull. It's boring and repetitive.Cluster f... to your mind.Why stable map was better but stable system is problem. This was the case of actual fun in this game with old map you just know you really know what to expect where big clans are going to build where players will be PVPing("But hey PVT that's why POI's are there" i know i know but before there where places where you fight even without POIS a great example of big PVP non POI place where Resource Valley and if u know that place well you could survive.) Or where you can go to hide or raid some solo/duo players. Everything on old map had a palce and with randomness of blueprints it was like symphony. PVP systemThis is my personal hate and why i hate so much PVP system at current rust build.Legacy again ?Yes legacy again and this was most or top or whatever you want reason why peoples like this game. Old legacy PVP system was just like Counter Strike. No bulletdrop some simple patterns and here you go perfect PVP game with some survival aspect. Current system of shooting looks like you take some very old old pistol add 30mag to it and make it shoot it just all over the place and it's disgusting it takes tons of times to learn it when you come from other games. Just meh in general. Upkeep systemFor me it's like hey you you dont have time for game ? Well say goodbye to your base... etc...Like nerfing in past false hopes for changes and etc... i would not even write about it because this will be review on 30 papers.Now let's see a better things that happen to this game(LOL).+Graphics+Building system+Good for peopels who never play this game before.+Some tutorial that is not helping.Conclusion For peoples who support this game at start and buy it and still hold up to this days good job but for me....It's just diffrent game its so diffrent that it have litteraly almost 20% from old and actual RUST that i used to know and enjoy. This game is almost dead to me one solution for me and maybe for players like me would be something like give us back old map stop promising t's and keep being sorry or full of excuses that it's not possible. Give us choose to create servers with old BP system and keep also current one for new players. For new players it might be a good game that they will like but as i said you have litteraly no guarantee that current system will not change even if they released this game.

review: Would I recommend rust? As you can see I have hundreds of hours in the game. It cost me 10 dollars. For 10 dollars I would recommend almost any game. Rust is a special kind of awful. The player community is toxic. The gameplay is repetitive. The crafting element changes so often you're never sure of how you make anything. If you enjoy being ganked by mouthy ten year olds I definitely would recommend rust. If you enjoy having all your hard work destroyed again and again and again I would recommend rust. If you like playing with people that would kill you for a piece of wood that would be easier to get themselves than it would have been killing you I would recommend rust. After 300+ hours in the game I can tell you if not anything else it's a great way to kill time.If you want a real challenge I would recommend you play rust as a pacifist. After my first 10 hours in the game I decided to play it without making any of the weapons. I decided to help anyone who asked even the 55hats who did nothing but kill you repeatedly. I made the game enjoyable for me by doing my best to be the anti rust player. That's what made rust an interesting experience for me. Rust is like The Lord of the Flies for a modern age who have no idea what The Lord of the Flies is. I don't know if I'm qualified to reccomend rust to you but I can say if not anything else it's interesting. Rust may make you a worse person than you already are. Rust may tear you down to it's level. So good luck out there and remember the game is as good as you make it.

review: You know when you play a game and find youself thinking "You know what'd make this even more enjoyable dying all the time and playing with people who are s." In Rust you can starve in half a day *long* before you die of dehydration.You can stand in a river. You *will* get wet and even get hypothermia if you stay in it too long but you *can't* drink from it. Why? Why have a survival mechanic for hydration when you're so frikkin hipster that the only water you can drink is bottled that you *might* find in containers?The mushrooms are apparently edible and give you a small boost to hunger hydration and health. The mushrooms are modelled on the fly agaric. You know the red one with white spots that's poisonous as . Are they *trying* to kill off idiots who'd eat one in real life *because they saw it in Rust*? If so I'd leave a kinder review the world needs less idiots. I suspect however it's because the colours stand out better on the background making it marginally easier to spot and tbh why bother thinking anymore about modelling an edible mushroom on one that's deadly irl...Meanwhile if you eat meat raw it will *actually harm you*. Yes there is a risk of food poisoning if the animal was ill and if it's not fresh but think how many people there are who like *rare* steak or sushi who miraculously survive everytime they eat it. What a ing dumb as mechanic.You can gather rusty metal plates and maybe even some wood but then find a bear *somehow* *without making any noise* is actually standing behind you and *oh dear* it hit you once and you're dead and you lost your scraps of crafting crap respawn in a random place and start again.You can always ask other players on the server for tips or even help but *oh dear* they're s and won't even try and help a newbie and are significantly more likely to kill you.In 2.2 hours of playing time I was killed something like 12 times once by a player who appeared behind me again without making a noise and *oh dear* one hit dead and the other *eleven times* by bears. Seperate bears. One I saw glitching next to a stream so I crouched down and walked away silently. The second I turned away it unglitched *bam* dead.On my last attempt of playing this game and bear in mind about 1/4 of the playing time was loading screens I happened to respawn near where to the two or three long time s of the server happened to be gathering crafting crap and ignoring/killing anyone else. I crouched and walked quietly up to the crates they were using took every single thing I could fit in my inventory out of them ran behind a rock and logged out. 'em.So in summary you get to run around naked until a bear or an kills you. Literally the most pointless piece of game I've ever bought I will be getting a refund for this.EDIT I *did* get a refund for this.

review: After a couple of days with this I can write something about this game. This game has way more potential than it gives. I recommend it but only if it gets better. The new guys will have a hard time as I am. I've been playing this for a couple of days now and I have yet to get anywhere with it. There is one HUGE drawback which other MMO's have and that is to draw (higher level) players away from n00b areas of the game. Though this game has no levels it has bigger guns and fending off 2 people that have guns with a rock will not cut it. I could crush a skull in real life with the size of rock that you are given yet it takes hit after hit after hit to kill someone in this. If you are attacked by someone with an axe you bleed out and the only way to get away is to run away then patch yourself up before you do (if you're lucky enough to not have the person still chasing you). Food is hard to get with a rock too and you need to find resources where people hog so that you can build better weapons armour buildings etc. There are camps you can join and this will be the ONLY way you will get anywhere in this game. I was hoping to scope out the game by myself for a little before going into an occupied area but you can't. It's literally impossible to play this without making friends first unless the entire server is full of friendly's. Most people aren't unless you're part of their group. Another huge drawback is when you die you lose everything and there is no failsafe for this unless you have a storage unit that's well hidden or locked up which you need when you're first starting out. If you die you start out as a noob again (rock med kit and torch) unless you're lucky enough to find your drops if they hadn't taken it which is also unlikely. I had a ton of wood needed to build stuff then died of hunger. I ran around looking for food but there was literally nothing in a forest near a wide open field. I haven't asked anyone in game how to do anything yet but I may next time I login if I can't figure things out. To give you an idea you beat your n00b rock against a tree and it gives you wood. The tree does not fall down but rather displays a message telling you there is no more wood available (disappointing I know since we ALL should have hardware that can handle this kind of stuff). You would then use the wood to build stuff like wooden barracades or wooden shelters and the like. Instead of putting these items where you are building them they go into your inventory (how the hell do you carry a shelter around?). I haven't figured out how to take the items out of the inventory to place them on the land yet though. Drag and drop just puts a bag in front of you with items in it (seriously a shelter in a bag?). You can pick these up again easy enough. I haven't been able to do much else because I get killed so quickly and gathering wood doesn't exactly help you build a better weapon right away. For a new weapon you need to do the impossible and find rocks which people seem to be guarding the resources for because of where the resources are located (and very few of them). The map needs to be a LOT bigger (or at the very least different bigger maps) with more resources and better resources to lure players with better equipment away from the noobs. As I mentioned before the trees not falling was a big disappointment for me. I would have rather cut down a tree then harvest it for wood. The graphics are sub par at best. Trees rocks shadows and characters (including the animals) all have low res textures. The only thing good about the graphics is the amount of grass and it makes the fields look grassy instead of fake. Add the trees and it looks better but only from a distance. When you kill animals in the game you get chicken no matter which animal you kill. Would like to see variances in the food and amount of hunger satisfied by the food (since a steak is bigger than a chicken leg pork chop etc. and a pork chop is bigger than a chicken leg but not much). I understand that this game is still in alpha stage and can still change drastically but all in all this game has HUGE potential and I hope that it will change for the better. It needs to so anyone new will not be so frustrated like I was (am).

review: I got this game a few days ago and I gotta say this is fun as hell but there's way to much KoS'ing. Be prepared to die. A lot.First server I joined was chalked full of KoS'ers around the good resource places so within 3 minutes of playing I gave up on collecting rocks n stuff and tried my luck at raiding a house I found with a wooden door. 10 minutes later I had full kevlar and an m4 after I accidentally accused one of the few friendlies on the server of KoS'ing me. Thinking the game was too easy I went around raiding for about another 2 or 3 hours before being worshiped by the moderately well geared players as "the luckiest n00b ever". My luck was about to run out. I built a nice base in the mountains and had tons of gear and got contacted by a n00b helping "friendly" and his buddy who invited me on a night raid. Needless to say they took everything I had and killed my buddies. I quickly switched servers.The second server I joined had more friendlies but they mainly stuck to themselves. I teamed up with another n00b for a while and collected wood to make a base but got KoS'd while going to the place I had built up shelter before. I decided to switch servers again. I hopped around on more servers for a couple of hours before settling down on the server I'm currently playing on. Me and my buddies built ourselves a small base in the mountain in the middle of the map and logged off for the night. When we came back online we found our base heavily raided so we decided to move. After finding a nice place to set up shop we built up a base and collected a ton of resources for further building. A few hours later an airdrop lands right next to our base and the one major group of KoS'ers finds me and my base. They kill me a lot. But I kept coming back and eventually they actually gave me an m4 mp5 2 pistols and a research kit. Somehow I had accidentally made an ally of the strongest and most feared group on the server. They've stopped KoS'ing me and now I'm aiming to build a metal base way in the north away from everyone. I only have a little over 36 hours logged in the game. This n00b has got some skill. Can't wait to see what else gets added in game.

review: I have lot of mixed feelings when it comes to this game. I played it back in 2015 where I played the game hours on end and found it extremely addictive. However through the multiple changes of the game and the development path it has taken down until now I find it difficult for this game to have me captivated for even five minutes. Honestly I've just gotten tired of this game now. The xp system was alright and the components system was kind of just meh. But the current crafting table system is just not my style anymore you can't be really creative with building anymore because of daily upkeep costs that were implemented and the recoil changes make gunplay less unique. Overall I can't play this game and have fun anymore. Sure go ahead and take it for a spin. But I'm done.

review: So after quite a while im changing my review for Rust.Rust is an amazing survival game with great graphics and atmosphere. Its a much more harsh experience compared to games like Ark because your number one enemy in Rust is not nature but all the humans you play with (though bears will mess you up).Sadly with the many latest updates for Rust basebuilding has gotten incredibly mediocre with focus on making automatic turrets and traps rather than fortifications in the shape of engenious construction work. Forced server wipes upon forced server wipes has made it a pain just to play the game. With the added component based crafting it is now more of a scavenger hunt vs. other players than a harsh fight for food and water. simply put bad update after bad update has made me change my standing from "The best survival game i own" to "im going to uninstall it and never play it again".I can no longer recommend this game to anyone.

review: This game has left me dumbfounded. I played for three months and this was on of the best games I have ever experienced the first month was learning the game and getting a grasp of this new different world then the next month was just pure joy staying up all night and day playing rust just for it all to be wiped but i kept coming back for more and more. Then the third wipe i realized the game gets worse and worse each update its like garbage and i quit after my four months of play. review: Product received for free. Rust is a very fun game where you can connect with friends or just people you meet and try to survive against nature and other players wanting a little bit of your hard earned loot. If pvp isnt your thing there are hundreds of servers with little to no people on them. But if you like pvp then you can join some of the more populated servers where you have to look over you shoulder while you collect some rock or wood. There are also a fair few servers that offer a PUBG version of the game where you can fight against other players to increase you skill in combat or just have a good time.

review: The game is nice a simulator of life i'd say. Its simple and gives all attributes and aspects of a common social life. Many depends on you don't trust anyone or make strongest friendship ever.Now about some horrible disadvantages their anti cheat politics. There is no ban safe warranty for any player. You may get banned if you didn't cheat as well as you won't get banned even if you cheat for months. The game is also unsafe from script using dishonest players (no recoil script as example). Playing on modded servers (the ones that use legal plugins) you may discover that your key bindings are getting collapsed each time you launch the game. I got banned for creating a script for myself that was replacing corrupted cfg file into a working one each time i launch Rust. I went even further and got myself a new copy of a game. And quickly discovered that there are still some other players with aimbot and wallhack which were not banned unlike me. The most irritating thing is the EAC anti cheat. You can't appeal they don't provide any evidence or reports from other player on you. They just ban. Pretty dubious politics of behavior some people are being banned for 8 years already. Hey finnish rats from EAC if you follow zero tolerance style of business to the ones who cheat on your opinion you'd better look deeper into each case. Otherwise is just a rip off of people's wallet. There won't be any cheaters indeed since everyone will be banned.Summarizing the game is cool but think twice before purchasing it.

review: Rust... Where do i start? I first played 4 years ago with kevelar armor and all that But some went down with the old account and i got banned for "hacking" its been 4 years and i tried again. Now rust is a hard game to review because of wipes. One wipe your walking around fully geared next wipe you have a 2x1 the whole wipe struggling to roam with bows. now I didnt know how to rate this. yes or no? I say yes because in rust you have VERY i mean VERY thrilling and fun moments. Like raiding a jackpot base. But then you have EXTREMELY boring moments like when you hike up dome get nothing then die because you failed a jump. Now for people reading this who never played. It is a intresting game. Not only is the game hard but the community is stupidThe community Toxic af but still can have fun and interact. will play downstairs in the basement for 48 hours on wipe day. The community is why i struggle to say yes to the game. Take out the community and its an awesome game. Dont get me wrong the community is funny af. people jump off towers screaming REEEE.Specs I have a gtx 960 and run around 50 60 fps. I honestly dont care if i have 40 or 80 frames per second as long as i have more then 30 fps im fine with it. I dont notice frame drops too much in rust. Unless its a war zone or a raid on High Pop servers.I honestly struggle to give this game a rating but i say 7/10 because of how fun it can be. I say try this game if you dont know about it ask a friend if you can try it there. Rust is annoying. Makes you salty even if you are never salty. Overall i give it 7/10

review: This game is one I had a LOT of fun playing...during the "old" Rust days. Frustrated with the ridiculous zombie AI mechanics of DayZ I found my proverbial survivor home with Rust. I originally stopped playing Rust almost a year ago because of the increase in hackers.I recently came back and was blown away with the new graphics and building system! I haven't had any issues with hacking (not to say it doesn't exist) but still have a problem with raiders. I am all for open world PvP but feel as though a properly upgraded base should provide players with a bit more security. In all honesty this is the ONLY complaint I have with the game. I would love to see the following implemented into the game Stronger base capabilities various trap systems would be incredible! BRING BACK SOME FORM OF ZOMBIES (please!) Fishing (as an additional food source) More clothing/equipment options (e.g. camo ghille suits etc.)I love the direction the devs are headed and will still continue to be a fan of Rust. &lt 3

review: Early access PUBG runs better than this game. That says a lot honestly. This game is still very unoptimized despite it being out of early access. Lowering the graphics options barely does anything to fix the framerate drop and I have decent specs that can run games on higher graphics settings fine. I literally get more FPS from PUBG on ultra than I do in this game on lower graphics settings.But you know what it's fun. There's lots of stuff to do lots of possibilities and I appreciate the challenge of survival it brings up especially in... m multiplayer.Don't enter multiplayer servers alone your will get ed believe me. But this is the same for any other multiplayer survival game.Rust has a bunch of depth to it much more than you'd ever expect and I appreciate that. There's so much you can do when building bases crafting etc. that the game has unlimited replayability. And even though the dangers of survival in this game are the same every time they're always unexpected.

review: This game is... interesting.When you are starting out much of the game is running around naked and beating people to death with rocks or stabbing them with pointy sticks. When they kill you however you have to be really good at begging for your life.If you manage to live long enough you can acquire some resources to help you build a base to keep you safe from those people out there. Only problem is now people target you because they know you have stuff and you are constantly worried about losing it all.Problem is you can't just sit in your base because if you sit in your base your base decays and eventually crumbles into nothingness thus forcing you to go outside and gather resources to keep your base maintained thus putting you at risk of death.Soon as you think you're doing well some jackass with a nailgun comes kills you and takes all your stuff and back to square one you go.Overall it's a 10/10 game. Amazing hardcore apocalypse survival akin to DayZ except without NPCs and less of a learning curve.

review: So why am I not recommending Rust? Many reasons. 1. Grindfest. Ever since the implementation of the scrap and component system the game has become a chore especially for small groups and solo players. I personally quit when I was devoting 60 hours a week to maintain a small base with basic gear.2. Lack of direction from game devs. As much as I like Helk and Garry they both don't know what the final vision of this game is going towards. It first started as a serious ish survival game then survival game with elements of counter strike and now its just a week long PUBG simulator with bases.3. Servers. The "Official" servers have been a garbage for a while. They are filled with cheaters massive clans and DDOSers. The community servers are extremely unreliabled. Crashing frequently abusive admins are getting constantly DDOSed and some even adapted the Pay 2 Win method of monitization. 4. Leaving Early Access. This game is plagued with numerous bugs exploits and optimization issues. It is in no state to be ready for full release. From what I could gather from the dev blogs it seems that they justified this by saying "Because we want to slow down development to work on other things". If the devs want to slow down development for Rust I'm cool with that but it just seems that they are trying to use the Full Release to poorly justify this. Plus see point 2. 5. Constant sales and the cheater problem. This game has been sold for extremely low prices in the past year. The lowest I've ever seen was about $2 in a humble bundle. This low price combined with the fact they use one of the worst anti cheats out there (easy anti cheat) has led to a quite high rise in cheaters. Even to the point where many people will not play if the game is on sale to avoid cheaters. Ending Note. I did once love this game and it was once a game I pointed at when people asked what was a good Early Access game but now it just feels like a shell of what it once was. I really did wish that Rust didn't become what it is now and still hope that it can become as great as it once was.

review: As much as I really want to like this game I cannot recommend this for anyone that is looking for fun or a semi relaxing game of survival and resource gathering. This review is not based on my experience with gameplay or the mechanics that the game has. The one reason that I can't recommend this game is mainly because of the people that play it. It doesn't matter if you are a passive player walking around gathering resources you will still die to by people with powerful weapons and strong armor. Yes I get that raiding is a big thing about this game but it's just not fun nor ok if you die every 5 minutes after respawn. It's not worth the money that I paid for it and I don't think I can ever find myself playing this ever. If you ever find this game at 50% or more on sales by all means pick it up with a couple of friends. Other than that I would rather play MineCraft than this game.

review: all right es sit down and buckle up for a bumpy ride were I talk ab Rust I started playing this game during the original Blueprint progression system btw.Rust is the most unforgiving hardest game to get into piece of but once you get in and figure what the flying is going on it's all worth it.By the way if you play this game solo you're either a) a very good veteran player and / or streamerb) autisticPlay this game with friends or you're gonna have a bad time and don't expect to make friends with people in this game cause the community is more toxic than Chernobyl ever since around the experience progression system.This game has seen good and bad days but things are starting to fall into place. Combat system feels fluid for the most part guns are where they should be. Guns that cost high amounts of resources have a definite advantage on lower tier guns but also take a slight more amount of skill to use i.e. high damage but very high recoil.The current progression system is also exactly where it should be despite the fact that I (personally) despise it. Personally it feels like a crawl trying to find the item then the scrap to research it only to then go back out and farm resources to make it and that fact that if you get the item or not from a crate is totally random doesn't help much either. I feel like it heavily harms veteran players who like to occasionally drop in for maybe a week use their skills that they've aquired over the time they've played to make some insane plays on other players then be rewarded for their skill by getting more stuff in less time to me it should be like that if you're good at a game it should show however with the new progression system it forces those veteran players with 1000's of hours to go back to exactly what they hate to do farm . The reason they gave a to get good at the game was so that they could outskill other playewrs through PvP and thus completely disregard a need for farming however the current progression system hinders that process a ton.What this means is the system is good for new players as they are more willing to stick around for the farming process and there will be less guys who can 1v6 your zerg clan who bought the game on sale 5 days ago.To conclude these two points Rust was a mess and is still a big mess animal AI is bewilderingly there are lots of bugs and dumb that will you off but this game is a mess you will come to love. It's definitely not gonna fix it's hot mess of a self any time soon but it' still worth the hassle. And with the current look of the devs's update roadmap this game has my hopes high for turning into something truly spectacular when it's done.Although tbh for where the game is at right now it's definitely not worth $40 I can't stress it enough wait for a sale.And a lil' personal game play story for those of you who stuck through this review to the end &gt be me&gt be 17&gt still loving rust&gt veteran player setup giat zerg base with other 5 guys who easily all have over 1000 hours&gt arab guy in group "guys lets build a mosque"Holy muddafuq shett good idea&gt build giant 10 x 10 mosque&gt thing would make allah cry&gt neighbors frequently see us go in out&gt think its our base since they don't know ab underground true base&gt they begin to online raid mosquetheres not even a single gun in there&gt they waste 10+ rockets&gt our guy runs up waterpipes guy and get ak + rocket launcher&gt we gun down rest of them in name of allah&gt week later begin to raid them&gt screaming "YOU WILL ALL DIE IN THE NAME OF ALLAH"&gt guys blasting ISIS music over mic&gt mow down every single one as they try to defend their base from the storm of rockets we fire at themNo one s with my rust mosque

review: I've played Rust for close to a year now and in the past year it has been my most played game and quickly climbed that ladder up to my favorites. I absolutely LOVE the rustic decaying artstyle. The gameplay however is definelete not for everyone. Unless you have a group to play with Rust will be a difficult game especially when starting. You have to have hours of time to spend on this game maintaining upgrading (primarily) researching etc. But when you get raided it feels like the world just collapsed ontop of you. Me being a solo player quickly learned that my prioreties seem to fall into running as far away from spawn as possible and then trying to make a base. I will admit I have gotten really mad and ragequit countless times. The game can be extremely frustrating but somehow just keeps drawing me back in. I only paid $10 for the game and I don't think i would have paid $35 for it but it has definaletely been an adventure. I would recommend this game if you have a bit of time to waste each day and you enjoy a good challenge but Rust is not for the casual player ESPECIALLY if you plan to go solo.
title: Rust

review: I'd like to recommend this game because I had some fun times back in the day but unfortunately I can't. I'm a solo/duo player mostly because of my casual gaming lifestyle. I don't like to join big groups where it ends up being a job because you have to be on at certain times or you have to do tasks put forth by the so called leader of the group. The most frustrating part of this game which has been mentioned I've seen many times is the offline raiding aspect of the game. Getting raided and having intense gun fights is part of the fun of the game. Someone shows up you fight for your life to protect your stuff that's what makes it fun. If I lose all my stuff because I failed at defending my base I can deal with that. But when I spend a whole day farming collecting and building only to wake up the next day log on and see that everything I did the day before is gone with no hope of stopping it practically every single day that's too frustrating. If that's something you think you can deal with then you could have a lot of fun on this game. Personally if that aspect was different I might give this game another try. Maybe they could do something like 7 days to die has. When nobody is online with permissions on a tool cupboard the stuff in range of the cupboard is fortified or something. Maybe that would deter people from doing so much offline raiding. I'm sure people would try to exploit it and just have one person have permissions to build then never be on but I'm sure you could find a way to counteract that as well. I guess just my opinion but personally I don't like losing everything I've worked for without a hope of stopping it on a daily basis.

review: This is probably my favorite post apocalypse survival game to date And there are so many to choose from on steam I have played a good amount of them and Rust always sticks with me it has an addictive feel to the game. On most servers you will find yourself nervously attempting to make yourself civilised enough in terms of tools and weaponry to stay alive long enough to build a base and make it strong enough to withstand a raid. Other servers are purely for building and community pleasure and you meet a lot of great people in game eager to help you which cannot be said about the PvP servers even if someone is friendly on a PvP server you have a strong instict not to trust them and leave you for dead once they have robbed you blind. Here are a decent list of reasons why i choose Rust over so many survival titles *Dev team are solid on bringing new cool stuff with every update whist working on bugs from previous builds. * You actually feel threatened even in the safety of your base (Door campers zergs etc) keeping you on guard.* The look feel and atmosphere of Rust all way down the the maps and sound fx keeps you hooked* The many many options you have while building* Being able to customize your character to great lengths* The combat feels really intense and realistic.All in all over all other titles i would choose Rust I heavily recommend you to do the same.
title: Rust

Sure if your a lazy no life who plays video games all day then go right ing ahead this game is for you! review: 2016 review Got killed by a guy after we shot him 1 time with a shotgun and 3 times with a gun. He shot 2 times with a crossbow and we got killed. Also rocks are the stupidest thing to find the game is when it comes to rocks. Also animals clip through everything so you can't catch or run away from anything. Also bears walk on water. UPDATE Other than a horrible cheating issue where you can instant heal and make walls instantly to the best material you have on you. They mostly fixed the above issues. (I did shoot a person 3 times with a modded out Spas 12 with slugshots in the face from 5 feet away in the span of about 3.5 seconds. And he ended up spamming me in the face with a pistol and i died *note* i was wearing brand new metal face mask and metal armor and he had nothing on. Admin did not call any cheats from his "logs" but i can't see how anything else would be possible with the sounds of me hitting him.) So yea cheating is still an issue but they fixed alot of bugs improved gameplay graphics and animal AI. That is no more bears walking on water deers clipping through rocks etc. The fact that they kept adding stuff and fixing issues must be held to praise with these devs adding boats and all the things you would expect that come with boats. I can now sucessfully conclude this review from a would not recommend to a would recommend. Good price fun with friends and devs work harder than PUBG devs so yea overall great job.

review: after a long while of play around 90 hours i can tell this game is one of the best games that u could ever buy however it has few problems within it.1.ITS ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE TO PLAY SOLO no matter how good you are you either will die on road when building when farming or whenever you go offline the night your base will be raided by clans.2.REALLY BAD OPTIMIZATIONS lot of times when i click to join severs it crashes the whole game and i have to restart the steam all over again3.GRINIDNG FOR SCRAP as a new player you will think only problem in your life is to just get stones metals and wood but when you get enough experience you will realise that you need one more thing and that is scrap which you will get very little each run through out the map but you need insane amount when back in home and if you dont have scrap you will basically fight sniper rifles players with your hand made bow which brings two problems together one well again you need others to help each other grinding scrap and its frustrating doing it solo and.two its repetitive and time consuming which you litteraly have to go to the same roads hit barrels with what ever weapon you have and collect scraps.3RD problem i think is the worst part of this game especially if you dont have anyone to play with imagine your base is on very south of the map and if you choose one road and go all the way up and hit barrels and collect scraps and not die to duos and sniper clans which build theire basis right on top of those roads you will come back with around 100 150 scrap to home and it will take around 20 up to an hour depending on your tool which you brake barrels or how many you do on each area and each side in real life day you will find around 500 scrap each day if you play all day because thats not the only need of the game coz in the mean time you need ton of other things to do and you will be stuck at maximum crossbow while others use ak47s 4. AI human AI in this game is pain in the which together with 3rd problem will prevent solo players from geting end game guns even more.there are caves and places which you can go and find guns so you can bring those home and learn how to craft same guns by again using scraps which well first of all good luck getting in those places and getting out while clans farm those places every second and second even if you go there good luck killing AI with your cross bow which gaurd the place why?ok let me tell you why.Ak kills player with around 2 to 5 shots on average.same ak kills an AI around 4 to 8 shots on average.bow kills a player on average 4 to 10 (they are not idiot they heal as you shoot each time) same bow kills AI... oh wait it doesnt unless you shoot them 100 time and consedring there is 10 to 20 AI covering each place well good luck again geting your hand on that gun again.so long story short either play on servers that are almost empety like less than 5 players or have at least one good friend that plays everytime you play the game or have your patience level maxed out in real life otherwise you will brake ten keyboard and monitors each day other than that you are fool if you dont buy this game coz you will miss a lot.

review: Is Rust a good game? Yes it is. Does it have its flaws? Oh yeah.First things first the world is beautiful and huge the graphics really are top notch. The crafting and building is insanely easy and fun. Its also very rewarding to get resources and work up to being the best. But the good things kind of stop there. The character modles are so rubbery and move in choppy manners the only way to get over it is to laugh it off. There are almost no animals in the map so it feels very fake and baren. I know most people complain about the community and how everyone is a and will kill you on sight but though this is a true statement for the most part Ive also met some very nice people who have spared my life and even helped me. And it is a survival game so you shouldnt explect anyone to be your bestie. It really is survival of the fittest or survival of the one who plays most. If you put time and effort into the game you will be rewarded. I recommend this game (but on a side note if you are debating buying this or ARK buy ARK. Better animals and stuff). Just watch your back look out for bears be slow to trust people and youll do just fine.

review: A dielectric (or dielectric material) is an electrical insulator that can be polarized by an applied electric field. When a dielectric is placed in an electric field electric charges do not flow through the material as they do in an electrical conductor but only slightly shift from their average equilibrium positions causing dielectric polarization. Because of dielectric polarization positive charges are displaced in the direction of the field and negative charges shift in the opposite direction. This creates an internal electric field that reduces the overall field within the dielectric itself. 1 If a dielectric is composed of weakly bonded molecules those molecules not only become polarized but also reorient so that their symmetry axes align to the field.

review: Rust is a beautiful life simulator.Packed up with stunning graphics the day and night cycle will aid you enjoy the most wholesome afternoon watching the sun go down from your wooden cabin in the woods.As the sun reaches the trunks of the trees and the orange sky deepens your appreciation for wildlife Rust secretly plans new teachings of life just for you.A few minutes back one kilometer away Mememaster Chad wakes from his slumber and proceeds to roam around scanning the terrain. As he runs through the grass fields Chad shows no respect towards wildlife nor silence. The madman probably deactivated push to talk and is currently singing All Stars with a mic volume buffer. Chad stops (his feet not his singing). A target has been acquired another naked player is chopping wood nearby. In a situation like this you would turn away and continue with your solo adventure but Chad is all about action and all about winning an imaginary trophy.Chad comes closer and the player immediately tries to keep distance with a bow and arrow Chad keeps walking towards him with a rock in his hands bouncing around thinking he'll dodge the arrow. The player is ready to nail this noisy man but notices something changed in Chad's lyrics. He's no longer singing the All Stars lyrics but he's actually asking the player to join as a team whilst keeping the song's melody. The player accidentally shoots Chad apologises and accepts Chad's request. The duo then traverses the planes singing All Stars repeating the same procedure when encountering a new player.When Chad's team reaches 4 to 5 members Chad's singing finally ceases. The group of naked men understands this signal announcing it's time to get serious. "Where do we start building our base" asks Timmy #2. "Pff you don't start bases in this game. Follow me." Chad replies. His eyes turning the reflection of the orange sky into fire when he spots a beautiful cabin down in the woods.The end.

review: As a casual Rust player the game did not peak my interest. Rust feels like a standard survival game. You can gather materials to create things build a base and create items for you to use. I will admit the base building aspect of the game is impressive. You can build to your own imagination. The thing I do not like about it is the community is pretty toxic and your base can easily get raided and destroyed. It is hard to get started in this game because the already developed players can wipe you clean with no trouble. I suppose it adds to the difficulty aspect of the game but I was not a fan of it. There are many places to explore. I like all the structures you can investigate and loot. Rust may be for some people who enjoy hardcore survival games but my experience with it was unsatisfactory.

review: Okay so i realize i havent made a review on either of the accounts I have this game on so im gonna make it on this one.My main account has about 300 hours on rust and this one 850hours at the time i write this comment.Sooo lets start out with the bad1) The game is absolute dog if you are by yourself (vanilla) modded servers make this better but at the end of the day you will probably get ganged up on by 4 people when ur farming on vanilla and get offlined. If you're new to the game i'll give you some advice to start off with. Go to /r/playrust LFG or whatever its called and find a noob friendly group that you can play with so you can learn more about the game while also having your own little team going.2) Repetitive game It its old much like every other game out there when you play it for a while considering how i have so many hours on the game it got rather old and stale over time. I have recently begun to play it again pretty often due to the amount of content that the devs have added to the game.3) Lag This game just like a lot of others gets lag at times for what seems to be no reason this could be you rubber banding back when your internet is completely fine or your frames becoming absolute dog out of nowhere. Since my computer doesnt have the best parts out there i will just assume its because i have out of date tech on my pc.4) "Survival" This game i really dont consider to be a survival game like a lot of people say... its more like a loot hoarding pvp game which is fine but really i just dont see it as survival. This is just a personal thing i guess5) "Toxic community" As number 4 states this game is pretty much a pvp loot hoarding game which means if you are a new player to a server and you just wanna make a base RP or whatever the hell you do you're in for a bad time. You will be pretty much KILLED ON SIGHT by literally anyone that sees you unless you are on a server that has a rule against KOS. Now even I can agree that the community of this game is toxic. Filled with hacking korean zergs dumb 10 year olds and just plain out s.. I believe they tried to counter KOS by adding a sash on your back if you have had a weapon or tool in your inventory but it seems that didnt do much of anything considering how people still KOS when you have no sash or loot on your body. People kill you just to be flat out I generally dont kill nakeds unless they are near a fight and may snag some loot or they are just me off. But some people do it as a big "lol u naked". So yes i would say that its a toxic community (most players at least)6) H a c k e r s Just dont ing go on a facepunch server please.The Good1) Content constantly being added and changed Ever since i first bought this game I always thought that it was cool how the rust team was always working on stuff to be in the game. They try to add more things like new events like the boats new items and ways to get loot etc.2) Interactions When you arent KOS'd on rust and you talk to people its a pretty good experience and usually you will have a good time until some geared guys kill you. People in this game can usually give me a good laugh when i meet them on the beaches and but thats probably just because they have nothing.. once they get a spear they will shove it into ur head more than likely. If you want to have more conversation or just talk there are places like the safezones you can run to and sometimes have a decent time in if you find other people in them.3) Pvp When the pvp works correctly and doesnt lag its a very good experience. Every weapon you use can be something you can make a play with a sword a spear etc all of these weapons you can kill someone geared with and snowball if you wanted to try it out. 4) Modded servers If you are a casual player like some and dont like the constant grind and bs you have to deal with to get to top tier modded servers offer things for people like you. Rust offers 2x 3x 5x even 1000x servers that just give you a lot more than Vanilla servers do. There will be less grind but more pvp in these servers usually. Most experienced players i've talked to dont like modded including myself so if you're solo or duo and just wanna get some quick loot join a 2x or a 3x they will be more friendly if you're newer to the game.5) Feeling Rust gives me a feeling that most other games cant do and thats when they just make my adrenaline flow fast as hell. When you are close to the nice snowball that you've been dreaming for.. no meds all teammates dead and just one more mag and that adrenaline pumps i just love that it makes me hard as hellOverall Rust for me personally is a 8 out of 10 It isnt really perfect at all with the lag and but it is a good game at the end of the day. The work they put into this game over the years has turned out to be in my opinion a great game.

review: I woke up on a beach with nothing but a torch and a rock. It was night when i spawned so i thought the best thing to do would be to light up my torch and look for stuff that would be useful for my first time in Rust. I was wrong very wrong. Seconds after I lit my torch swarms of naked and half dressed people came running at me with rocks and spears screaming and playing mainstream memes and music from their mics. It was then when I wanted to know how to kill myself in rust (If you don t know it s F1 and then type kill). After that when I respawned at a different beach a man wearing trash and cloth was screaming really loud and making weird noises. I looked in front of him from a distance and saw a bear attacking him. Without hesitation I lunged towards the bear with my rock and bashed it s head. But the bear wasn t done yet. It fought back and knocked me to the ground. Just as I thought I was about to die. I heard gun shots and saw the bear fall to the ground. I was picked up by the man in cloth and trash. He thanked me and took me to his base where he fed and healed me. He asked if I was new to the game and I said yes. He said I could stay with him until the end of the wipe. I went to sleep that night feeling accomplished in Rust. I woke up the next day excited ready to play Rust.I loaded the game and joined the server greeted by a a screen saying I was dead and I was killed by a semi automatic rifle. I didn t play Rust for a while after that until I learnt more about the game and found out what happened to me in the base was called getting raided.Toxic community savage bears and wolves. Just a great game especially with friends. 10/10

review: This game has a very sharp learning curve and can be very frustrating. At 600 hours I'm still learning how to play! Facepunch is doing a great job adding content with monthly updates and the developers actually listen to the community with some of those additions. Rust can feel very repetitive but something about it draws me back in every time.It is especially fun to play with friends and definitely gives you an edge in PVP situations. It is still playable solo and there are servers that only allow groups of up to one two or three players on a team if you're having trouble on vanilla where it is very likely you will come up agrainst a group of five ten or possibly even more players. I play as a solo or in a duo most of the time and the moments where you come out on top are definitely worth the struggles in my opinion.I wouldn't really recommend the game if you can't dedicate a lot of time to it since you need to constantly harvest materials to maintain your base. And the larger your base the more materials you need to harvest. You can find yourself playing for hours get some gear get a base down then you log off to get some rest. You go to school or work or whatever else you do during the day then you log back on and you've lost everything. Right back at square one. It can be very frustrating but some people enjoy that.However there are modded servers that speed up or remove the not so fun grinding process of the game which can also be very fun to do. There are so many different servers with different levels of modifications that can improve the game for people who don't have much time to game.

review: Hundreds of hours in and I'm still enjoying Rust. I enjoy the continual updates this games has gotten over the years as the develpment team is always working to improve the game. Rust's crafting system is solid and the loot drops are pretty fair making it not too difficult to get your base up and running.Although I do reccomend this game that reccomendation does come with a few caveats. For me rust is a mainly co op game. The majority of players you'll meet will be hostile or toxic. They'll usually kill on sight making it difficult to go alone. For this reason I mainly will play with friends. Fortunately I have met many players that are willing to work together which helps make the game more enjoyable especially if you're playing on your own.With all that being said Rust is a fantastic survival game offering a solid PVP experience as well as interesting roleplaying opportunities.

review: Do I recommend this game?Yes!Rust is a unique open world survival FPS in which you must survive against many other players and NPCs.Imagine this...You wake up on a beach shore naked with just a rock and a torch and whatever you do next is up to you. You don't know who you are or why you're here but you have one goal SURVIVE AT ANY COST. You wander around collecting resources gaining valuable items and finally make a little base. You slowly upgrade your arsenal from spears and bows to more modern weapons such as revolvers and basic rifles.As you explore more and more you stumble upon other people some friendly and some not. Whether you befriend them or not is up to you...Now I'm gonna get all technical.This game has lots of pros It's open ended making gameplay and replayability basically endless. As of writing this I have spent over 200 hours in this game and I definitely haven't explored all possible outcomes of playing.The general community isn't the best but if you play with friends and make allies the game is much more enjoyable and less grindy.The weapon physics and movement system is pretty good in my opinion with gunfights being very skill based and rather realistic.The devs are very in touch with the community posting weekly community updates and constantly informing players of the future of the game. That alone to me is very important and I respect how much time and effort is put into each update.Now the cons The biggest con to me is how unrewarding the game is in the long run. Each month all progress from the past is wiped whether you want it to be or not.Now while this is useful for server/player balancing it's just an unfortunate event that happens.One other thing that deters me from playing is how grindy the game can be. Rust isn't a game where you stop by and play for an hour then be done because you can't get much done in such a short amount of time. If you are wanting to truly play Rust you are going to need lots of time to be able to play the game to it's full potential.Optimization is also a problem. You don't neccessarily need an extremely powerful pc to be able to play but Rust demands a lot of processor and graphics card power. Luckily optimization is constantly being improved to the point that I have gained over 30 fps since I started playing Rust less than a year ago.One last thing. If you've never watched any content over Rust I definitely suggest you take a bit of time to understand what you are about to get yourself into. The Rust experience is very hard and unforgiving and playing without any knowledge is extremely difficult. Expect to die...a lot.Conclusion If you like open world survival games this is right up your alley...Just make sure you have the time and patience to play!Wyl33 J's Rating 8/10

review: This is the point where the game starts to drop. The toxicity of the community can make newer players upset about the fact that whenever they try to kill a good player they just get called a terrible player and they're 'trash'. Again this can make bad players really demotivated and not want to play on servers with players who know what they're doing. You could be doing so well and then get double teamed by a bunch of people with SAR's and then they would trash talk you while you bleed out infront of them. This is pretty annoying but after awhile it becomes kind of a natural thing to happen. You don't want this to happen to you. There's rarely anymore kind players and everyone just wants to trash talk other people and try to look good at the game. For a person that only started to play a week or two ago I've began to understand that RUST is a game about skill and if you don't know how to control the AK47 spray there's not much for you in a modded server or vanilla. I learned fairly quickly about the AK spray and quite frankly I really enjoy the game in some parts. I wouldn't find anything being grindy (except for component farming which gives a chance of you to lose everything and then start over again). Other than that. This game is pretty fun but there's still cons for new players.

review: Although the community is pure toxicity and "cancer" I would say without a doubt that this is an amazing game. My favorite things about the game are Constant developer support for the game meaning new updates and new content quite often. Great to play with friends and with the new party feature it is easier to do so. Many items and features in the game. Huge amount of servers to choose from server support is well developed on Rust. PvP is plentiful it's almost impossible to become bored when there is always constant looting and killing and exploring to do. (not to mention raiding although it isn't really worth it.)I currently have a few complaints about the game mainly involving how the servers and community behave Toxicity is everywhere if you are faint of heart or one of those "special overprivileged snowflakes" then this isn't the game for you. Clans will dominate you clans are everywhere and if you don't submit they will take care of you easily. Zergs (massive groups of people who attack together) are common it's the same story as the clans but they are more violent and hostile. Game optimization is very poor even if you have a good pc you will have a hard time running this game at 60FPS at all times on the highest graphics or even medium graphics. Very high difficulty curve it's not easy to play the game and get good at it if you don't dedicate enough time. Although I haven't encountered too many cheaters due to my low play time I've noticed that people complain of hacking and cheating in the game a lot and it is true there are quite a few hackers and cheaters in the game.Most of my complaints are based upon the community and the servers themself not really against the game. If you feel like that there should be anything else added to my list then feel free to comment. Overall I highly recommend buying Rust despite the price being raised I think it is worth it. Especially compared to other games in the same category for higher prices.

review: First let's talk about what is good about Rust.Decent Progression The current progression system in Rust is based around obtaining both scrap and blueprints from looting and using scrap in order to create blueprints at a research table learning the blueprint and finally allowing you to craft the item at the correct level workbench. While the system does have it's problems (which I wil talk about in the cons section) overall I like the concept of having to take time to find and unlock better items. It adds a bit more of a sense of direction to the game that before it was added was missing.Okay now that's we've talked about what's good we can get to all the things that are bad.First and foremost... The community is toxic as all hell I'm not joking I don't think I have ever seen a more toxic community in a game in my entire life. Almost every person you encounter will try to kill you regardless of how gear you are and regardless of how geared they are. There are servers where extremely geared player will literally just sit at the spawn points and shoot you every time you respawn. Heck I've even been on servers where other nudies (fresh spawns) will sit and spawn camp the other nudies... for literally no reason there is nothing to gain from killing nudies. You'd be hard pressed to find a single official server that does not include almost all of the following Fly hackers Aim botters Griefers who raid your base and then lock you out of it... not take it for use just make sure you can never use it again Massive clans that take over the entire server and relentlessly hunt down any new players until they quit the game People who wait until you log off to raid your base because they're too cowardly to do it while you're online Tons of racial slurs Tons of koreans and russians who speak no English in the slightest (on US servers)A zerg clan that has full metal armor and AKs 5 hours after wipe while you're still trying to build a base.The community of rust is just on a never ending downward spiral of toxicity. The toxicity makes the casual players quit which only leaves the toxic player remaining so when you join a server it's almost guarunteed that every player on it is the most toxic person you've ever seen. People who take pride not in a fair fight or in having fun or even in the sense of accomplishment of beating an equally skilled opponent but in attacking people while they can't defend themselves killing griefing and raiding not because they need supplies or because you are a threat but simply because they know it pisses you off.The base upkeep system The current base upkeep system was added by facepunch in order to combat zergs and large clans. Does it actually do this... hell no. The current upkeep system does nothing more than hinder casual and solo players. The way the system currently works is that once a base is built a tool cupboard (TC) must be placed which covers an area and only allows those who are authorized in it to build any higher than twig level inside of the protected area). The TC then requires a certain amount of resources every day in order to keep your base from starting to decay. The type and amount of resources is based on what the base is made of and how big it is. The more people who are connected to the TC the higher the resource cost. If the base ever gets damaged after ten minutes of no damage the TC will use even more of the supplies stored in it to repair the damage. Once the TC runs out of supplies your base begins to decay. Once the decya begins you can expect your walls to be destoyed in 3 hours and your entire base to be destroyed in around 6 hours.Now that you know how it works allow me to explain all of the massive problems with it. First off the upkeep costs are so astronomically high that it's near impossible for solo or casual players to upkeep their bases. A simple 3x3 3 story base (which in rust is a rather small base) costs 40 000 stone per day to upkeep which is around 3 4 hours of mining just to be able to upkeep your base. This makes it near impossible for any casual or solo players to play as they will have to spend almost all of their time just preventing their base from falling apart. Also you know how I said that a 3x3x3 stone base costs 40k/day to upkeep? Well the TC only has 18 slots and there are onlt 1k stones per slot so that means a completely full TC can upkeep your base for a whopping... 11 hours... not even a full day. The way the current upkeep system works either you have a ridiculously small base that is easy pickings for any clan or you have a larger base that you have to essentially fill every couple of hours... people who have school or work amirite?Another problem with this system has to do with that whole "the TC repairs the base using the stored resources" part. This causes a massively overpowered exploit where a clan can essentailly come to your base and instead of having to seach for the rooms in your honeycombed base the contain the loot they simply have to damage the exterior walls wait for them to repair and repeat this process until they've bled your TC of all it's stored resources and then just wait 3 hours for all of the walls in your base to break and it's looting time. So in short the upkeep system does nothing but make it almost completely impossible to have a base unless you have a massive clan that has players online 24/7.The blueprint system Like I said above while I like the concept of the blueprint system there are massive problems with it's application in Rust... first off... everything is FAR to expensive. First off there are three ways to get scrap the first is by breaking barrels which typically gets you 1 2 scrap per barrel. The second is crates which get you around 5 scrap per crate. Finally the high level chest can typically get you anywhere from 20 50 scrap. Now just to make the research table and all 3 workbenches you need 1 875 scrap which is either roughly 1 250 barrels 375 crates or roughly 60 70 high level chests (which only spawn in the hardest areas of the game). This is just a downright absurd price for this stuff and that's just the stuff to research and build stuff with that's not counting the actual research costs. Want to be able to research a hoodie? That's 75 scrap. A pickaxe? That's another 75. An assault rifle? Pfft 750 scrap please. A chair whos only purpose is decoration... 20 scrap.The costs are downright absurd. A simple hoodie should not take an hour of farming to unlock when the servers wipe once a month.The servers wipe once a month Now I understand why this was a thing back in early access Facepunch needed to wipe servers in order to put out updates... but the game is in full release now server owners should be allowed to decide how long their servers will gow before a wipe. It's virtually impossible for any solo or casual player to make any significant progress before the servers get wiped every month.Cont. in comments

review: This game is simple. You start out wondering how you're going to overcome the world in front of you. It's not an overnight cycle as many would think. Start with the small things. Chop trees gather stone and build a base maybe. What's you're goal now? Pvp. Fight for mass amount of loot in populated zones to build your empire. Playing this game with friends only means you'll be better equiped to build your arsenal. This game isn't about surviving it's about thriving. With developers that care about what content is in their game on a daily basis new changes come monthly. This doesn't fully switch up the whole flow of the game but instead adds little hints of new things to explore experiment with and master. This isn't your typical survival game. There is always going to be a new experience around the corner. &lt 3 Facepunch

review: This game is the main reason I got into pc gaming. I've just recently put 100 hours into the game and it's still just as fun as when I first jumped into a server. I've been chased by naked men and women and been chased by full geared guys with Ak47s. If you've been looking for a game that you can play over and over this is it. If you're looking for a game to make friends on this is it. If you're looking for a game to make enemy's on this is it. If you like staring at a rock for 30 minutes everytime you die this is for you. 10/10 rust life&gt real lifeEdit Now I'm nearing almost 400 hours and I can still whole heartedly say this is my favorite game on steam. The Devs are ever changing our experience for the better and the game is being changed in general to give the players more things to do. All in all I think this is my favorite game I've played in a long time no matter what others say.

review: Rust is simply a fantastic game. Garry and his team are always updating content on a weekly basis and the gameplay mechanics continue to improve. Rust is a surivival style game and only playable with other players online. It's an awesome team or solo experience and you will sure make some enemies playing.Pros Vanilla servers are well optimized for low end PC's. Variety of procedurely generated terrain including snow grass mountains streams lakes and forests. Good early game and end game items and weapons. Great FPS mechanics. Regular updates based on community feedback. Base building is highly customizeable. Raiding is very fair for both parties requires skill and planning. Great hunting and crafting mechanics. Modded servers with gamemodes like The Hunger Games You can master crappy items and use them to kill unskilled geared players You can starve to death freeze to death be mauled fall to your death be quickscoped by a rock burn and really die any way possible. Everything is out to kill you! It's spooky at nighttime and you can sing campfire songs.Cons Abundance of cheaters on modded rust servers. Decay is rather fast so bases can disappear after a few days of inactivity. Dead bodies of animals and players glitch through the floor. Community is generally pretty savage.Overall Rating 9/10Worth the Price YesLike surival games? This is the best. This game is not very welcoming of new players but with a little practice it's quite fun. It's best played with friends but solo is always really fun too.

review: I recognize it is likely that this will result in strongly held opionions no matter what I say but now seems a good time to review rust. I have put enough hours in to feel that I have a fair view of the gameplay. Lets start out by saying you may be somewhat mortified that this game is fun to you. Why you ask? The short answer is that if you feel bad about killing naked people simply trying to chop a tree or pick a rock or waiting until someone has put in a bunch of hard work so that you can kill them and take their stuff you have choices. Dont Play. Become a Victim or the more popular option victimize you fellow humans while chortling that the tweleve year old you killed is raging about it and hoping you family dies in a fire. The thing that makes the game the most fun and the least fun is the player base. I have made great friends and some pretty distingushed enemies. I have also delt with what many consider to be one of the most toxic communities you can encounter. That being said I have still played this game and enjoyed almost every second of it. Game play is pretty simple and very intuitive. The tech tree is overly simple and provides a significant advantage to the players who log in and invest time after a server wipe. Due to this the servers with the highest population wipe weekly if not twice a week. As a whole servers that dont do this will see their player base drop off to almost nothing withing the first few days.
