review: Now i do not have the best pc on earth but can run GTA V ultra settings at 60fps but rust runs at low settings at 20fps. now i bought this game back before the major update on sale. when it was really not worth 40 however i was aware that facepunch studios would not leave it it such a state. so i believed that it was an investment. however starting this game on my mid range pc it ran like a polished turd. now as you might say to me. "but uppa i have a high end pc will it still be ok?"now maybe so but for the majority of players i believe that this guide will help them out. as buying this game is a waste of money. do look at other reviews. as this may only apply to my AMD R7 with my i5 core. but i hope this review helped and for god sake if you have a mid range pc DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.EDIT This game has made the best leap forward in such an amazing way this game is now one of the best open world experiences on the market and i would encourage anyone to buy it. a very solid 8/10 experience &lt 3

review: I love Rust so much. However I know that this request is stupid to a lot of people but if the Devs would add the ability to play solo without making a server I would be very happy and I know other people would be too. I just want to be able to play even if something happened like no internet at the moment for example. And be able to change every setting within the game instead of joining countless servers with their own settings. Or at least make it easier to make my own server. But other than that it's an amazing game and I highly recommend it to everyone who loves the survival genre.

review: Hi there! My name is TheLastWarlord (as of posting this.) If anyone follows me on Steam you will know I am a heavy survival game player (Noone loves me so I doubt that) Anyway I just got rust a few years ago but I finally decided to play it. When I got in what do I get? Toxic players and a shotgun to my face. Is this bad? Up to you to decide.Rust is a straight PvP game with alot of young teenagers that play it thinking their hot stuff (me included) In reality it is the hardest game I have played but also the most addicting. I'd have to say grab a group of 3 4 friends and make a clan and harvest away!PROSThe pros? Well for one the graphics and sound. Depending on your computer they can be really good. I think the sound is the better of the two. This game is really heavily reliant on sound to determine where your enimes are picking hatcheting shooting etc. Is super loud but so are footsteps. So make sure your house is quiet turn up game sounds and enjoy. (Just kidding ignore my terrible advice lol. Keep your ears intact) Another pro is the resource gathering. This includes but is not limited to tools mats (Materials for you non survival players) and meds. Mining barrels is a sure fire way to get guns ammo armor and building mats. I personally think this is an amazing idea some think different.CONSToxic community I have to say it. Every once in awhile you'll run into a nice player but that is rare. I'm not saying the whole community is toxic but most are either quiet (Again nothing wrong with that) Really talkative too trustworthy or just outwright toxic. These are just personal cons for me don't take these too seriously. Hackers. Facepunch doesn't really help with this either. They are so common on Offical servers that everyone except the occasional noob and hacker goes on there. I play on a 20x that wipes every Thursday and I see almost 1 hacker a wipe. The admins usually take care of them but still nuts right?That is about it for my review. What is my overall thought? I wrote this as positive but tbh it can be both for me. Don't take this review too seriously as it is just me posting my thoughts on the game just to let you know how this game is anyway thanks for taking the time to read this )

review: Overall game is very good.Pros A lot of people are complaining about cheaters in any PC game which is competitive the game has cheaters ( didn't encountered not a single one in 130+hours of play ) but the company really cares about the game and banning actively them. They ban them in such a way that to return to the game is very difficult or costly meaning 1 banned cheater is gone he will not return for a while. Game very competitive and addictive has a lot of content had so much fun playing and very interested in streamers who stream the game. Developers are updating the game constantly every month they are presenting new features its like monthly Christmas you know that some big update will arrive and it actually changes the game and makes it better. The game has modded servers it means that if you want some different things you can easily join modded servers. ( For example if you want only to build you can join building servers same goes with PVP or anything you can think of ) Best survival game that exists to this day. Don't trust anyone who has 2 legs Involves skill you can't buy anything for money which will make you better it's not pay to win game it requires time ( much more time than i have 130+ hours ) and patience. Overall more you play you get better not your weapons or character.Cons The game badly needs optimization I have very high end PC and the game has FPS drops watched a lot of videos played with settings but didn't fixed the problem. This game badly needs optimization. Some bugs are there for months for example the bug where you can't pick up item because body is on top of the item and you need to remove body in order to pick up gun this is very annoying because sometimes you don't have even 1 second to waste. And other bugs which I checked are reported to facepunch studios. The game badly needs huge advertisement campaign to attract more people to the game I mean this game is the best survival game that exists and the same time sometimes servers are not full and lack people i understand that there are thousands of servers but the player base can be increased dramatically with the right advertisement. The game has so much content and for the beginner its pretty hard to understand everything how to do certain things i love that there was helping tips but its not enough.Overall If you like survival style games this is a MUST play game There is no better game than this in survival genre. BUY IT.

review: Going from having everything you can ever imagine too nothing in under 10 minutes? Yeah we call that rust. EDIT DEC 2018 As of December 2018 I thought I would write an updated review of the game in a shortish form. Lets just say that Rust has changed while still being the same game deep down personally I don't like the scrap system they put in but I'm getting used to it (my favourite was still blueprints from a couple years back).The game revolves around you starting out with nothing you must gather resources to build a base make weapons and armor as well as venturing out to collect other resources for scrap to get the blueprints for new and better items to make all while being hunted down by up to hundreds of other players. Very intense and fun game and I find it never gets old but can really be ruined by the community of certain players which isn't the games fault.All in all the game is fun and while you are doing the same thing over and over each time its different in certain ways making the replay value after each map wipe very high. The devs are very involved in the game and are constantly adding new things and fixing the old. One of my favourite games.Also don't expect to be very good at the game unless you play it quite a bit steep learning curve here get some friends to teach you how to play or else you are doomed. Rust can be a full time job if u wanted it to be.

review: Being honest don't come into this game expecting people to be nice to you. The community is so toxic and I love it. This game has given me the ability to grow above players and join a clan that runs the server. I do recommend playing this game IF and IF ONLY you have the requirements. This game is VERY demanding and with each new update the developers add more content to the game. Though at times it may be hard and boring but is fun when you get guns and start to gain wealth in the server. Knowing your base may not be there the next day you need to gain more resources and materials to build up your base and defenses. I would personally give it a 9.5/10. I can barely run the game due to the updates that have been added but I do recommend you play this game. Thank you for reading this D

review: Game is fun and all. Rampant with hackers the superjumpers and brute forcers make light work of your structures without needing a single resource. The private servers seem to be better policed for hacking than the offical facepunch servers which is kind of sad. Would be a fun game without the rampant hacking.Update almost 2k hours definately the best survival sandbox game i've played. As before still hackers but with an EA game i guess it's generally easier to do. The XP system was a bit of a flop but thankfully they realised this and introduced the component systems not quite bps again yet a great improvement on the XP system. I returned for a month to check out the compnent system and had great fun. Recommended to anyone who likes surivival games. Tip Rust is brutal alone.UPDATE 11/08/17 It still has it s positives and is a bit of fun though have spent a lot of hours on this game and the devs have no clear path. They chop and change things constantly. Now I get it it's EA but complete system changes to poorer systems only to then change them again is a joke. The lack of actualy decent updates anymore and simply cosmetic fixes and looking skins being pumped out for extra cash. They first destroyed legacy rust now they are well and trully on the way to destroying experimental branch as well. Quit while you are ahead Garry.......... If you wanted to around with every little aspect of a game to make it sandbox you already have Garry's Mod you and your team have en sunk this one sadly.

review: The games concept is appealing and has a great way of drawing people towards it. But that fact that the creators do a poor job of explaining how to play and what to actually do is garbage. If you never had any experience with games like these dont download and waste your money. unless you want to spend hours just learning how to get food. review: Rust is a survival game created by Facepunch Studios. Inspired by games like DayZ Minecraft and Stalker Rust aims to create a hostile environment in which emergent gameplay can flourish. The aim of the game is to survive. To do this the player should gather resources. Hitting a tree with a rock will give you wood hitting a rock with a rock will give you rock and ore. You can then craft a hatchet from the wood and rock allowing you to gather faster. You can go out and hunt a variety of wildlife such as boars chickens rabbits bears wolves and deer. Once you have killed an animal you can butcher it to gather its meat and skin. You can craft a fire using wood and cook the meat inside the fire. Then you can eat. You face two major dangers in game. Rust is a multiplayer game so there will be other players trying to survive in the same way that you are. Unfortunately for you they can find you kill you and take your stuff. Fortunately for you you can kill them and take their stuff. Or maybe you can make friends and help each other survive. Rust s world is harsh so you might need to make friends to survive. The environment is not kind. Bears and wolves will chase and kill you. Falling from a height will kill you. Being exposed to radiation for an extended period will kill you. Starving will kill you. Being cold will kill you. I will kill you )

review: I bought this game twice last week for me and my friend and paid 28$. At first we didn't know about there's "Legacy" mode. So we played with Experimental and we really liked it. Then we looked at Legacy but after Experimental Legacy was not good enough for us. So i'm writing this for Experimental. We loved the environment physics interface and much more things of the game but "connection problems" are very very annoying. So we both stopped playing it. Here are the serious problems that we noticed We always disconnect suddenly from different servers and we don't know why. Sometimes when we try to get into a server the game freezes on loading screen. (Receiving data) I'm playing the game on Fantastic mode. But when i look at that huge trees' from a long distance their leaves and bodies look like blocks of glitchy little trees. There's a bug on the code lock. Sometimes it aparts from the door and freezes in the air. There's no options tab in the main menu.You guys should sell Legacy and Experimental seperately. And Experimental's price must be under 5$. We didn't want to pay for the game we'll never open and play.So I'm not recommending this game until the connection problems are resolved. We can handle other bugs but connection problems are not acceptable for a paid game.EDIT The game is better now. Recommended.POST EDIT This game is the best!

review: Rust is an incredible game truly magnificent. Me and my friends have had hours building awful wooden bases only for them to be obliterated by a group of highly trained killers. Usually after this we are conscripted into some sort of army and used to wage war upon others like ourselves. Eventually the feelings of guilt and betrayal fade and are replaced only by a desire to please our overlords and bring death to their enemies. After several more hours of endless violence and bloodshed we stunble upon a few friends making a simple wooden shack. Tears flood our eyes as we remember our past and the journey we went on it to get here. We quickly put this out of our mind and mow them down like animals and then offer them a chance to join our glorious overlords army and they accept. the cycle continues.... Truly a fantastic game.

review: Product received for free. Before you scroll down and read the rest.. let me say one thing "Rust is a high risk high reward type of game if you get salty every time you die.. then move along.. this game isn't for you"._______________________________General game informationThis game is a great example of a survival sandbox game. You can literaly do whatever the hell you wanna do. Do you wanna roleplay? Go for it. Do you wanna build stuff and let your creative mind blow of some steam? Go for it. Do you wanna murder another player in cold blood with your trusted rock? Go for it.Obviously there are populair ways (PVP) to play the game but when you spawn in this game.. naked and along on a beach.. armed with a rock and torch.. with nothing holding you back.. you will realise why you woke up on the beach in the first place._______________________________My experienceAt the time of writing this review i've been playing this game for hours. It started out with a mate of mine buying the game. I was watching him through some streaming software and I thought it looked fun. So I bought it.After figuring out the basics of crafting and resource gathering i started building a wonderful base. That base lasted for a full hour. Then we were severly punished for the flaws in our design by a more experienced player. This happened over and over and over and over again. At this point a lot of people lose interest in the game I didn't.For some reason I was determined to learn from my previously made mistakes and improve on them.This resulted in over 800 hours of gameplay._______________________________State of the GameWhen you invest a little into this game physically and emotionally.. you will run into people referring to "Legacy" being the best state of the game I disagree.The current version of Rust is a combination of two previously tested systems of the game.These are named The Blueprint system + The component system.Most Rust players will tell you that the blueprint system was the best system this game has ever seen. Over the last few years them tried different systems which generally didn't get any love.A week ago (at the time of me posting this review) They revamped the system to the one I mentioned earlier.The Blueprint system + The component system Aka the best system Rust has ever seen + new features of older failed systems revamped._______________________________The prosIf you use a microphone you will have the most fun and random interactions you have ever experienced.There's a lot of ways to express your creativity. Basebuilding gearsets drawing penisses on other peoples bases.There is no real endgame so you can set your own goals. Trust me when I say that those can be very rewarding.Its a great game for Youtube content (has profanity filter auto censoring nudes ect.)Its a great game for Twitch content (has a streamer mode to hide from streamsnipers has profanity filter auto censoring nudes ect.)As a big community that really loves the game but for the most part is filled with toxic players. (Like any other game these days)The game is constantly being developed. Weekly changes+additions with every patch.The game also has a great Dev team they are hardworking and very dedicatedThe consIt has a big learning curve. The first thing you need to do is join a empty server and start figuring stuff out cause on a populated server you will get punished for it.A lot of people KoS in the current state of the game which is fine for me cause im used to it. But if you are new it can be very offputting.The game has a very annoying memoryleak that will cause problems no matter how much GB you got in that godlike computer of yours. (they are working on it)Deciding on the correct server for you to join will directly affect how much fun the game is for you as a soloplayer.The official servers are terrible. There is hardly ever a admin in there to counteract a possible cheater. My advice Stick to the community servers.The game uses a day/night cycle. During the night it truly is pitchblack and you wont be able to see a thing. Unless you have Nvidia then you can just fire up the gamma and you'll be fine. Especially vs people that have a AMD graphics card. Its a annoying problem in the game thats currently being looked into._______________________________The future isn't set in stone.Well sorta. If you take a look at the facepunch website you will be able to see a roadmap. On this roadmap you will be able to find features and fixes they lined up for the game. Some will be added shortly and some will probably never see the light of day. Keep in mind the game is currently still early access and might change drasticly in a year. I've seen the game go through 3 4 different systems now. And all of them had fun aspects and negative ones._______________________________ConclusionIf you are still interested after reading all this definately buy the game. Over the time of me playing Rust I've had the most interesting interactions and the most fun experiences ive ever had in a game._______________________________I'm Currently trading rust items feel free to send offers to me!!https //steamcommunity.com/tradeoffer/new/?partner 892100980&amp token QzzjP36

review: Let me start by saying that i have never ever in all my years on steam felt the absolute need to find the button to post a review on any game. That's obviously not to say no other game is worth a review. But rust...this game has a bittersweet taste. And i mean that in the best way possible. This game is a metaphor for life in my opinion. There are times where you will get the end of the stick. But moreso this game can be very very rewarding.The first thing i'd like to capitalize on is it's RANDOMNESS of events. Not events scripted into the game per se. Lets put it like this. I was and am really still quite a noob. It took me awhile to learn this game.I could not find a single node of stone or a single hemp plant for like the first 50 hours. Do not let this discourage you. (also do not let being killed or raided discourage you. Do whatever it takes to get in on the action. Mess with people try to get involved with other players in some way shape or form). THE MOST IMPORTANT THING I CAN SAY is to figure out what you're supposed to be doing and work towards it. Explore. Just the other day i joined a new server and within 5 minutes i had a pistol. Ive walked into decayed bases and past dead bodies with tons and tons of great on them. The bigger message here is you can run and run and run around in this game for 8 hours getting killed while naked starving freezing burning..This pattern changes with persistence. You WILL eventually kill someone with something good or find a dead body/broken into base full of loot. Once you get that first guy full of rifles explosives great armor it will motivate you. This game can be unforgiving but if you try to fit into the environment of hostile players the same way youd fit in at a new school a job prison try to communicate with folks even if you get screwed over. if you keep roaming building and wathcing youtube videos on all the aspects of the game you'll be at least somewhat successful. and it will continue to increase your motivation to play this. dont let trolls get to you. brush it off man. Servers wipe clean and everyone's item blueprints theyve acquired to craft essential items wipe clean typically between 1 week and several months. servers wipe monthly the longest ive seen and 4 days lowest. i prefer monthly wipes because i like to build. justwiped is a website that shows what servers have just wiped structures/loot and blueprints. When you start out on a fresh wipe everyone starts from scratch and things get a chance to be fair for everyone again. You're going to lose your base on wipe cycle date. youll probably lose it eventually otherwise unless you're lucky or you/your team happen to be the type to dominate servers. i believe the game is pretty balanced. More balanced than a lot of survival games. The building isnt too grindy. not like ARK. you can throw down a decent sized base fairly quickly when you get used to the rhythym and find good locations to seek residence in. LONG STORY SHORT i play on monthly wipe servers for instance...i like to think of the beginning of each wipe as entry to a month long competition against the other folks in the server. It's a game of elimination. People spend the first few weeks all building up and fighting with more pitiful weapons and it can get pretty amusing. Id say after around the 2 week mark things really start getting more hostile day by day usually worst to try to farm on a weeknight unless you're slick with the pvp. Once theres 2 3 days left before a month wipe people start using all the resources theyve had stockpiled and youll hear nothing but gunshots and explosions all over. therell be non stop chaos and destruction. it sounds like the 4th of july and its just beautiful. we start with nothing build up defenses and hoard stuff and go out with a bang at the end of every wipe and it repeats. new location servers hit population cap again new people to make rage. i go back to the randomness of events. I can say that ive been geared up in great armor with some of the best guns and have been killed by someone chucking spears or lobbing arrows at me. Ive also been the naked player with a bow to get a kill on a guy in full armor with a gun. It's all about awareness of your surroundings and not letting anyone get the drop on you. Generally a veteran player in high tier gear will have the upper hand but i have seen so many scenarios play out with what some would believe was pretty absurd irony. If you just try to do good and keep a positive competitive attitude youll eventually start making off with hauls of loot here and there. If you get ahold of blueprints for good weapons and items being wiped off the map does not stop you from getting a few workbenches back up a research table and mostly insignificant amount of materials to start crafting more of most mid level weapons/items and get back in the fight somewhat at least. you can become king of the hill yourself in the blink of an eye. thats just how it happens in this game. i see so many reviews of people ing about this game. i have had many unique experiences. Ive never played a game where i felt happy disappointed adrenaline pumped and paranoid all in the same day. You always have a decision to make trusting other players you intersect with. you never know if this person will become your friend on steam 10 years from now or if theyll shoot you and take all your stuff. Preemptive strikes can either get you some good loot or can off some kid and get him to go get his team nearby and stomp you and your base out. So you need to choose your battles. Maybe not kill everyone but detect when someones going to do something and react first. always be ready to kill someone man. It's like life. you take risks and hope for the best outcome. you get maimed you revise your tactics and try again. This game might not be for everyone MAYBE. BUT!!if you go on youtube and watch a bunch of videos on this game for months like i did before you buy it you will know whether this game is for you or not. This game will some people off if they fail to see the bigger picture of it's intention. I have to admit though I've never been i have felt this short lived disappointment/frustration yes. But it wears off and i keep playing compulsively like im a teenager again. I'm happy for anyone who can learn to appreciate this game and accept that yes it can suck but ask yourself what you're doing wrong if your whole experience of the game has been negative and figure out how to change it. watch videos of "salty rust kids" and building/raid guides. find an item read up on it online. like many games rust is its own world and its like learning a new language. it is the world we live in but people dont hold back on being amusing irritating or just plain psychopathic. Bad day at work? make some 10 year old beg for their back and laugh at them. GOod day at work? go farm and make some trades joke with some people. Put on some thick skin and just raise hell. thats all else i can really tell you. Next to warcraft in it's prime battlefield games and a handful of other games this is one of the best games i believe has ever existed. Like any game there could always be something added to it that isnt and maybe never will be. Theres always room for improvement in any game but look...theres a reason people play this game for 7k hours. ill leave it at that. hopefully people read this long scatterbrained but i think informative post put in a detailed way i dont see a lot of reviews do

review: Started on the XP System update. Coming from ARK Survival Evolved what that game does wrong this one does it absolutely right. There's no HUGE gap between veteran and starter players (a TREX vs a Crossbow low tier vs high tier damage etc) meaning you can get on a server and start raiding in a few hours instead of spending your playtime grinding. The farming/pickup rates are far more generous meaning you will actually feel like you've made some progress which also makes a vanilla solo run feasible.Basically it's a survival game that allows hardcore and casual players to cohexist. You can play this as casually as an fps and still make meaningful progress which saves you a lot of time for your other daily activities. It's not exhausting for the common player.Lastly and in comparison to ARK PvP in rust is all about your ability as a player rather than seeing which flying dinosaur has more health in a world where guns are useless and an individual is meaningless.It has a long way to go but its foundation is pretty solid.

review: Rust Review I bought this game in Early Access almost a year ago. Since then the development of the game has been astounding. Performance used to be terrible and certain aspects of the game were broken. Now performance has increased greatly and the game has increased in quality as well. Positives This game has an awesome atmosphere. It really makes you feel like you are there. There is something cool about meeting strangers and building a community or just trading or talking. It really makes the game that much better. Progression feels good. Whether you make your first gun or your first base. It feels good. Complaints You need a good/great pc to run this. Because of issues and graphics this game needs a beefy pc to get any fps. The majority of the community will KOS. So if you plan to play I recommend you get some friends first. There are still issues with the game. It isn't polished and perfect so don't buy it for that. Should I buy it? I would say yes. It's a wonderful game that has provided thousands of hours of enjoyment to many people. It's a little rough around the edges but I enjoyed every hour that I put into it

review: DO NOT GET ME WRONG!!! Rust's concept is great I personally love online co op open world survival games. However the horrible optimization drives me away from this game.I love the gameplay everything is great getting geared is a long but rewarding quest. The graphics look really fresh.All the other stuff is horrible though whenever I access my build menu (Q) and click on an item to craft it lags my game so hard for 0.5 1 second. This might not sound like a lot but this happens every time no matter what I do. This may be the fact that my 1060 6gb is the only thing not sufficient for the (recommended) settings for the game but if I have an i7 8700 and 16gb of RAM and the game runs at 65 80 FPS average (1080p) this really should not be happening.I also have completely random lag spikes for 1 2 seconds during game with no warning and for no particular reason and of course this pushes me away from the game.All in all I recommend this game to everyone that has recommended settings however that one component you don't have on there can cuck you (in my speculations).

review: Now that i have 1k plus hours in this game i feel obliged to write a review Therefore i will try my best to describe what this game is at its core and why it is on a steep downward trend.I bought rust on June 17th 2016 And it was a really buggy and unfinsihed game but a really fun one it had alot of depth within the crafting and the pvp aspects. In my opinion xp was the best system for rust because it was a linear system in which one doesnt level up by being with a clan and having them do everything for them (like it is now) you had to actually farm and do things in the game that would contribute to your personal level And even if 1 person grinded really hard for 1 day they most likely would have rockets or c4 mabye ak but no raiding materials in which most of this game is dependant on that depth in raiding and pvp. And from that change from xp to components it wasnt about skill anymore it was about how much manpower you could muster and the chinese dominated this (for some reason i actually dont know why) in turn from that alot of those clans (in rust we call them zergs most of the time) they would cheat and from that more people feel inclined to cheat from that to counter them and from them countering the cheaters they kill more people and they feel inclined to cheat and the cycle repeats. And from that a toxic community forms not from social contact but from who can horde the most stuff and have the biggest base or the biggest zerg. The developers of this game are blissfully blind of what is actually happening in their game which is really saddening because rust used to be my favorite game of all time but this rapidly changed with the updates they have been releasing. These updates have the intentions of the people AWFULLY wrong and in turn the player base it turning against the company FacePunch studio's for not listening to the consumer feed back and doing whatever the they want with the game. A great expample of this is the boat update in this update they added boats in which you can go on the water and get items this is all fine and dandy but they have no clue what the community wants everyone on reddit has ben BEGGING for a change to pvp and the guns in the game. But no they want to add boats hot air balloons electricity and a lot of other t no one asked for. Which in turn made the community even more toxic and making everyone not trust facepunch. Which is making me turn my review against this game i give this game a 4/10 it is painfully average because facepunch has their fingers up their not changing what the entire community really wants in this game.Helk please

review: I personally Find Rust be and amazing game with lots of content it can go 1 of a million ways u could start and with nothing and stay with nothing for hours then in a split second u could be full gear with Ak Metal Gear i personally think that the game is a great investment and if ur skeptical of buying wait for black Friday Christmas or any other holiday with 50% off sales and buy it then and u can always re fund if its not your cup of tea the game is definitely not for new PC gamer and its a brutal game to play but once u get past the starting stages of rust and know what your doing all it is fun and enjoyment ive met most of my good online friends over rust either from raiding them and then talking to them after or teaming up with them in a random server to raid some big zerg Rust was a big part of my life sadly i dont have a PC anymore but someday ill be able to pay again my personal time played is around 1250 Hours and ive been playing since XP days back when there was bugs and not to many players ive gotten to watch this game grow and deal with summer sale players and its been the best game i have ever played ever i recommend it if u like constant pvp and pushing your skill to the limit this game is 100% for u and just be happy new players u didnt have to deal with the old muzzle brake or heavy armour i also love the semi Automatic pistol (P2) no matter how much u want to Nerf it 10/10 Game

review: So i have a love hate relationship with rust i've had some of the greatest moments i've ever had in gaming but also some of the worst. I've had wipes where i was raided 8 times in one week and others where i only died 5 times and dominated an entire official server. I've been playing this game over the course of 6 years and i've seen it from the days where you were hitting zombies with a hatchet on hapis to where we are today. Unfortunately rust in its current state well it's very time consuming almost too time consuming. I can't say i was a fan of the upkeep update because well your base decaying with the fact you also fall asleep in game when you log off just kind of forces you to play almost everyday. You constantly have to worry about losing everything. You will find yourself at work thinking about how your base is holding up. It's just really obnoxious and i know some people will say that oh hey why don't you play on a 2x server and to that i say it ruins the balance. People get explosives and very high tear way too quick and since there's only so much space in a tc you bases defence is weakened while your enemies offense is doubled which is problematic. I think that the tc should at the very least have more space so if you slapped by real life you can just grind a bunch and fill your tc to hold you over for like 3 days and maybe have the space in your tc scale with the size of the building so it's still going to be expensive to upkeep if its too big but you can keep is up for 72 hours since people get busy and can't be on every day to grind. Another big thing is give people at the low tear more options to kill heavily geared opponents. The thing is if it's 1 or maybe two heavily gear guys you can take them out with a pipe if your really smart about your positioning and if they come to you. The only other option that comes to mind is if you use a crossy and three stone spears which if you have never tried it is a load of fun to use. It's really effective though because you can headshot with the crossbow and then follow up with three spears to the head and kill well anything. The problem is that well you have the groups of five patrolling with ak and road sign and if they are even a challenge for one dude with metal armor and an ak. It would be nice if there was some sort of very high skill weapon that has the potential to kill opponents who are well equipped if you play your cards right and the pipe is not adequate for killing five men unless they ar absolute garbage but at that point you could probably kill them with a sword. My proposal is that you add a musket that take a long time to reload has a slow moving projectile with a lot of bullet drop and damage drop off is expensive to shoot as well but can one shot head shot anyone within let's say 30 meters. So you would be able to kill five armored men but you would have to use very good positioning maybe set up some traps and have cover to reload and retreat while also not missing a single shot but it could be done. Also it might be a good idea to lower the price of the bolty because it's really difficult to justify making one of your using a rifle body you would use for an ak and of course the L96 is just better than it so the bolty either needs a damage buff or price cut honestly it's would be a cool high end mid tear if maybe it didn't cost a rifle body but it did cost a bunch of hqm springs and pipes like a more expensive version of the pump. Also something i've always wanted to see in this game is a high end semi auto maybe an fal since that is what i would consider one of the best survival rifles and its would have m249 damage in a semi auto package maybe it would be op idk but i love the fal and i want to see it in game. Anyway i've gone off on a tangent. Something important to take into account is this game has a very toxic player base not all of them are bad but most are but you can usually find a decent crew to run with if you look hard enough. Basically don't take anything to heart in this game people will be cruel and they dont give a about you if you react more they will probably stick around and try to torture you so sometimes it's best to just let it go and stay quite. Me personally i like to hold grudges at least for that wipe sometimes i'll make a list and if your on it i will kos and you will be a prime target for raids and i might partake in casualy hunting you like an animal for fun(please don't take that out of context because it looks really bad but it's just a game). Basically this is a hardcore survival experience that is best played with friends solo is brutal and not for those who can't handle abuse. It's a game where the highs are super high and the lows will have you contemplating why you ever bothered picking this game up. One thing worth noting is that these devs are some of the best i've ever seen i love how devoted they are to this game and it's insane that they have kept up with this weekly updates for all these years seriously facepunch thank you for your hard work you have made an amazing and it's sure to get better. You have given me some really awesome experiences with this game and even though im taking a break from it for now it's one that i will never forget. To anyone considering this game i would say it's worth a buy on sale mainly since your either going to love it or hate but it's worth the experience try and see if you can survive a wipe i'd love to hear how it went.

review: Rust was the highlight of my year for 2016 2017 and the beginning of 2018. I have spent 1.7k hours on this game coming home after school at 4 00 in the afternoon and binge playing Rust well into early the next morning with all my friends. Though I never was and still am not extremely skilled at the game the game offers a variety of options to make your experience great. Primarily Rust is a sandbox where you can do pretty much anything the majority of it offers combat/pvp which when playing with friends involves high levels of communication &amp strategy while other parts of it offer building crafting farming etc. The game is 100% a lot better when you have a group of friends to play it with as it will make the experience a lot more fun. I would highly recommend this game to any of my friends.A couple negative points about the game though which I do want to throw in for anybody that may be considering to purchase the game. Toxic Playerbase the community/playerbase of Rust is extremely toxic and not friendly or helpful to newcomers. If you look at a community like Greekgodx Ice Poseidon or Sodapoppin it is a mixture of all three communities combined I know that isn't good The majority of toxicity is caused by salty 12 year olds who aren't able to handle the aspects of this rage inducing game. Cheaters the community does have a notable amount of cheaters though I haven't played in a good 4 months the game had a lot of cheaters back in early/mid 2017 which did cause a lot of issues and made the game not enjoyable to play anymore. This game is very rage inducing so to work hard to put up a base farm materials and craft gear and to have it taken by a cheater doesn't sink in that well.

FIVE years and you STILL haven't fixed some of those glitches? every time you have "optimized" the game i seem to lose 10 20 fps consistently? what does optimizing do or SUPPOSED to do? this game was SO much better in either legacy or early expiremental days ever since you dicked off the game developer leader in 2015 june the game has ONLY gone downhill and worse. i have over 2k dollars into my pc for me to have to sit here and wait 30 minutes every time to load into a game and have somewhat decent fps. Actual garbage game DON'T waste your time or money on this game all you will find is 20+ groups of people gameplay or pure toxicity. They have changed things that change just blow my mind completely skill based controllable recoil which makes sense if your jumping and shooting its harder to hold the gun right? to hardly any recoil at all with BLOOM? SKILL TO LUCK? it makes absolutely no sense why you would change something realistic and skill based to something COMPLETELY unrealistic and luck based your bullet doesn't just do a 90 degree angle turn in real life. and things like that is what im talking about how this game has just gone downhill

review: Honestly this game is great. shooting building and a heirarchy of power.The only thing that i am getting angry about is the stupid things the developers keep doing. I find it annoying that when the devs leave something out e.g. you can use ladders to scale to loot rooms and weaker points (great raiding tactics) the deleted that. I hate them for that after all the intellegent raider's hard work all they can do is make raiding boring slow and dumb. they also removed normal stairs many people used this to hide their loot from raiders. I mean COME ON i work hard with other raiders and builders to create this handy tactic and they delete it?!?I must say that from my point of view (i am a raider) this is a crime. People work hard on learning new interesting ways to raid bases and 'whoops!' sorry its gone. I also think that the developers should spend more time trying to fix the fact that deers and boars can walk through rocks and walls. But instead the focus their interests on making the game boring. Can you see where this is going? they are making the game soooo boooring...Another nasty thing about this game is the fact that the combat system is THE WORST. it is completely useless. recoil on guns make it better to use that useless bolt action rifle the stupid bow or just waste ammo with a rocket launcher. I think this is why raiders dont do frontal assaults as they just get mowed down in thin corridors. What i am trying to tell you (or the devs) is that this comabt system is HORRIBLE because of the extreme recoil on every singe gun. so much recoil that when i got my hands on a newly added machine gun 5 bullets got me to face the ceiling. wow. that didnt end well i might have had to retreat and lick my wounds for tomorrow.But other than that it is pretty good. Stashes was a good way to hide loot put a secret loot room under your foundation and place secret stashes next to the containers? nice. And the game isnt going to be boring for a long time that time being when you are just hitting rocks and slapping wood because the game has made raiding impossible. and i think that that is why this game is so populare raiding. so many good times... so funny... If they keep on ruining raiding however i am going to ask for a refund.Also (just saying) this game is full of Russians. and although theey are nice when they ARENT raiding you there is that 1 in 1000 that decides to shoot you when you are trying to be kind. But who can blame him? he cant speak english so there is no way he can understand us. 6/10. stop ruining raiding.

review: Rust is kind of glitchy and has high pc requirements to run imo. Be careful about the people you trust because they can easily betray you or inside your clan and steal everything. Don't let random people join you... don't expect people to help either.The developers continue to add new content which was recently the cargo ship and hot air ballon. The cargo is buggy. The air balloon has some glitches. Other than that the point is that they add new things every 2 weeks or so with the updates. My advice is to find a server that you enjoy the most. Modded servers are easier to navigate as a new player because they give more loot faster and you can learn faster by progressing faster throughout the wipe.Don't forget to honey comb with triangles. Lock your boxes. Lock your doors. Spread your loot out. Build stable/sturdy houses. Enjoy the game. Don't get tilted and if you do take a break. ) The community is toxic on some servers and better on others. Every wipe is different. Find friends to play with. Of all the hours I've spent playing Rust I have only encountered one clan that has super obvious hackers (ESP). Other than that this game is amazing and the developers do a good job of adding new content. &lt 3 Highly recommend.

review: If you want a post apoc survival game with resource gathering building pvp than this is the best value for money game you can buy. Most people who play it have thousands of hours because of the amount of fun you can have from playing this game. Rust just like its theme is unforgiving. you risk everything just to try to survive and thrive. There is a very steep learning curve but the more you watch videos of the game and practicing different servers you will become better at the game with experience. Make friends or play with friends. You will have a much better chance of surviving and winning fights/raids against other groups. place lots of sleeping bags around it makes it easier to get back to your body WHEN you die. because you WILL die..... Alot. Cheers. p.s. dont trust anyone and remember to always shut your doors.

review: Probably one of the most frustrating games you'll ever play especially as a solo player but there is just something about this game that draws you to come back even though you've been beaten down time after time you can't help but love this game and once you really start to get the hang of the game like me you will probably sink hundreds of hours into the game within a week or two.To start things off with the most satisfying and rewarding part of the entire game The exhilerating combat situations you end up in this game are what makes it so fun and is what makes it so replayable. Getting a sweet sweet bow headshot is beyond satisfying especially once you've mastered it you feel like an absolute god. Also using spear and other weapon combos are also needed to be used very strategically to pay off as the enemy could easily just pick up your weapon and leave you defenceless which is yet another combat mechanism to master in order for you to have the quickest most fun start. Not to say that you need to be a PVP god to enjoy the game it's still very enjoyable taking your time with gathering your loot then going out to battle this is especially recommended to newer players if you aren't comfortable or used to the combat yet. But a word of warning if you are going into your first server as a solo and don't want to be thrown straight into the line of fire I'd recommend joining a solo only server as no group limit servers could have several roofcampers or even zergs.Next off the farming aspect of the game is somewhat boring at the start mainly because of how slow the rock farms and that nodes don't always spawn near you so you may have a hard time getting arrows or stronger tools. But other than that farming is very simple and no bs. If you manage to come across an edible plant or hemp you can plant them outside your base for easy food (be warned that people can steal or even break your crops). There isn't really anything else to be said about farming other than to watch your back because some people like to roam around and kill farmers for easy loot!Another aspect you'll want to know about is how to get loot like the ak47's that everyone desires or the m249! Generally you'll be finding all of the top range loot in big monuments that require puzzles to be solved in order to find the loot or even fighting off scientists with guns. You'll need keycards to do these puzzles which are found in lesser monuments but they shouldn't be too hard to find. There are several types of crates in rust which all contain different rarities of items. There are Basic crates Tool Boxes Food Crates Military Crates and elite loot crates which have the best loot but require alot of grinding to get to but hey RNG can sometimes send you straight to top dog in a matter of minutes! If you are a new player you could just set your self up to a small monument like gas station or mining outpost which shouldn't be too crowded but can still supply you with basic loot like revolvers or shotguns. Most experienced players will prefer to setup up next to the most populated monuments to find alot of pvp or loot nearby and will also try to set up next to a small recycling monument to easily get scrap from spare components.Finally building and Crafting. In rust you can create a building plan and a hammer which will let you make your very own base building a simple base is self explanatory however to protect your base from raiders and campers you may want to add some more complex features to your base e.g an airlock (2 or more doors facing each other so you can trap or stop players from entering your base) honeycombing(triangular reinforcements around your base so enemies raiding you will have to blow through several walls rather than just one. Also with the hammer you can upgrade your base using different materials each making your base significantly stronger. There is twig wood stone sheet metal and armoured. A good rule to go by is to never leave your base at twig level (remember you foundation!) because at twig level anyone can come along with any item (even a rock) and just knock it down. Also while we are on the topic of building I'll mention the Tool Cupboard sometimes referred to as TC the tool cupboard will claim a small area around it than only you can build on so you can't be griefed or so other people can't build on your stuff! However unless the TC is locked or hid behind walls and a door than anyone can authorise themselves to it and build all over your property also if they have authorisation of your TC they can unauthorise anyone on it so you'll no longer be able to build there. So now crafting crafting in itself is pretty simple and won't take long to get the hold of however there may be a few things your are not going to understand like Blueprints and workbenches. So some items in Rust aren't immediatley craftable so in order to craft them you'll first need to find one of the item learn it on a research table using scrap and then most likely have to use a workbench to craft that item and the higher tier the item is the higher tier workbench you will need.Thank you for reading my review obviously there is a lot more to rust than what I have stated and it is an absolute blast to play and I can honestly recommend it to anyone it is one of the most addicting thrilling games I have ever played. Good Luck in Rust &lt 3

review: Played since the very first game released and onto this version. I'll always remember the horrid screams of terror from people getting hacked to pieces by scavengers the ominous threats of slaughter between factions times long before the appearance of road sign armour where having full radiation gear meant you were a demigod but could easily be dethroned by the knock of a single arrow from a man you never saw coming.No matter the playstyle the behaviour the morals and lack thereof you practice in Rust you'll always find two things 1 There will always be noobies who have died a hundred times before learning any basic skills2 There will always be the one guy you wish you never metNo matter what happens treat your fellow players like your kin and you'll always have fun. (Smashing the corpses of your enemies is fun too)Every update brings something new even if it is a small bit of glitch fixing or big releases like new items or even map updates RUST always makes me giddy whenever I see the download pending and even more when I launch the game (And it crashes and takes 20 years to load in to a server)Love it forever

review: I have almost 200 hours in this game. I don't recommend it.They fixed all the funny bugs like bears walking through the ground they continue to make changes some of which are useful and cool (ie adding content like new guns and armor and plants and monuments) but most changes make pointless changes to mechanics fixing problems no one had or making the game unbalanced till those changes were reverted a couple of updates later. The community is a toxic cesspool anyone thats friendly is probably terrible and going to be dead weight everyone else is a and wants your blood the moment you respawn. Its a horrible unless you know at least 5 people to play with at least two of which much be online 100% of the time. It lags like a on community servers and the official servers are the worst for cancerous players and being harassed by large groups of people. The randomly generated maps are very samey and uniform. They're always familiar. The map generator probably took two weeks to write using some Perlin noise and a random walk that makes rivers and it showsIf you manage to make a base somewhere away from other players you're still forced to move around and forage and most likely come into contact with other players due to the fact that animals are extremely sparse so you'll have to make a trip to one of the premade monuments whenever they respawn food and items. Likely to find that it was cleared out by a clan 5 minutes ago and they're still hanging around or that its being scouted out by someone who has been playing since day one of the server wipe and has all the best gear already. Add on top of this the poor optimisation that comes from being a Unity game that is completely remade every 3 months.Actual game would be pretty ok if the community wasn't absolute trash and if the devs made actual improvements for each new version instead of wanking in a corner and calling the pathetic dribbles on the wall a game.

review: Product received for free. I now have over 2 000 hours in Rust I have been playing this game for over 3 years I have enjoyied the game for a long time and it still keeps me entertained. The game does have a big learning curve in which i think the devs are working on a turtorial to help with that but its best to play with a friend for at least when your starting out to help teach you how things work or watch a lot of youtube videos. Even when you know how to play well the game will be better with friends or a clan because more people can get more things done and its a overall better experience. The game is really diverse and thats what keeps me playing every time I log on I know unique things and encounters with other players will happen that i've never seen before so it keeps the game fresh. Also every time a server wipes there is never a repeated map so it is always changing and keeping the content new and interesting. This game can support multiple play styles but it can be fustrating and rage endusing when your learning the game as mostly everyone will kill you. P.S. Don't trust anyone in game.

review: The game was once good great actually. people wanted to interact with each other and killing on sight was not as frequent as it is now. The community has gotten way too toxic. Killing fresh spawns is now a sport for the unskilled PvP players. The dev team tried to help nakeds by putting a sash on the ones that have gear on them so you can identify someone who has gear and is naked but it hasnt helped any. Joined a server today in hopes to enjoy some rust like I once had. As soon as I was spawned in I was instantly met with a swift death by some kid screaming racist remarks "I am killing all those that dont look like me." I miss the days of meeting someone random teaming up and raiding a base that the players are online to defend themselves. Now its players in global chat asking for help to raid a base that has "tons of loot" while not one player is online to defend it. If you're a new player to rust and just recently purchased the game I feel sorry for you because you wont get a great experience because of the egdelords and reddit kids who now plague every server. Now I can admit some servers can be fun to play on but more often than not its not enjoyable anymore. HARD PASS on this game spend the money on a game that youll enjoy.

title: Rust

review: This is my review so far having played 22.4 hours as a noob.I like this game alot. I think it has alot of potential. I read somewhere that it is still a game in development so I hope this review is at least read even if discarded.I think Rust is one of the most intriguing survial games I have come across so far. On the main servers there really is no forgiveness and at first this seemed insanely harsh especially due to the griefers.I met some people instantly even when I was completely naked and almost had nothing just take me out for "fun's sake?"Okay I kind of get it. This is a brutal world even though I don't know if there is any story here. Nature mixed with the modern and everyone is hunting each other. Really feels like there should be a main lore here.Anyway I spent about three or four days getting enough materials to start a new base. On the second night I had been successfully farming hemp and collecting in the wild to make a full cloth armor set as well as a decent spear.That same night I saw some guy collecting stuff near my tree and I killed him. I got a number of supplies and added it to my small boxes.I had enough materials to provide protection of my base for a number of days so I really started feeling I would develop my small home to at least stone and possibly a metal door before I had any trouble.Boy I was wrong. Final night I was alive. I heard someone approach. I took out the metal blade I had made from some previous looted metal fragments and wood I had gathered and made what I thought was at least a starter decent metal blade.I had some cloth armor on at this point but not fully clothed because I had been killed by a pig after two or three strikes even after I thought I hit it twice with a wooden bow. I died the previous day to that pig so I lost my full set.This last night I readied my blade and had my door closed though I knew it was weak.In a few moments this guy blew up one of my stone walls or still remaining wooden ones with guns or explosives not sure.However then as I stayed quiet getting ready for him to approach he fires some shots sounding like they were from an AK and boom just like that I died. I didn't even hit him once.My bag was so close though I instantly respawned. This time again naked and just having a rock. I hit him once with the rock I think and "boom" I was hit again from some fire from his gun.To be fair I had killed a guy the previous night naked with very little and now this guy had hunted me.Fair and Square and he is going to get all of my loot.However I had just felt like I was begining to develop and since stone doesn't seem as common as wood it's not even that super fast to be able to upgrade to stone walls at least and or a foundation within the first few days and just like that all of your hard work can be gone and you start out again with almost nothing.I get this is part of the game and I don't see this changing where just like that "boom your gone"However I do feel that the developers want to attract more people and I feel there are alot of players that would seriously hate having to grind even this basic stuff out and just in a heartbeat lose everything after taking so much time and resources to develop even minimal protection and progress.I am not going to advocate that pvp servers should be gone. That would ruin the point of the game as a survival one.I do question though if at least some specific servers should be dedicated pve ones or at least safe within certain specific territories.With the world that exists so far I don't think that would be a huge stretch.Not everyone wants to be forced to join a clan or group up to survive.It should be possible at least on some servers that certain zones allow the player to reach at least a certain level of development on their own before being killed orat least allow the player to live within certain small areas of the game where they can not be harrassed at all if they don't want to be bothered.This worked with wow and I don't think it's that bad of an idea.Then if that player chooses to go out into the wider world that isn't protected they are agreeing on taking their chances possibly for higher rewards to entice.I would like to see this game grow but right now considering gamers in a general basis and not just hardcore Rust Fans I feel if the dev's would like this game to grow more it should at least have a bit more dedicated servers to being pve or noob friendly.

review: Rust certainly has its pros and cons. It's definatly not worth the current price point I bought it during early access for pretty cheap. It's not at all suited for single player. For sure it needs to be played on multi person servers or with friends on a private server. It's pretty simple in regards to gameplay. The challenges come from the threat of other people and thats pretty much it. At least in games like ARK and 7 Days there's those other danger elements that make it more playable alone. The modded servers can be pretty fun. The official servers are completely toxic and are unfortunately the only way to get achievements. If you have other friends who play then its worth getting on sale. If its just you and you're not comfortable playing on multi person servers alone then I suggest looking for something else.
title: Rust

review: Rust I mean.... what more can I say?!!!!No game will push you to such a high level of anxiety desire mistrust and anger. You'll spend days making an awesome base gathering wicked loot then get raided killed and griefed.... and then want to do it again.No game requires as high and huge a learning curve as Rust where after 1000 hours of gameplay you MIGHT not be considered a noob. But you'll love the journey all the way.And with such a huge following community and highly present developers Rust is always growing and offers a wide variety of game styles and servers for everyone to enjoy and train on. The game is ever growing with constant updates adding more content to increase the replayability.Tthis game is MORE than worth the 20 it cost me (when it was EA)

review: They should rename this game to "You're Gonna Die. A Lot. No Really A Lot. We Mean It." We would call it YGDALNRALWMI for short.First love this game it's as addictive as Minecraft or 7DTD combined with the added bonus of you constantly being hunted by real people not AI. Highly encourage anyone purchasing this game to hit YouTube and watch some of the community "get started" videos. If you watch the vids you'll be frustrated for the first two hours. If you don't then you'll be frustrated for many many more.Casual gameply will require some hours. You can't launch the game play for 10 minutes and quit long play sessions are about the only real way to make progress.Once you get the hang of the gameplay and get yourself a cabinet established the game will change a bit. Oh you still die a lot but you'll get the hang of venturing out scavenging/mining resources and returning to base to stash your loot. When you choose a server look for one with a very recent reset or everyone you meet will have machine guns. I found one with a reset two weeks prior and even that was a little brutal but I'm working my way up.The only downside is the long loadtime especially the first time you play a server. The load times are definitely better on subsequent plays but that first one is brutal. Very fun game happy I stumbled onto it. I can see spending hundreds of hours in Rust.
title: Rust

review: This game was "officially" released solely for the purpose of revenue. Wolves still bite you wile facing the opposite direction. lots of cheats and admins only on community servers (if that). the community is full of kids who aren't even supposed to have the game and constant racism and general hate fills the chats. My first experience on the Official Hapis server was like this farmed for 2 hours built base out of stone made furnace made sheet metal doors (including airlock) made boxes logged off next day gathered resources for about 2 hours but log off because work for a living log back on next day find my doors destroyed and new door with key lock stuck inside cant break out leave server. My second experience i decided to go on a smaller server as to decrease the likelyhood of me being griefed as well as hopefully find a community of newer players to trade with and overall have an enjoyable experience play for 4 days over break making a large house and trade with a few players log on fifth day died by (Chinese characters) while offline spawn nearby and head back to base completely intact no doors broken hmmm go inside go through 6 airlocks closing doors behind me and find my inner lootroom stairs destroyed as well as TC everything else fine including walls get shot in back by (same Chinese characters) return again only to see them seal the base off just so i cant use it they leave I give up on game.Overall the game can be fun but playing something for a few days straight only to have some cheater log on and ruin it all as well as monthly wipes is not my idea of fun i would not recommend the experience to anyone. They need to change some things to make the players work together or focus on another foe altogether or have some in game punishment for griefing or destroying people unprovoked such as a heli and group of scientists. until then this game is a pointless grind.
title: Rust

review: First impressions are it would be an amazing game but as usual the kiddies who really should not really be playing this sort of game just have to go and ruin it for everybody with their toxic attitudes. It's a shame there are not any servers that implement an age verification system as i imagine playing this on a server with mature people would be an amazing experience.I also wonder if it was created as some kind of social experiment. It has the potential to change you into some kind of sociopath. When i started playing my mindset was 'I could never loot items that someone else has worked hard to gather' half hour in am desperately hungry and thirsty find a dead body with some food and water on them i loot it and feel bad about it. Another half hour goes by and i am killing and looting people without a care in the world.Update being new i did not know about 'server wipes' so basically once a month all the materials you gather the base you build the weapons and armor you craft as well as everything else you manage to gather gets wiped so every month you have to start all over again. Sorry but that makes this the most pointless waste of time/effort game ever.

review: Oh boy this game is just a chore that doesn't let upFirst off you don't get to customise your character a creative choice by the dev.......that makes no sense. "Oh you don't get to choose in real life so you don't get to choose here" Because in real life I gather wood by hitting a tree wtih a rock after I arrive with nothing but a rock and a torch ........this isn't real life so why deny me a little customisation.Secondly the game makes it needlessly annoying to gather resources. Wood is fine enough stones can only be gathered by finding the small stone clusters on the ground or the minable stones from the very few rocks out of the very many textured rocky areas in the land that you need to get to grips with fast. Most of the time you will be running about trying to find these...then need to worry about your hunger levels which start off drastically low and continue to drop as you run about making a race of who can find the first canned food or chocolate and actually be able to concentrate on normal resources.But it doesn't stop there oh no if you want to build anything and have it last more than a few hours....enjoy stuffing your cupboards full of more resources more running about trying to find stone and other such just to maintain what you have done.Unless you have a lot of friends with you working to help you with this skip it.

review: This game is horrible in its current state. my first life I spawn in and go to a tree when i hear over the voice chat "start chopping that tree down before i add another death to your usless account peasant". He then forced me into becoming a slave and joining his already growing slave labor force. I had 2 other people helping me get wood for theses people with guns. then after we got them a couple thousand wood. they lined us up and shot us. By this point I was a lightly salted but I respawn. I go towards some trees and start to get wood I craft a few basic tools from the wood and rocks near by. then i start to get hit i turn around and there is a bear. "I can take this bear down" I think so I attack it with my spear. It kills me in 2 seconds. By this point I've moved past lightly salted and more into the salt induced coma. i ask in the chat after i respawn "does anyone want to team up?" I rappidly get a responce telling me to kill myself and respawn at the sleeping bag they've made for me. i knew it was a troll but i had nothing to lose so i killed myself. I then respawned in a walled in space with a door and no roof with 5 other people. all we had was the starting rock. then we hear "who ever survives gets to join us kill each other" then out of no where they all started to beat each other with rocks. i died again and waited the the required time before respawning in the sleeping bag. I respawn in and its night and they are all gone and sleeping. so i walk over to get my revenge and kill 2 of them in their sleep before being killed. then they destroyed my sleeping bag so i couldn't do it again. after that I still havent returned to this excuse of a game.0/10 would play "Click the respawn button every 30seconds" game again

review: Great game fun concept and difficulty is just right it's not too easy when you begin making you work to learn and understand the game further progression allows you to understand more of the mechanics of the game and learn how to speed up the process of starting.Basics for starting off Get off the beach preferably into a thicker forest a place that offers protection and gets you out of the main eye sight of looted players begin by collecting Hemp and Wood and the ocassional stone by this time you need to begin thinking about water and food I'd say hunting is your best bet however the more you feel comfortable then I'd say go ahead and walk into a gas station or supermarket. (Fair warning this one is risky) From this look on the map and try to find the best place with easy water access don't worry about food as you can always plant food or hunt either work and if worse comes to worse and you live near enough to clean drinking water just eat other humans...Simply put the game is hard however slowly becomes easier as you get better towards the game and allows you to open up a great game with friends. BUGS There are a few simple bugs that occur killing an animal on a foundation usually glitches the animal through the floor making it impossible to loot or harvest.If you purchase any skins either from the direct store or from the Market you might get the "no icon" bug where it either has no icon in your inventory or has a massive bugges icon.The game also needs some optimization increases personally I don't get many FPS realted issues I can pull just about 60fps at a stable rate but I hear and see a lot of people with the issues.Other then that the game is cleanly made and as already stated brilliant!I love the many differences between textures the attention to detail and the fact no map is the same it gives the game a load of replayability.NOTE Don't play on Community Servers unless incredibly popular most community servers wipe every 4 days due to the fact thier population drops so fast so to get it back up they wipe I'd say go for either an incredibly popular community server or join an offical.Good luck!Still going strong!

review: Rust is yet another early access gone down the drain. If you like killing and trolling rust has now joined the ranks of sooo many game developers catering to one architype player. I recently revisited rust to find many advancements (visuals / stability) but severe gameplay regression. Rather than moving forward with what rust was originally and building upon it It has gone in reverse and has become the empty shell it is today. Whether or not this is developer resources limitation or lack of vision Rust is no longer the really fun and full of potential game I originally purchased....

review: When you first buy the game your experince depends on the server you start on. I started on Offical and didn't like the game that much but i kept playing and found a server I liked which really got me into the game. I think it's an amazing game but it does have its down sides. It has a very toxic community but you can run into some really chill and nice people. All I would say to a noob is "Just keep playing don't worry about dying don't get upset if you get raided and be ready to deal with a toxic community." Rust in my opionion is better with friends or a clan. The game takes allot of time to get good at and learn recole patterns but when you do I insure you that it'll be worth your money.

review: Audience Beginner Casual Gamer Normal Gamer Expert Graphics Bad Alright Good Beautiful Fantastic Music Bad Alright Good Beautiful Fantastic Difficulty Easy Average Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard Unfair Bugs Bugs destroy the game Lots of bugs Few Bugs You can use them for speedrun Nothing encountered Story The Story is your own Path Gameplay Frustrating Sleepy Boring Fun Challenging Game time / Length Really short (0 3 hours) Short (4 8 hours) Few hours (10 20 hours) if you focus on the main story Long (40 60 hours) if you complete everything Very Long (61 100 hours) Extremely Long (101+ hours)$ Price / Quality $ Full price Wait for Sale Don't buy Refund it if you can Personal ReviewAfter 1k hours of this game and going though around 4 different resets i could say Rust is a Hardcore game and should mostly be played with friends as clans are the strongest in this game and if your not apart of one you might have it hard take it from a player who played solo for 800 hours. This is a type of game where its kill or be killed if your nice you better watch your back because over 89% of players here haven't been around since the good days of where you could walk up to sombody and say hello now adays nobody would really talk to you. This is a game when you can get drain out the first few 100rds of hours and still not even have a base down once and you might think it is a game because it is but the amount of fun it was with friends was great i am giving this a bad review because this game is made for groups and non aint social people aren't gonna make it here and its funny because you can't even go around talking to people without getting killed. I have taken time off this game and now i am comming back to this game hopefuly i am still good with a bow.

review: For people who want a quick anwser well there is no really quick anwser because everyone is different but go try it out it's performace is great and graphics are beautiful but be aware that a lot of people are really unfriendly...(Sadly it has become like this before it was a very friendly community now it's hard to find people who are just nice)And now i have played this game for a very long time i even played it cracked but i always knew that i will buy this game even if it is to support it and so i did.But the problem i have with this game is that a lot of people are very unfriendly they don't even let you build anything camp even sometimes trashtalk you...I would highly suggest to ignore those people and if you can have friends playing with you so you will have a higher chance of survival.And then there is the modded servers which are fine but it killed my motivation to play proper vanilla so if you can stay away from it unless you are just fine with playing both.And again i'm not saying that modded servers are bad it's that you get everything really fast and you just don't have any other reason to play really just pvp.And talking about PVP youtubers of rust kinda ruined it with their 'Raid Cams' everyone wanted to be like those clans and missed a very important thing it's a game and people want to have fun and not be sniped from a tower or camped at a spawn.So if you can deal with these problems you are good to go but before that i just want to say that developers are doing a great job of keeping this game alive and fresh i just hope people start changing for the better!Good luck and remmember to have fun!

review: Fun to play with friends but dont trust anyone. No one is really friendly...Edit I'm 2000+ hours in and my honest advice/opinion to anyone looking to play this amazing game is the following. You will need to have no social life. The game takes a ton of hours just to get to a point where you feel you have some sort of level playing field with large clans that basicly have 6 10 people. The blueprint grind on this game is hectic. Especially if you play solo on a heavy populated server. (Low pop servers tend to die out quick and get really boring) Watch youtube movies on how to build a proper base otherwise you get raided instantly and you're immediately discouraged from playing the game again. Best server configuration in my opinion is 2 week wipe. (and 2x resource gathering if available ) The grouping system that's been recently introduced has made the solo gameplay really difficult. So I suggest making friends in game and use the system to your advantage.Besides that the game is really fun. During your wipe you'll experience up's and down's. Killing a semi geared guy with a bow and grabing his loot will give you such a rush but minutes later you'll find yourself raided and lose all of it.Nature of the game so don't get attached to anything you make or loot.
